description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 3Four Israeli military vehicles crossed the Lebanese border today and penetrated half a mile before being forced back by Lebanese artillery, according to a Defense Miniitry communiqu.

title: Rosewall Amritraj, Ashe Wit
description: Ken Rosewall and Arthur Ashe, who know their way around, found their way, out of trouble and into the quarterfinals of the United States Open tennis championships yesterday in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: WEISS AND BROKAW ANNOUNCE MERGER
description: Weiss, Peck & Greer, a diversified Wall Street brokerage firm, announced yesterday that it would merge with Brokaw, Schaenen, Clancy & Co., a small investment management firm here with a number of bluechip corporate pension accounts.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Citibank Raising Consumer Loan Rates
description: The First National City Bank, which makes more consumer loans in the metropolitan area than any other, said yesterday that it was raising interest rates on most consumer loans.

title: Gibson's Calm Counters High Emotion in Newark
description: NEWARK, Sept. 3Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson continued to counter high emotion with calm today as he held around of meetings with his staff and with leaders of the Hispanic community to discuss ways of cooling tempers after two days of disturbances.

title: ADS ON FAULTY LIGHT RULED UNNECESSARY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI)A Federal judge ruled today that the manufacturer and distributors of a hazardous household trouble light did not haiie to buy corrective advertising because news media coverage had already done the job. The Consumer Product Safety Commission said it disagreed but would wait for 10 weeks to judge the eff^ctiveness of a recall campaign on the lights before deciding whether to appeal the court's ruling.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jerseydaily lottery number yesterdaywas:

title: LIEUT. GOV. REID WINS IN NEVADA
description: CARSON CITY, Nev. Sept. 3  Lieut. Gov, Harry Reid, 3 34yearold jogging enthusiast and political veteran, defeated Maya Miller, a 59yearold political newcomer, in today's Democratic senatorial primary contest here.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WNCN. Concerto in D for Trumpet, Horns, and Strings, L. Mozart; Fantasiestucke, Schumann; Hungarian Rhapsody No. A, Liszt; Overture to Zampa, Herold; Harpsichord Concerto in A, Seixas; Jupiter from the Planets, Hoist; Flute Concerto In G, Tartini; Le Festin d'Esope, Akan; Entrance of the Guests from Tann huser, Wagner; Overture to the Magic Flute, Mozart.

title: President's Organizer Lewis William Seidman
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3It is still dark when Bill Seidman bounds out of his house in Georgetown about 6 o'clock each morning, clad in sweat clothes, to run a mile as a tuneup for a long day's work as a top economic specialist and organizer for President Ford.

title: Greeks Said to Accept Cyprus Partition
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 3Rauf Denktash, head of the Turkish Cypriote administration, said today that Greece and the Greek Cypriote Government had privately conceded that Cyprus would be formally divided into two zones, one for the ethnic Greeks and the other for the Turkish community.

title: Lindsay Returns to Old Law Firm as Senior Partner
description: has been composing since his piano teachers dissuaded him from a career as a performer. He has written five symphonies and is working on a commemorative piece for the bicentennial.

title: Grass Era at Forest Hills Fading Amid Sea of Fans
description: Attendance records every day, new stars and old favorites slugging it out and the prospect of Chris Evert and Jimmy Connors repeating their Wimbledon triumphs have made this the most successful United States Open tennis championship. The officials, from Director Billy Talbert downward, are beaming with the conviction that they have finally found the right formula, although the tournament still has far to go to match Wimbledon's success.

title: Homeowners Facing Costlier Fuel Oil
description: Despite large inventories of heating fuel that are building up in storage tanks across the country, home fuel oil prices are about 60 per cent higher than they were a year ago and experts say that it will cost homeowners at least 10 per cent more to heat their homes this season than it did last year even if prices remain relatively stable.

title: Robbery Suspect Kills Self
description: HAMDEN, Conn., Sept. 3 (UPI)  A 21yearold robbery suspect surrounded by the police here took his own life last night rather than be captured alive, the police reported. The suspect, Leon F. Burzynski of Northford, put his weapon to his head and took his own life, the Hamden police said.

title: Former Dix M.P. Found Slain; Barracks Mate Is Questioned
description: FORT DIX, Sept. 3  The body of George Washington Dean, a military policeman who retired here Saturday after 20 Years in the Army, was found in a waterfilled ditch just south of this military reservation by Pemberton Township policemen. Authorities believe he was murdered and are questioning a barracks mate in connection with the death.

title: Leavening in Chile?
description: There are indications that Chile's military rulers may be contemplating the release of some of the thousands of persons still held for political reasons a year after the overthrow of President Salvador Allende. Nothing could do more to improve the international standing Gen. Augusto Pinochet's Government.

title: GM. EXPECTS RISE IN 1975 SPENDING
description: DETROIT, Sept. 3The General Motors Corporation said today that it expected 1975 capital spending to top this year's record $1.4billion.

title: Planner of L.I.Kidnapping Is Sentenced to 30 Years
description: NEWARK, Sept. 3The man who led a group of Cuban refugees convicted of kidnapping 5yearold John Calzadilla from his Dix Hills, LI., home last March 6 was sentenced to 30 years in prison here today by Federal Judge Herbert J. Stern.

title: Saigon Girl, 3, Sent to U.S for Surgery
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 3 When Tran Thi Ngan was born nearly three years ago her mother named her Ngan, which means thousand, because she thought the, child would bring the family a thousand good fortunes.

title: REP.CAREY ALTERS STAND ON SAMUELS
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey reversed himself yesterday and told Howard J. Samuels, his Democratic gubernatorial primary opponent, that he would endorse him should Mr. Samuels win the primary election next Tuesday.

title: Business Records
DR. ESTHER FELDBLUM
description: Dr. Esther Feldblum, a specialist in Judaic studies, died Sunday of injuries received in an automobile accident. She was 41 years old and lived at 515 West 183d Street.

title: IRVING ROEMER
description: Irving Roemer, a retired furniture merchant, died Monday at Doctors Hospital at the age of 74. He lived at 45 Sutton Place South. Until his retirement about five years ago, Mr, Roemer had operated three furniture stores under the name of Pennington Furniture Company.

title: Allegheny Ludlum Payout Up
description: Directors of Allegheny Ludlum Industries, Inc., yesterday raised the dividend on the common stock for the second time this year, with th declararation of 40 cents quarterly. Payable Sept. 30 to holders of record Sept. 13, the new common dividend represents a quarterly increase of 10 cents or 33 per cent for this year, lifting the annual rate to $1.60 a share.

title: Parks Chief Is Now Opposing New Theater for Papp Festival
description: Citing a change in priorities, Edwin L. Weisl Jr., the Parks, Recreational and Cultural Affairs Administrator, announced yesterday his opposition to the 2,500seat permanent concrete theater proposed by Joseph Papp as a replacement for the deteriorating wooden Delacorte Theater in Central Park. Mr. Papp is producer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, which presents free performances at the theater.

title: U.S.ISRAEL TALKS ON TRADE ARE SET
description: WASHINGTON; Sept, 3 (UPI)  Treasury Secretary William E. Simon announced today United States and Israeli officials would discuss bilateral trade and investment issues this week.

title: Citibank Raising Consumer Loan Rates
description: The First National City Bank, which makes more consumer loans in the metropolitan area than, any other, said yesterday that it was raising interest rates on most consumer loans.

title: $700Million Deal Signed to Construct North Sea Pipeline
description: LONDON, Sept. 3 (Reuters)  Seventeen oil companies signed an agreement today to build a $700million crude oil transportation and delivery system designed to carry at least a million barrels of oil a day onshore from the North Sea. The deadline is 1980.

title: Army Chief Abrams Dies at 59, Directed U.S. Forces in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Sept. 4Gen Creighton W. Abrams, Army Chief of Staff and former United States Commander in Vietnam, died early today of complications from lung cancer surgery, the Army announced. He was 59 years old.

title: TOP HANOI OFFICER DESCRIBED AS ILL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 3Gen. Vo Nguyen Giap' North Vietnam's master strategist, whose army defeated the French and fought the Americans to a stalemate, is reported to be gravely ill with cancer.

title: About New York
description: Tennis has always been to Forest Hills what steel is to Pittsburgh, although it is, thankfully, more seasonal. But, while steel was always a mass item, Forest Hills and tennis, several decades back, were fairly remote from the usual run of life.

title: Capital Voters to Choose Candidates for First Time in a Century
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3For the first time in more than a century, citizens of the nation's capital on Sept. 10 will take the, first step in the election of local officiate.

title: CRABIEL WILL ASK TO BE ABSOLVED
description: TRENTON, Sipt. 3Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel will ask the state courts this month to dismiss a conspiracy indictment handed up against him last July by a state grand jury here.

title: ALUMINUM INGOTS ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: The Reynolds Metal Company and the Alcan Aluminum Corporation yesterday announced they were increasing the price of 99,5 per cent primary aluminum ingot to 39 cents a pound from 36 cents, effective today. Price Prices of other Changes ingot products and selected semifab ricated products will be adjusted as appropriate, the companies reported in separate announcements.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Administration is up against a difficult problem with respect to, grains and soybeans. However, just because there is still much uncertainty, and conflicting evaluation, about prospective U.S. and world supplies in 1974/75, the Government's policy line is difficult to understand.

title: CANADIAN FOOTBALL
description: Montreal 12, Toronto 11.

title: Bulls Acquire Thurmond
description: The Chicago Bulls, who always claimed they were a center away from challenging the Milwaukee Bucks for the National Basketball Association Midwest Division title, filled that void yesterday with Nate Thurmond.

title: Tennis Results
Woman,74, Stabbed to Death
description: A 74yearold woman was found dead last night as a resuit of a stab wound of the chest with a scissors. The victim, identified as Virginia Thomas, lived in Apartment 1 at 107 West 122d Street in Harlem.

title: Gibson's Calm Counters High Emotion in Newark
description: NEWARK, Sept. 3Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson continued to counter high emotion with calm today as he held a round of meetings with his staff and with leaders of the Hispanic community to discuss ways of cooling tempers after two days of disturbances.

title: Tandy Shows 12Month Record Sales and Net Income
description: Reflecting sharp gains in the final quarter, sales and net income of the Tandy Corporation, in the fiscal year ended June 30, set records for the 11th consecutive year, the company reported yesterday from Fort Worth headquarters.

title: Tennis Results MEN'S SINGLES
description: Tennis Results MEN'S SINGLES

title: Heath Yacht Sinks, Drowning Godson
description: LONDON, Sept. 3Former Prime Minister Edward Heath's racing sloop Morning Cloud capsized and sank in a gale last night in the English Channel off the Sussex coast.

title: RIDERSHIP DOWN FOR BUS AGENCY
description: Despite expansion of its routes, the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority (MABSTOA) has had a sharp drop in ridership and last year had an operating loss of $5.6million, its first in a decade, State Controller Arthur Levitt reported yesterday.

title: Hood, America's Cup Skipper, Is Not Enamored of Courageous
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 3Ted Hood, the skipper who will defend the America's Cup starting next Tuesday, is not especially enamored of Courageous, the instrument of defense.

title: Parks Chief Is Now Opposing New Theater for Papp Festival
description: Citing a change in priorities, Edwin L. Weisl Jr., the Parks, Recreational and Cultural Affairs Administrator, announced yesterday his opposition to the 2,500seat permanent concrete theater proposed by Joseph Papp as a replacement for the deteriorating wooden Delacorte Theater in Central Park. Mr. Papp is producer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, which presents free performances at the theater.

title: Carey and Samuels ate Financial Backing
description: Quarreling over the sources of each other's support, the Democratic candidates for Governor spoke at the New York Times yesterday in a debate that is excerpted here. Reiiresentative Hugh L. Carey, a veteran of Congressional argument, was the challenger, politelybut persistentlyinterjecting objections that threw Howard J. Samuels, former head of the Offtrack Betting Corporation, off verbal stride. Mr. Samuels, animated and discursive, gesticulating as he spoke, criticized loans to the Carey campaign by the candidate's brother, an oil man. Mr. Carey, brisk and confident, gazing reflectively at the tabletop, challenged Mr. Samuels over campaign contributions from people who had done business with OTB. Each interpoldted occasional strained praise for the other, but only at the end did they hurriedly speak of how they planned to beat Malcolm Wilson, the Republican incumbent.

title: A Strike Threat and Costs Plague Nonpublic Schools
description: Amid inflationrelated rising costs, pressures for higher salaries and pinched family budgets, religious schools serving nearly threequarters of a million pupils in the metropolitan New York area and in New Jersey began opening their doors this week for a new school year.

title: EDWARD J. BYRNES
description: Edward J. Byrnes, assistant customer service manager of The New York Times, died Monday of cancer. He was 50 years old and lived at 7224 Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: United Parcel Service operations in most of the New York metropolitan area remained shut down yesterday for the sixth day of a strike by 4,500 teamsters. No settlement talks were scheduled as Local 804 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters mourned the death of an organizer Thuriday during a demonstration at the stilloperating United Parcel depot in Secaucus.

title: National Council on Arts Marks 10th Anniversary
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3The National Council on the Arts marked today the 10th anniversary of its creation and the first Congressional legislation created to support and encourage the arts.

title: Alouettes Triumph, 1211
description: TORONTO, Sept. 3 (AP) Don Sweet booted four field goals to lift the Montreal Alouettes past the Toronto Argonauts, 1211, tonight in a Canadian Football League game. Sweet's winning kick came at 9:33 of the final quarter and covered 40 yards.

title: Screen:Drug Traffickers Vie in 'Black Godfather'
description: There's been a lull in the field of black exploitation movies, but "The Black Godfather" reverts to the formula that some black leaders criticized a few years ago. The movie opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters.A clever young operator (Rod Perry) gains control of all the organized crime in his neighborhood  except narcotics. Determined to drive a powerful white drug dealer off the turf, Mr. Perry and his gang unleash a lot of bullets along with such pious statements as "The essence of our struggle is independence," and "Money buys dignitypower is a crime," or "We're sick and tired of being exploited." Compliments are exchanged among the gunmen for "protecting the brothers on the street" (by killing white pushers), and someone even says "Power to the people."The black and white hoods ice each other with unflagging enthusiasm; the whites are the most sadistic, though the blacks do enjoy the enemy's humiliation. The movie drags because so much of the action requires the characters to take messages to and from one another. The performances aren't, too bad, but the karate is negligible.

title: Merrill in Paris Venture
description: The chairmen of Merrill Lynch International and Lionel D. Edie International said yesterday that they hid entered a joint agreement with Groupe PaltielMarmont of Paris to form a new Frenchbased portfolio management concern. The new firm, called PaluelMarmont Edie S. A., will be 55 per cent held by Groupe Paluel and 45 per cent by Merrill Lynch International.

title: A Call to the Campus
description: In calling for a real partnership between the academic community and the rest of our society, President Ford has taken an important initiative toward ending an intolerable schism: The break between academia and the Federal Government, which originally developed during the Johnson Administration over the single issue of the war in Vietnam, subsequently deepened into a virulent antagonism in the Nixon years.

title: Looking Toward Summit
description: President Ford will sit down at an oval table in the White House tomorrow with 21 invited economists fcr the first of the meetings leading up to the summit conference on what is wrong with the economy and what to do abcut it. Since the ecort omists range from a selfstyled New Socialist such as John Kenneth Galbraith to Keynesian liberals such as Paul A. Samuelson, Arthur M. Okun and Walter W. Heller to Nixonian conservatives such as Paul W. McCracken, Herbert Stein and George P. Shultz, as well as an outstanding Friedmanian such I as Milton Friedman, the safest, prediction in the history of economic forecasting is that Mr. Ford is going to hear lots; of conflicting advice.

title: Fidelity Bank Plans Loan Unit
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 3 (AP)  The Fidelity Bank, with assets of $2.5billion, said today it had received approval to open a loan office in Los Angeles. It now has outofstate offices in New York City, and in England, France, Switzerland, Lebanon, Bermuda, Japan, Brazil, Mexico and Hong Kong.

title: Wallace Ross Dies at 52; Led Ad Association Here
description: Wallace A. Ross, executive director of the International Advertising Association here, died Monady at Norwalk Hospital in Connecticut. He was 52 years old and lived in Westport, Conn.

title: Hughes Tool Delays Meeting
description: The Hughes Tool Company has postponed the special stockholders meeting scheduled for today in Houston until Sept. 23. The meeting is being held to vote on the acquisition of the ByronJackson division of the BorgWarner Corporation. The action was taken in view of the Justice Department's question ing of the acquisition, a company spokesman said.

title: The Pension Reform Act: Complexities and Limitations
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3The Labor Day setting was perfect for President Ford to sign a law that in his words will probably give more benefits and rights and success in the area of labormanagement than almost anything in the history of the country. The setting was the White House rose garden, flowers in full bloom, with whitejacketed waiters serving iced tea and lemonade to the elite of industry and labor who arrived at the Executive Mansion in long black limousines.

title: FORD EY PUT OFF AMNESTY DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 President Ford may put off until next week a promised decision on conditional leniency for Vietnam war deserters and draft evaders so as to consult again with the Departments of Defense and Justice.

title: Cash Prices
description: Cash Prices

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mall Ships

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Bridge:
description: The final session of play in the International Team Trials in Washington was far from the formality that it was expected to be. The four Los Angeles stars, Paul Soloway, John Swanson, Bill Eisenberg and Eddie Kantar, held a commanding lead of 94 international match points with 32 deals remaining, but their opporients refused to lia down and die.

title: Man Dies in Gasoline Blast
description: WAREHAM, Mass., Sept. 3 (AP)One man was killed and another injured today when a 5,000gallon gasoline storage tank exploded in the yards of the deMarzio Construction Company. The police identified the dead man as Joseph deMarzio, 25 years old, ofBrockton.

title: SOUTHWEST AFRICAN TELLS OF TORTURE
description: CAPE TOWN, Sept. 3Counsel for David Meroro, chairman of the SouthWest Africa People's Organization, alleged today that his client had been tortured by the police. Mr. Meroro, 57 years old, went on trial in Windhoek on charges of being in possession of forbidden literature.

title: Rockefeller Promises to Take Steps to Resolve Any Conflicts of Interest
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller, back in New York City for the first time since his selection two weeks ago by President Ford to be Vice President, said yesterday that he would take whatever steps are necessary to resolve any possible conflicts of interest arising from his vast financial interests. Mr. Rockefeller, who re turned to his Westchester estate Saturday after a vacation at his summer place in Seal Harbor, Me., held a news conference yesterday morning in the group of West 55th Street townhouses that were his city headquarters during his years as Governor and now serve as the offices of his National Commission on Critical Choices.

title: MAYOR DALELBACK FROM A LONG REST
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 3A thinner, more subdued Mayor Richard J. Daley returned to City Hall this morning for the first time since he suffered a mild stroke on May 6.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jerseydaily lottery number yesterday was:

title: OIL COMPANIES ARE INDICTED HERE IN GASOLINE SALES
description: Indictments against seven major oil companies, charging them with criminally acting together to restrain competition in the sale of gasoline throughout the metropolitan area, have been voted by a special state grand jury.

title: Penn Central Trustees Tell Judge of Line's Cash Flow
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad told Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia yesterday that the cash flow of the carrier's nontransportation assets amounted to $92.4million last year.

title: Sioux Stories, and Other Fun for Youngsters
description: Some of the relics of the Siouk Indian's pasta war bonnet, peace pipes, tomahawks and the likewill be on display from Tuesday through Oct. 15 the Donnell Library. And there will also be a storytelling part of the program to, give those relics life.

title: Planner of L.I. Kidnapping Is Sentenced to 30 Years
description: NEWARK, Sept. 3The man who led a group of Cuban refugees convicted of kidnapping 8yearold John Calzadilla from his Dix Hills, L.1., home last March 6 was sentenced to 30 years in prison here today by Federal Judge Herbert J. Stern.and Mr. Fernandez up to 12 years. Both could be released, at the discretion of the parole board, before such terms expire.

title: Lugano: Discreet Haven for Lire
description: ROME, Sept. 3Italian is spoken widely in Lugano, a pretty, lakeside town just an hour's car drive north of Milan. The espresso coffee and pizza there are almost Neapolitan In quality, and Lugano is listeddeluxe hotels, blueribbon restaurants and allin Michelin's guidebook of Italy. Yet it is Swiss.

title: I.B.M. to Shift 956 Employes To New White Plains Building
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 3The I.B.M. Corporation said today it would move 950 employes, nearly half of them from Manhattan, into a 14story office building under construction at the center of the White Plains urban renewal area.

title: Changing the Clubwoman's Image From Flowered Hats to Serious Business
description: There was a time when the mere mention of the word clubwoman brought snickers of derision from some quarters, along with visions of flowered hats, tea and cookies, idle chatter and Canasta.

title: Court of Appeals
description: In the threeman Democratic primary for two associate judgeships of the Court of AppealsNew York State's highest courtthe choice is clear. Our strong endorsement goes to Associate Judge Harold A. Stevens, already on this bench by interim appointment of Governor Wilson early this year, and to Justice Lawrence H. Cooke, of the State Supreme Court Appellate Division, Third Department.

title: Nations Display Plastics At First Soviet Show
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 3Polymer 74, the Soviet Union's first international commercial exhibition in the field of plastics, formally opened here today as exhibitors from 19 countries sought to capitalize on the intense interest of their Soviet hosts.

title: Lucia Wilcox, Artist, 72, Dies; Overcame Blindness to Paint
description: Lucia Anavi Wilcox, an artist long active in Paris and New York, died Monday of cancer at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 72 years old.

title: 7 OIL COMPANIES ARE INDICTED HERE IN GASOLINE SALES
description: Indictments against seven's major oil companies, charging them with criminally acting together to restrain competition in the sale of gasoline throughout the metropolitan area, have been voted by a special state grand jury.

title: German Plan Proposed To Tighten Bank Curbs
description: BONN, Sept. 3 (UPI)The West German Finance Minister, Hans Apel, today proposed new measures to guarantee bank investments and control bank activities that have led to the collapse of four banks in five weeks.

title: Italians Enduring a Shortage of Pasta
description: ROME, Sept. 3A scarcity of pasta, caused by the Government's attempts to control the price of the national staple, is angering Italian housewives just as many families have returned from vacation and are bracing for what threatensto be a difficult autumn and winter.

title: Ticket Lag Threatens Giants TV Here
description: If you're counting on watching the New York Giants home football games on television again this fall, better consider other alternatives: the Giants may not sell out any of their Yale Bowl games.

title: Alleged Olivieri Payoffs Are Studied
description: The State Senate's Select Committee on Crime is investigating alleged payments by supporters of Assemblyman Antonio G. Olivieri, a candidate for the Democratic nomination for Lieutenant Governor, to a Queens Democratic state committeeman, sources close to the committee reported yesterday.

title: World Football League
description: New York, 24, Philadelphia 16. Chicago 32, Southern California 22. Birmingham 8, Florida 7. Memphis 16, Jacksonville 13, Portland 18, Detroit 7.

title: As. G. Carey, Machine Firm Aide And ForeignAid Official, Dead
description: Andrew G. Carey, a former machinery industry executive and foreignaid official, died Monday at his home on Godfrey Road, Weston, Conn. He was 75 years old.

title: Dietz Faces Test in Title Rowing Today
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, Sept. 3 (AP)Jim Dietz of the New York Athletic Club was ready to face a big challenge as he made final preparations today for the world rowing championships.

title: 2Party Economic Approach Is Ford Goal
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3In a sharp departure, President Ford has moved to make management of the economy a bipartisan policy, in much the same way that foreign affairs has traditionally been.

title: SAMUELS, CAREY REPORT DEFICITS IN PRIMARY DRIVE
description: The Democratic primary campaigns of Hugh L. Carey and Howard J. Samuels were reported yesterday to be running at substantial deficitsunusual for rival candidates in a primary campaign.

title: 1 BLACKS NAMED SCHOOL TESTERS
description: The Board of Education yesterday appointed three members to the school system's controversybeset Board of Examiners, including the first two blacks to become regular members since that body was established in 1898.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The choreography for the polonaise in the Metropolitan Opera's new production of Mussorgsky's Boris Godunov will be staged by George Balanchine. The assignment is the first at the Metropolitan for Mr. Balanchine since 1953, when he staged the American premiere of Stravinsky's The Rake's Progress.

title: Proceedings on Herstatt In U.S. May Take Years
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Sept. 4 (Reuters)  It may take two to three years before the position of the United States assets of the closed Bankhaus I.D. Herstatt have been clarified, the provisional receiver, Walter Reiss, said today.

title: The Anna Bolena of Sills
description: Donizetti's Anna Bolena, like the other Tudor Queen operas being presented this season by the New York City Opera, is one of those Janusfaced works that look both, back at, the undiluted bel canto tradition of Bellini and ahead to the heavier vocal and dramatic style of Verdi. Anna, therefore, might plausibly be produced with an emphasis in either direction without violating the music's integrity.

title: Dave Anderson
description: His office reflects Bill Virdon's personality. Nothing adorns the white cementblock walls except the large American League schedule across from his desk.

title: Needed: A U.N. Probe
description: The discovery of a mass grave in a Turkish village near Famagusta, containing more than eighty bodies civilians, including children, who were obviously executed in cold blood, is only one more reminder of the Cyprus tragedy's grim dimensions. Given the long antagonism between Greek and Turk, on Cyprus and elsewhere, excesses were inevitable and atrocities were probable on both sides, once largescale shooting erupted on the unhappy island. In fact, the Turkish Cypriotes are already charging the Greeks with two more massacres Cyprus.

title: FINANCE LEADERS PLAN A MEETINO
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The finance ministers and central bank governors of the United States and four other leading industrial countries will meet at an undisclosed place in Europe, reportedly in France, during the coming weekend.

title: Seoul Jails Defense Lawyer Who Criticized Secret Trial
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 4 (AP)A military court sentenced a lawyer to 10 years in prison today for having violated presidential decrees that forbade dissidence while he was defending clients on charges of violating the same decrees.

title: GUIDE GOING OUT
description: SWEETS The narrow, bustling streets of Little Italy are taking on an anticipatory quality these dais with the San Gennarce Feast only one week away. Arid usual, one of the focuses activity is Ferrara, perhaps the sweetest food establishment in town, where the street scene and crowds are themselves enough to recommend a visit.

title: Marginal Laws Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Federal Reserve Board announced today a technical change in bank reserve requirements, that could have a slight easing effect in the Reserve's currently very tight monetary policy.

title: Bridge Acesin Flesh if Not in Nameto Face Italians in January
description: The Aces have been North America's most successful and celebrated team for the last five years. Their recent results in national tournaments have not been as good as in the past, but their nonplaying captain, Ira Corn of Dallas, reports that a reorganized Aces team will be fighting hard for top honors in the coming months.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WNCN. Baryton Trio No. 79 in G, Haydn; Brandenburg Concerto No. 5 in F minor, Bach; Waltz in D flat, Chopin; Poem Lyric, Glazunov; Sonata No: 5 in G (K. 283), Mozart; Sonata in C minor, Handel; Damnation of Faust Dances, Berlioz; Concerto in D minor for 2 Violins, Strings, and Continuo, Vivaldi.

title: Prof. Murray Peppard, 57, Amherst German Teacher
description: Murray B. Peppard, a profesisor of German at Amherst College, who had been chief of the department of German, was found dead Tuesday of a gunshot wound at his home in Pelham, Mass.

title: A Freebie at Yonkers Unappreciated by Fans
description: YONKERS, Sept. 4It was Fan Appreciation Night at Yonkers Raceway tonight but the degree of appreciation shown by some of the 20,584spectators who went through the turnstiles free without even a furtive look behind was questionable.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Tomorrow, September 6

title: EARNS AT PEAK VOR H. J. HEINZ CO.
description: Record sales and earnings were reported yesterday by he H. J. Heinz Company for its first fiscal quarter ended July 31. R. Burt Gookin, vice chairman, said operating margins improved, principally from our ability to control fixed manufacturing and administrative costs during a period when other costs were increasing rapidly.

title: Tales of Mrs. Hoffman: From Dancing to Dogs
description: A dancing instructor (I taught the chacha to a football team), a private detective, a professional handler, the owner of a boarding kennel, chairman of a humane society, former president of the Elmira Kennel Club, a refinisher. of antiques.

title: Events Today
description: C. DE ROSA STAGE BAND, Bryant Park, 12:15.

title: District Attorney's Race
description: After becoming accustomed to decency, integrity and tempered judgment in the Manhattan District Attorney's office during the three decades of Frank Hogan's distinguished career, New Yorkers are suddenly faced with sorting out the issues in a sharply contested race for that job.

title: London Police Foil Effort to Take Stone of Scone
description: LONDON, Thursday, Sept, 5(Reuters)  An apparent attempt by Scottish nationalists to remove the Stone of Scone, the ancient Scottish coronation stone, from Westminster Abbey was foiled early this morning.

title: 2 Hurt by Argentine Bomb
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 4(Reuters) Two persons were injitred today when a bomb ripped through the home of the dean of the faculty of philosophy and letters of Buenos Aires University, police sources said.

title: Perpetual Losers in the Trading Game
description: KINGSTON, JamaicaThere is a continuing and increasingly significant world dialogue about the relationship between the rioher and peorer nations. The search for effective development strategies; the desirability of aid programs; the problem of the terms of trade; the role of the Third World in international politicsthese concerns occupy more and more attention of the world's political leaders and analysts of human affairs.

title: Poor Crops Drive Up Price of Cooking Oil 60% in Year
description: The price of cooking oil rose more than 60 per cent here in the last year, as a result of poor crop production and market uncertainties during the last three years.

title: Mrs. Ford Tells News Parley She's Busy and Happy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4I have found it is a very busy life, Betty Ford said. I'm very happy. Everyone lias ben so generous and warm.

title: C.M. Unit Recalls Workers
description: LOCKPORT, N. Y., Sept. 4(UPI)  More than 1,000 employes laid off at the Harrisor Radiator division plants of the General Motors Corporation during the energy crisis last winter have been called back to work.

title: Brewers Lose on Medich's 5Hitter
description: With cool assurance reminiscent of another era, the Yankees methodically halted the Milwaukee Brewers, 30, yesterday and by the end of the day found themselves at their highest station at this stage of the season since Oct. 1, 1964.

title: Early Limit Declines Fade on Afternoon Recovery
description: Commodities futures prices fell their limits early in trading on the Chicago Board of Trade but rallied to close mixed yesterday.

title: INFLATION IN U. S. WORRYING EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 4  Europeans are watching the antiinflation maneuvers of the Ford Administration with more than usual interest because of their worry that new policies in Washington may lead the world into a prolonged slump.

title: Business Briefs
description: ROME, Sept. 4 (AP)Italy's balance of payments was in the black for the first month in a long time in July, registering a surplus of $354.4million, according to preliminary figures released today by the Bank of Italy.

title: Mansfield Asks Close Look At Nixon Expense Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI) The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield, of Montana, said today that the $850,000sought for former President Nixon's pension and transition expenses should be looked at most carefully.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: 15Hour Rainfall Brings Floods and Blackouts
description: More rain fell on the city and its suburbs in a 15hour period that ended at 10 A.M. yesterday than normally falls here during the entire month of September.

title: Layne, Figure in Scandal, To Coach C.C.N.Y.'s Five
description: Floyd Layne, a star who rose and fell at City College, is returning 23 years later as the Beavers basketball coach.

title: CHRYSLER WEIGHS 8% PRICE INCREASE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 4Eugene A. Cafiero, group vice, president of the North American operations of the Chrysler Corporation, said today that they company was considering raising the price of its average 1975 car by about 8 per cent, or $400.

title: Suspect Herd in Kidnapping Of Mexican Chief's Kinsman
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Thee police were holding a suspect today in the kidnapping of 83yearold Joso Guadalupe Zuno Hernandez, fatherinlaw of President Luis Echeverria Alvarez.

title: Aussies Spy on Cup Rival
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 4In the dark of night two members of the. Australian entourage seeking the America's Cup stole aboard Courageous, the United States defender, to have a look at her deck layout. From that inspection on Monday night the Australians have questioned the ability of Courageous to pass the stiff construction rules governing the International 12Meter class to which the defender and the Challenger, Southern Cross, belong.

title: 11 More Seized in Newark, Most on Looting Charges
description: NEWARK, Sept. 4The police arrested 11 more persons here today, most of them for looting, as representatives of the city's Spanishspeaking community continued to try to cool tempers, and Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and Joseph P. Lordi, the Essex County Prosecutor, jointly announced a broad investigation into the causes and aftermath of three days of civil unrest.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Third Battle of Gettysburg

title: RUSSIANS ARREST AILING JEW IN BED
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4A prominent Jewishmovement activist, suffering from a heart condition, was dragged from his bed by policemen early this morning and arrested on grounds that he refused to work, his wife charged today.

title: The Classroom Seemed Dull, So Parents Turned Creative
description: SOUTH SALEM, N. Y., Sept. 4In the housekeeping corner of the Lewisboro elementary school kindergarten, Katharine Gill, who wore a red dress and a Band Aid on her chin, ran into an old friend) Todd Prybylski, on the first day of school.

title: Chessa  Kavalek Loses Heartbreaker  Quinteros Wins in Canaries
description: The second Torneo Internacional de Ajedrez in Lanzarote, Grand Canary Islands, resulted in another triumph for Miguel Quinteros. The Argentine grandmaster took first prize with six victories and four draws despite a smashing fifthround defeat by Silvino Garcia, a Cuban international master.

title: Flyers Sued by Former Goalie
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 4 (AP)The Stanley Cup champion Philadelphia Flyers have been sued for a million dollars by a former goalie, Michel Belhumeur, who charged they failed to pay him $23,500 in playoff dividends.

title: Inflation Issue Stressed in Arkansas Race
description: FAYETTEVILLE, ArkWhat does a Democratic Congressional candidate do when his best issue, the Nixon scandal, is shot out from under him?

title: MOZAMBIQUE TALKS WILL BE HELD TODAY
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 4(AP)Portugal's Foreign Minister and leaders of the Mozambique rebels will meet here tomorrow to arrange independence for the territory in southeast Africa.

title: Steelworkers Reject Offer
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 4 (UPI) Steelworkers at the United tates Steel Corporation's Clairon coke works here unaninously rejected two contract offers that the company said vould have increased wages ind vastly improved working onditions. The vote of 512to0vill send the contract dispute nto arbitration, according to names Fiore, president of Local 557 of the United SteelworkIs of America.

title: GREECE FLEXIBLE ON CYPRUS STATUS
description: ATHENS, Sept. 4Greece would be willing to discuss federated Cyprus, divided into two geographical regions, at peace talks, an authoritative Government source said today.

title: Player Dies on Court
description: ROANNE, France, Sept. 4(AP)  Philippe Prost, 18yearold member of the French national junior basketball team, died last night during a game here. His death was attributed to a heart attack.

title: Bill Beutel Is Named Host Of ABCTV AM America
description: Bill Beutel, a coanchorman on WABCTV's local Eyewitness News, has been selected to be host of the ABCTV network's new morning show, AM America, which will have its premiere early next year.

title: Judge Jails Two Officials In Wife's Salary Dispute
description: NOBLESVILLE, Ind., Sept. 4(AP) Three Hamilton County commissioners have been jailed briefly by a judge who was angry because his wife had not been paid two weeks salary as a court reporter.

title: OUSTER OF BLACK BLOCKED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Ford Administration has narrowly avoided a crisis with the black leadership on Capitol Hill by blocking at the last minute an effort to force the resignation of Barbara M. Watson, the State Department's highestranking black official.

title: Notes on People U. S. Land Off Limits to Knievel
description: Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton has denied the use of Federal land to Evel Knievel, who was hoping to use a patch of it as a landing strip when he attempts to vault the Snake River Canyon on Sunday in a rocketpropelled motorcycle.

title: China Ties Reported Going Well
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4The naming today of George Bush to fill the top American diplomatic job in Peking comes at time when Secretary of State Kissinger is reported to be satisfied with the development of United StatesChina relations.

title: Iowa Woman to Be Named To Head Republican Party
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford named Mary Louise Smith today as his choice for chairman of the Republican National Committee.

title: Strolling in Park, Through 12 Triangles
description: Twelve painted WalkThoughTriangles, described variously, as tents, threedimensional triangles and true prisms, went on exhibition yesterday at noon at the Fort in Battery Park. The display, composed of original works by members of New York Professional Women Artists. is sponsored by the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council.

title: L. I. School Budget Voted
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Sept. 5 Voters in the Herricks School District approved today a school budget of $14,130,479 by a vote of 2,561 to 2,241. The revised budget will carry a tax rate of $16.12 for each $100 of assessed valuation, an increase of 85 cents over last year.

title: Iowa Woman to Be Named To Head Republican Party
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford named Mary Louise Smith today as his choice for chairman of the Republican National Committee.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Swiftle the Magician, by Herbert Gold (McGrawHill, $6.95). A television film maker of the nineteensixties and three women in his life.

title: Nassau Man Sought in Slaying Of Father and Estranged Wife
description: MINEOLA, L. I., (UPI) Sept. 4Nassau County police issued an alarm today for 37yearold John Burks, a Freeport bartender, who was named as a suspact in the shotgun slayings liest night of his father and his estranged wife.

title: Campbell, End, Will Join Stars
description: Carter Campbell, a defensive end, has obtained an early release from the Cleveland Browns of the National Football League in time to join the New York Stars of the World Football League this weekend, exactly halfway through the Stars season.

title: Giants End Their Gamble on Glover
description: The New York Giants gamble on Rich Glover ended yesterday, when the former Nebraska AllAmerica was cut, along with another college superstar,. Torn Gatewood, and a World Football League signee, John Douglas.

title: Fraud Inquiry Opened On Mrs. Papadopoulos
description: ATHENS, Sept. 4 (UN)Despina Papadopoulos, wife of the ousted dictator George Papadopoulos, is the first person associated with the military junta, now collapsed, to be prosecuted for illegal activities during her husband's sevenyear rule.

title: Envoy to Seoul Sworn In
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP) Richard L. Sneider, a career diplomat, was sworn in today as United States ambassador to South Korea. He succeeds Philip C. Habib, who has been named Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and Pacific Affairs.

title: INDIANS APPROVE A CLOSER SIKKIM
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4India's lower house of Parliament overwhelmingly approved today Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's decision to place Sikkim, the small Himalayan protectorate, under Indian sovereignty.

title: Prices on the Stock Market Plummet As the Pace of Trading Accelerates
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday for the second consecutive session in steppedup trading although a late technical recovery trimmed some of the earlier losses.

title: Arbitrator Cancels Shift Of Firemen After Strike
description: The Fire Department has been ordered to return personnel transferred after last November's firemen's strike to their original companies.

title: Legislative Choices
description: Next Tuesday's primary ballot will feature a profusion of contests for nomination to the State Legislature, mostly among Democrats in this city where the Democratic nomination often is tantamount to election. We recommend the following in pivotal contests:

title: FORD NAMES BUSH AS ENVOY TO CHINA TO SUCCEED BRUCE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 President Ford today named George Bush, the Republican National Chairman, to be the United States, envoy to China as he announced his first major changes in key diplomatic, political and economic posts.

title: Levy Defends Goldman Role on Pennsy
description: Gustave L. Levy, senior partner of Goldman, Sachs & Co., insisted yesterday that the investment firm bore no responsibility in its sales of commercial paper of the Penn Central Transportation Company from August, 1968, to April, 1970. Mr. Levy said that the firm, in maintaining its defense, had acted as a dealer and not as an underwriter.

title: Anita O'Day Tries New Kind of Setting At Reno Sweeney's
description: Both Reno Sweeney, the West 13th Street supper club, and Anita O'Day, the singer, are trying something new this week. Reno Sweeney is dipping a tentative toe into jazz programing for the first time with a bill comprising Miss O'Day and Hugh Brodie, a saxophonist and singer, while Miss O'Day Is moving out of her customary jazzclub setting.

title: TESTIMONY FINISHED IN TRIA LOF 2 INDIANS
description: ST. PAUL, Sept. 4 Testimony ended today in the Wounded Knee Indian trial, which began Jan. 7.

title: Quasar Emissions Used in a Quake Prediction Study
description: Radio emissions from objects billions of light years away are being used in an effort to recordin fractions of an inchthe kind of warping of the California landscape that is believed to precede major earthquakes.

title: Sindona, Big Franklin Holder, Reported Selling a Bank in Italy
description: ROME, Sept. 4Michele Sindona, the Italian financier who holds a 22 per cent interest in the troubled Franklin National Bank, has sold the Banca Generale di Credito, the Corriere della Sera of Milan reported today. The batik is the latest element to be removed from Mr. Sindona's financial empire, which two months ago was thought to be worth between $400million and $450million.

title: OIL FLOW LAGGING IN ARABIAN LINES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 4Pumping in the two pipelines that carry Saudi and Iraqi crude oil to the Lebanese Mediterranean coast is reported to have dropped to about 40 per cent of the pipeline's capacity in the last seven weeks.

title: Optimistic Trade Forecasts Usher in Chicago's Machine Tool Show
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 4Secretary, of Commerce Frederick B. Dent said today that he expects Congress to pass a favorable trade bill this year, to approve mostfavorednation status for the Soviet Union before its planned adjournment in midOctober and to grant the ExportImport Bank a new charter this month.

title: NORWAY TO BEGIN SOVIET OIL TALKS
description: STAVANGER, Norway, Sept. 4 Norway and the Soviet Union are to begin talks in October on dividing up the offshore waters north of Norway for oil exploration.

title: Sports Today
description: Cowboys vs. Pittsburgh Steelers, preseason, at Dallas. (Television  Channel 4, 9 P.M.)Sharks vs. Philadelphia Bell, at Jacksonville, Fla. (Television Channel 9, 9 P.M.)

title: Classes End Early as East Meadow Teachers Strike
description: EAST MEADOW, L. 1., Sept. 4The first day of school ended early for the teenagers of East Meadow todayabout half an hour after it began.

title: 3 Seeking 2d Spot On Democratic Line In Amicable Debate
description: Two of the three candidates for the Democratic norranation for Lieutenant Governor answered a broad range of questions last night from members of the National Organization for Women and guests at candidates night at Jimmy's restaurant in Manhattan.

title: INQUIRY PRESSED ON ROCKEFELLER
description: A spokesman for Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A, Rockefeller estimated yesterday that there were in the neighborhood of 400 F.B.I. agents investigating Mr. Rockefeller as part of the detailed scrutiny of his past that embraces his health, his fortune and his acadeinic record at Dartmouth College.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: Clark Asks Arms to Israel; Hypocritical, Says Rival
description: Ramsey Clark yesterday urged a United States policy of economic aid plus invincible armament for Israel. in Vietnam and now was speaking as an apostle of might in a vain attempt to win votes among Jewish voters.

title: ALBERT BOLLENGIER OF W. R. GRACE & CO.
description: Albert E. Bollengier, vice president and controller of W. R. Grace & Co., Inc., died Tuesday evening, apparently of heart attack, at his home in Larchmont, N. Y. He was 61years old.

title: Broken AxHandle
description: The defeat of Lester Maddox in the runoff election for the Democratic nomination for Governor of Georgia by George Busbee, the moderate majority leader of the State House of Representatives, marks continuation of a healthy political trend in the South. It also seems to end one of that section's ugliest and most ludicrous political careers.

title: People and Business
description: Andrew F. Brimmer, who resigned after eight and a half years as a member of the board of governors of the Federal Reserve System, will be nominated as a director of E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc. Irving S. Shapiro, chairman of the board, announced yesterday. The Wilmingtonbased chemical company's board is expected to elect him at its next meeting on Sept. 16. Mr. Brimmer, who is 48 years of age, will be the first black director on the du Pont board.

title: ASHLAND OIL UNIT SUED BY THE F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission announced today that it had sued an Ashland Oil Company subsidiary for $420,000 over alleged violation of a 1964 commission order.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 4 (AP)Chuck Wepner retained his American heavyweight title with an 11 thround technical knockout of Terry Hinke of Hayward, Calif., last night in the Salt Palace. Wepner knocked Hinke down three times in the 11th round of the 12round bout before the referee called the fight.

title: Israelis Say Troops Thwarted Guerrilla Plot to Free Detained Archbiship
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 4The Israeli Army reported today that it had thwarted an Arab terrorist plot to free the Most Rev. Hilarion Capucci, Greek Catholic Archbishop of East Jerusalem, who is in an Israeli jail awaithr trial on charges involvingbthe smuggling of weapms to Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Northwest Raises Dividend
description: Northwest Industries, Inc., announced in Chicago yesterday that it was raising its quarterly dividend on its common stock to 30 cents from 21 cents, an increase of 41per cent. The dividend is payable Oct. 1 to stockbrokers of record Sept. 13.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Yonkers Raceway Results

title: HIJCKING FAILS ASSUSPECT YIELDS
description: BOSTON, Sept. 4A young man who menaced an Eastern Airlines pilot with a razor, a rusty nail and an ax surrendered meekly today after a tense fourhour hijacking attempt on a runway at Logan International Airport here.

title: Consumer Notes
description: While there are many new regulations affecting the lebeling of foods, there is still no foolproof path to knowledgeable buying of canned fruits and vegetables. Although the labels for almost all of these foods list the net weight, this is very little help in knowing how much product is actually in the can.

title: Moyers, Reasoner Share Emmy Awards for News
description: Bill Moyers and Harry Reasner won 1974 Emmy Awards last night as outstanding television news broadcasters.

title: 11 More Seized, Most Alleged Looters, As Newark Studies Cause of Unrest
description: NEWARK, Sept. 4The police arrested 11 more persons here today, most of them for looting, as representatives of the city's Spanishspeaking community continued to try to cool tempers and Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and Joseph P. Lordi, the Essex County Prosecutor, jointly announced a broad investigation into the causes and aftermath of three days of civil unrest.

title: Player Dies on Court
description: ROANNE, France, Sept. 4(AP)  Philippe Prost, 18yearold member of the French national junior basketball team, died last night during a game here. His death was attributed to a heart attack.

title: ARAMS POST SEEN GOING TO WPM
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Gen. Fred C. Weyand, the last commander of American forces in South Vietnam, is expected to assume the burden of rebuilding a postVietnam Army from Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the Army Chief of Staff, who died early this morning.

title: VENEZUELA TO LIFT INCOME TAX ON OIL
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 4 (UPI) Venezuela apparently has dropped plans to increase its oil prices but will increase income taxes charged United States and other foreign oil companies, Government sources said today.

title: Rock Island Line Will Sell Locomotives to Stinnes Unit
description: The Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific Railroad said yesterday it had an agreement to sell 80of its 20yearold diesel locomotives to a subsidiary here of, Hugo Stinnes, A. G., the West; German machine tool maker.

title: Arbitrator Cancels Shift Of Firemen After Strike
description: The Fire Department has been ordered to return personnel transferred after last November's firemen's strike to their original companies.

title: LEGISLATORS GET WOMEN'S RATINGS
description: Calling the 197374 session of the State Legislature a major disappointment for the cause, of women's rights, the New York Women's Lobby yesterday issued ratings for all incumbent legislators, including an 18member honor roll and a 29member dishonor roll.

title: Edward Carey, Brother's Chief Backer, Called Rich, Rich Man
description: Edward M. Carey, the man who has financed a substantial portion of the gubernatbrial primary campaign of Representative Hugh L. Carey, his brother, has built a sizable business for himself in the last 27 years, one that has, earned him the nicknitine of the oil baron of New York City.

title: Newark Hispanics Seek Greater Representation
description: NEWARK, Sept. 4These riots are the best thing that could have happened to us, a member of the Hispanic Emergency Council said today. The council is working with Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson on ways of preventing a continuation of the rioting and looting that has gone on for three days in the Puerto Rican community here.

title: FORD PAYRISE PLAN SCORED IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI) light intensified today over President Ford's proposal to defer a raise for 3.5 million Federal workers as part of the battle against inflation.

title: ECONOMISTS OPEN INFLATION TALKS IN CAPITAL TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Twentyone economists, representing almost the entire spectrum of economic opinion, will meet here tomorrow in the first of a series of White House conferences on inflation, and there were indications that they might approach unanimity on at least some issues.

title: seven Indicted for Murder In Prison Escape Attempt
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex., Sept. 4(UPI)A Walker County grand jury today indicted seven persons on capital murder charges in the attempted escape of three inmates, from the Huntsville State Penitentiary and the death of a woman hostage.

title: Gomez Again Lifts Pitcher in NoHitter
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 4 (UPI)Preston Gomez did it again. For the second time in five seasons, Gomez, the manager of the Houston Astros, removed a pitcher working on a nohitter but trailing by a run when he replaced Don Wilson with a pinchhitter in the eighth inning against the Cincinnati Reds tonight.

title: Ford, a Convert, Pays Tribute To Arts Council and Sees Play
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (AP) President and Mrs. Ford received a standing ovation tonight as they stood spotlighted in the Presidential box while attending a musical at the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A barracks mate of George Washington Dean, a recently retired military policeman whose body was found in a waterfilled ditch south of Fort Dix, was charged with murder in a complaint filed in Federal District Court in Trenton. The suspect, Kenneth Harold Woodson, who retired from the Army last Saturday, was accused of murdering Mr. Dean in Mr. Woodson's apartment in the M.P. barracks in which the two men lived at Fort Dix.

title: Stulcer, Off Peculiarly, Wins Astarita at Belmont
description: Things broke a little awkwardly for the Jaclyn Stable's Stulcer at the start of the $28,400 Astarita at Belmont Park yesterday. The filly was first out of the gate according to the charts, At the but she went up Race in the air according to her jocTracks key, Angel Cordero.

title: Currency Sales Cited
description: The Federal. Reserve sold the equivalent of nearly $100million of West German marks, Belgian francs and Dutch guilders during June and July to prop up the value of the dollar, the Federal. Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday in its semiannual summary of its activity in the foreignexchange market.

title: Food an Obsession in MiseryRidden Calcutta
description: CALCUTTA, India  This is a hungry city. It is a place where thousands survive each day on a slice of bread or a howl of rice, a potato or a scrap of garbage.

title: Expecting Miracles
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4When President Ford introduced the new chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers to his Cabinet, virtually the first words out of Alan Greenspan's mouth were, Don't expect miracles.

title: Tropical Storm Dissipates
description: MIAMI, Sept. 4 (AP)The tropical storm Dolly skirted the northeast coast of the United States and then lost its punch In the cold waters of the North Atlantic tonight, the. National Hurricane Center said.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: DOWN

title: A Bundle of Economic Dilemmas
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 4As leading economists gathered here for the first of President Ford's presummit conferences tomorrow, they were largely agreed on at least one thing:

title: SHOP TALK
description: Jerry Brown has moved his imported fabrics uptown from Hester Street to a site more convenient for his clientele, many of whom patronize such places as Henri Bendel and Bergdorf Goodman. The elegant new shop at 37 West 57th Street, with its crystal chandeliers and French Provincial chairs, is the kind of place to sit down and be waited on, though Mr, Brown doesn't mind a bit if customers investigate his stock on their own.

title: So Where Are Bob Hope and the Government?
description: Two summers ago the Susquehanna River catapulted over manmade barriers and lashed the old mining town of WilkesBarre, Pa., until its residents were gasping.

title: Press Strike in Portugal
description: LISBON, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Lisbon and Oporto were without newspapers today as journalists and technical workers staged a 24hour walkout in support of a twoweek strike at the economic daily, Journal do Comercio.

title: Fort Lee Bribe Case Defendant Asks Judge Lacey to Step Aside
description: NEWARK, Sept 4Joseph Diaco, one of two men charged with attempting to bribe the Mayor of Fort Lee last May, today asked Federal Judge Frederick B. Lacey to disqualify himself from presiding over his trial.

title: Beame Plan Would Split H.R.A. Into 2 Departments
description: The most controversial of the city's superagencies, the ofteninvestigated Human Resources Administration, would be split in two under a proposal made public yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: Air Accident Investigator Quits In Dispute Over Role of Politics
description: Charleq O. Miller, the Federal Government's senior aircraft accident investigator, resigned yesterday and said that steps by the White House to tighten control over his agency, the Natibnal Transportation Safety Board, had disrupted efforts to improve safety in air transPortation.

title: Gunman in Holdup Is Killed By an OffDuty Patrolman
description: An offduty patrolman shot and killed a suspected holdup man in an exchange of fire last night.

title: Connors, Miss Goolagong File Suit
description: PARIS, Sept. 4 (AP)Jimmy Connors of the United States and Evonne Goolagong of Australia have sued the French Lawn Tennis Federation for $200,000 damages apiece because they were banned from the French open championship in June. There was no indication of a hearing date for the suit, which was filed by attorneys in Paris.

title: Woman Inmate Found at Guard's Home
description: EASTON, Pa., Sept. 4One of two furloughed women inmates who had failed to return to the Clinton Farms Reformatory in Hunterdon County was found hiding late yesterday in a closet in the home here of female corrections officer at the reformatory.

title: Harvard Physician indicted
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 4 (AP) Dr. Louis C. Brown, an associate physician with the Harvard University health service, was indicted yesterday for income tax evasion, according to the United States Attorney's office in Atlanta. Dr. Brown, a former member of the Atlanta Medical Association, owes the Government $34,000 in taxes, according to the indictment.

title: Scientists Seek to Breed a Super Plant to Guarantee Food Supply
description: EL BATAN, Mexico Plant breeders have long dreamed of combining the most desirable characteristics from a variety of agricultural crons into a single super plant that could resist insects, survive droughts and still produce large yields of highly nutritious food.

title: CYPRIOTE REGIME SEIZING WEAPONS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 4President Glafkos Clerides said today that his Government had confiscated hundreds of weapons from illegally armed Greek Cypriotes in recent days.

title: GLENMEDE WEIGHS DOW MERGER DEAL
description: The Glenmede Trust Company of Philadelphia, trustee of a majority interest in the General Crude Oil Company, is having second thoughts about voting, its shares in favor of a takeover of the oil company by the Dow Chemical Company Dow said yesterday that it had been advised by attorneys of Glenmede that they would advise the Glenmede board that it was entitled to withdraw from the contract that comitted Glenmede to the Dow tender offer of Aug. 13.

title: Rome: La Scoria, Literary Sensation
description: ROMEMaybe it is the new gasoline price that makes pleasure driving prohibitively expensive, or maybe it's the new fiscal austerity turning minds to nonmaterial valuesat any rate, Italians are reading more than they have been in a long time.

description: MEN'S EVENTS WOMEN'S EVENTS

title: Stulcer, Off Peculiarly, Wins Astarita at Belmont
description: Things broke a little awkwardly for the Jaclyn Stable's Stulcer at the start of the $28,400 Astarita at Belmont Park yesterday. The filly was first out of the gate according to the charts, the but she went up in the air according to her jockey, Angel Cordero.

title: Swiss Initiate Action In Lloyds Bank Loss
description: BERN, Switzerland, Sept. 4(Reuters)The public prosecutor's Department of Tessin has started proceedings against the persons accused of being responsible for the foreign exchange loss sustained by the Lloyds Bank international branch in Lugano, Switzerland, the Swiss Federal Banking Commission said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 4 (AP)Chuck Wenner, retained his American heavyweight title with an 11thround technical knockout of Terry Hinke of Hayward, last night in the Salt Palace. Wepner knocked Hinke down three times in the 11th round of the 12round bout before the referee called the fight.

title: Heath Yacht Search Ends
description: BRIGHTON, England, Sept, (Reuters)The coast guard has abandoned an air and sea search for the missing crewman of former Prime Minister Edward Heath's yacht, Morning Cloud. The boat capsized in the English Channel yesterday. The body of another crewman was recovered yesterday. Five crew members survived.

title: INFLATION IN U. S. WORRYING EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 4  Europeans are watching the antiinflation maneuvers of the Ford Administration with more than usual interest because of their worry that new policies in Washington may lead the world into, a prolonged slump.

title: Layne, Figure in Scandal, To Coach C.C.N.Y.'s Five
description: Floyd Layne, a star who rose and fell at City College, is returning 23 years later as the Beavers basketball coach.

title: The Markets Are Full of Tomatoes Now, So Get Out Those Jars
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I.  Random thoughts for the end of summer: Who steals my storebought tomatoes steals trash; who steals my handprocessed tomatoes steals gold.

title: U.S. and East Germany Open Ties and Name Envoys
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 4The United States established formal diplomatic relations with East Germany today, the last major Western country to do so since the Communist country emerged from relative international isolation three years ago.

title: School Construction Workers Continue Strike
description: Members of Local 3 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters have not returned to work although a Federal judge ordered them on Friday to end their twomonthold strike on public school Construction sites.

title: HENRY SALTIWAN, 65, LED ROOSEVELT HIGH
description: Henry Saltman, principal for the last five years of Theodore Roosevelt High School, 500East Fordham Road, the Bronx, died yesterday at Mount Vernon (N.Y.) Hospital. He suffered a heart attack last Friday. Mr. Saltman was 65 years old and lived at 36 Columbia Place in Mount Vernon.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Sept. 5, 1974GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism 10:30 A.M. Committee on Relations With Host Country3 P.M.

title: Tor Sale Sign Goes Up At Upstate College Campus
description: GROTON, N.Y., Sept. 4 (AP)  Interested in buying a rural, college campus?

title: Wallace Ross Dies at 52; Led Ad Association Here
description: Wallace A. Ross, executive director of the International Advertising Association here, died Monady at Norwalk Hospital in Connecticut. He was 52years old and lived in Westport, Conn.

title: U.S. Eight Wins Heat From E. Germans
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, Sept. 4The United States heavyweight eight scored the most stunning upset in the preliminary heats as the world rowing championships opened today on Lake Rotsee.

title: Personal Finance
description: A survey of interest to young prople looking for for office workers in the New York area are in computers that the highestpaying jobs career opportunities shows on the other hand, are as The bestpaying plant jobs, auto mechanics, machinists and truck drivers.

title: Japan Dominant In Asian Games
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 4(AP)South Korea's ChoOYuen broke Japan's swimming monopoly and North Korean marksmen and weight lifters won six gold medals today in the Asian Games. But the Japanese maintained their overall lead by 17 gold medals after three days.

title: The Screen:' Murdered House' Has Grisly Inhabitants" The Cast
description: If you have a soft spot for ruined grandeur, for romantic decay, you'll be captivated by the opening shots of "The Murdered House," a Brazilian movie that is playing today and tomorrow at the First Avenue Screening Room. The picture focuses on an elegant family ravaged with debts; their mansion is falling to piecesand so (on a grand scale) are they.The movie, which is intensely operatic, begins well; two members of this oppressive tribe detest the entire clan and are eager to humiliate it. One is a defiant transvestite, who says that he's possessed by the soul of his dead aunt, and the other is the beautiful, restless wife of one of the glum sons. (Norma Bengellwho bears a stunning resemblance to Jeanne Moreau  brings strength and subtlety to a complex part.) Although the Brazilian director, Paulo Cesar Saraceni, has studied with Bernardo Bertolucci and Marco Bellochio; his extrav-vagent personas seems more akin to those of Federico Fellini.About halfway through the movieafter a botched suicide and a successful onethe narrative suddenly jumps 17 years and becomes thoroughly confusing. The characters haven't aged at all (although some of them have grown quite crazy). There's some incest afoot, butdue to the fact that a baby or two were born off camerait's terribly hard to tell which mother is making out with whose son, and who did or didn't sleep with the gardener.However, the most impassioned couple hits the sack in such a public spot that their relatives needn't miss a single motion. (Despite the lack of privacy, this scene is extraordinarily, erotic.) But much of the acting declines into gusts of bitter laughter and stagey declamations, as hatred becomes the motivation for almost everything. Two characters rend their clothes in rapid succession, acorpse gets its face slappedfinally, we're in a realm beyond tragedy or lunacy, and the emotions have become too exotic to follow.The photography is magnificent throughout: the browns, blacks, and whites of the landscape simmer in contrast to the lush green gardens, and there's a daring shot of a lifeless body that recalls Mantegna's foreshortned view of the dead Christ. Although the movie doesn't fulfill the promise of its first scenes, let's hope that more of Mr. Saraceni's films are shown in this country.

title: Oregon Curbs Noise Levels

title: New President of NOW Prepares Message for Another New President

title: 200 Years Ago: a Mix of Ideals and Economics
description: It was 200 years ago yesterday that the First Continental Congress convened in Philadelphia to discuss mutual problems concerning the British colonies. The 56delegates of the 12 colonies (Georgia was not represented but sent her best regards) were not thinking of revolution. None of them would have been mad enough to have thought that about half a year later the colonies would be at war with England. But they did have grievances, and they did want redress of those grievances, and they helped set in motion a chain of events that nobody could have foreseen.

title: Bridge:
description: A player who opens the bidding in a minor suit and hears his partner respond in a major often has a choice between rebidding his suit and supporting partner with a threecard holding.
