description: While Robert M. Morgenthau and Richard H. Kuh have been accusing each other of a poor record on civil liberties, some civil libertarians here are saying that on such issues a choice between the two contenders for Manhattan District Attorney is a choice between the lesser of two evils.

title: HARRY MUCH, 73, A COMPOSER, DEAD
description: Harry Partch, a free spirit among American composers who invented his own musical scales and his own outlandish instruments, was found dead Tuesday in his apartment in San Diego, Calif. He was 73years old. The coroner's office said he had suffered a heart attack.

title: STATE AUDIT FINDS WIDE OVERBILLING BY NURSING HOMES
description: State auditors going over sampling of nursinghome accounts have reported $4,623,288 in unwarranted claims to Medicaid. These ran the gamut from the debatable to the apparently fraudulent, and from the petty to the exorbitant.

title: Strike Is Begun in Lisbon By All 17 Foreign Airlines
description: LISBON, Friday, Sept. 6 (AP) Employes of all 17 foreign airlines operating to and from Lisbon began a strike early today aimed at cutting almost all the country's air links with the outside world.

title: Cash Prices
description: Cash Prices

title: Smokey Bear May Co Back to Forest at Death
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5(UPI)Congress declared today that it wants Smokey Bear sent home when he dies.

title: U.S. Official Warns Of Ozone Depletion From Nuclear War
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency said today that a nuclear war could destroy the ozone layer in the stratosphere, which protects all living things from the sun's ultraviolet radiation.

title: General Electric Layoff Set
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Sept. 5(Reuters)  The General Electric Company announced today it would lay off 1,500 workers at its Louisville, Ky., major appliance plant.

title: Notes on People
description: With commentators praising the golfer's form, Spanish television showed film of Generalissimo Francisco Franco on the links. It was reported that the 81yearold Spanish leader, who was listed as near death from blood clots two months ago, played two rounds of nine holes in the last two days, walking a total of 2 miles. His golf scores were not reported. He is expected to preside at a Cabinet session today.

title: Youth Sentenced Here In Killing of Professor
description: Daniel Mingues Jr., 17years old, was sentenced yesterday by Supreme Court Justice Joseph A. Martinis to an indeterminate sentence in the September, 1972, mugging murder of Prof. Wolfgang Friedmann of Columbia Uni versity, an internationallaw specialist.

title: F.E.A.ASKS CHANGE IN OILPRICE RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The Federal Energy Administration proposed today technical changes in its petroleum pricecontrol rules that it said look toward eventual decontrol of petroleum prices.

title: Shipping/ Mails
description: Today, Sept. 6

title: U.S SOUNDING OUT ALLIES ABOUT HAIG AS CHIEF OF NATO
description: BONN, Sept. 5The United States has sounded out its 14NATO allies in Brussels on the naming of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. as supreme commander of the alliance and of United States forces in Europe, according to German and American officials here.

title: DodgersReds Sold Out
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. (AP)The threegame series this weekend between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Red at Cincinnati is a sellout, making it the first time in National League history that a threegame set was sola out in advance, a league spokesman said today.

title: Mr. Ford's Diplomats
description: In his first batch of major diplomatic assignments, President Ford has made respectable but hardly inspired choices. He has shown a tendency to go outside the career Foreign Service for, new ambassadors, a tendency that will be more pronounced if he proceeds with his expected nomination of Senator J. William Fulbright Ambassador to Britain and Peter M. Flanigan, former White House adviser on international economic affairs, as Ambassador to Spain.

title: EAGLETON ASSAILS TURKEY ARMS AID
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Senator Thomas F. Eagleton said today that President Ford was being deliberately kept uninformed by his foreign affairs advisers of a legal obligation to cut off military aid to Turkey.

title: PREMIER CHOSEN IN NEW ZEALAND
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Friday, Sept. 6Wallace Edward Rowling was chosen today as the next Prime Minister of New Zealand to succeed Norman E. Kirk, who died last Saturday.

title: MORGENTHAU, KAU FAULTED ON RIGHTS
description: History Scorned

title: Ford Seeks a Battle Plan Against Enemy, Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 President Ford, facing growing political pressure to deal quickly with the nation's economic problems, opened the first meeting of his conference on inflation today with an appeal for action that is practical, possible and as rapid in its effect as we can reasonably expect.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Detroit Tigers, twilightnight doubleheader, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 5:30 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 5:30 P.M.)Mets vs. Cardinals, at St. Louis. (Television  Channel 9, 8:30P.M.)(RadioWHN, 8:30 P.M.)

title: MARGARET ALLEN
description: Margaret Flannery Allen, who with her husband, Harrison H, Allen, who died in 1963, had operated the Allen Travel Service, died at Doctors Hospital on Wednesday evening. She lived at 222 East 50th Street.

title: Democrats Predict Defeat Of Byrne's Bond Proposal
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5Democratic legislative leaders disclosed here today that the Byrne administration's proposal for a $300million bond issue for highway construction and railroads in New Jersey faced the prospect of defeat when the Legislature was to reconvene here Monday.

title: Anderson, Clayton Dividend
description: Anderson, Clayton & Co. announced yesterday in Houston that it was raising its quarterly dividend on its common stock to 25 cents from 20 cents. The dividend is payable Oct. 15 to stockholders of record Sept. 20.

title: Major League Baseball and Standings
description: Major League Baseball and Standings

title: Music: Kindred Spirits'
description: A pianist who wishes to give three recitals of standard 19thcentury repertory evidently feels it necessary these days to bind the programs together with a theme of some sort. Elizabeth Rich began a three  recital series devoted to Schubert, Schumann and Brahms at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night, using as mucilage a quotation from $chumann:

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WNCN. Quartet in G for Harpsichord, Flute, Viola and Cello, C.P.E. Bach; Die Perle von Iberien, Hellmesberger; Norfolk Rhapsody No. 1 in E minor, Vaughan Williams; Dance of the. Water Nymphs, Catalani; Prelude to The Afternoon of a Faun, Debussy; Cordoba, Albeniz.

title: U.S. Official Warns Of Ozone Depletion From Nuclear War
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency said today that a nuclear war could destroy the ozone layer in the stratosphere, which protects all li'ing things from the sun's ultraviolet radiation.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Pan Am, T.W.A. Ready to Talk Merger
description: Pan American World Airways and Trans World Airlines, both financially hard pressed, said yesterday that they were ready to, discuss a merger.

title: Anaconda Company Plans Copper Complex in Utah
description: The Anaconda Company disclosed here yesterday that it planned to spend more than $135million to develop a major new copper mining and concentrating complex in Utah.

title: Peru's Seized Press Shows New Freedom
description: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 5 They've taken the press away from the dominant class to give it to the people and that's good, but what's bad is that there will be no more criticism of the Government, says a 37yearold mineworker who moved to a Lima slum to find a better job.

title: British Football
description: FM Run, Third Replay

title: Knicks and Chamberlain Said to Be in Negotiations
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5Wilt Chamberlain has been negotiating with the New York Knicks, through intermediaries, and although no agreement has been concluded, it is still possible that the 38yearold giant center May resume his playing carper with them this season.

title: Worker Killed in Blast
description: OXNARD, Calif., Sept 5(UPDAn explosion caused by a gas leak rocked an oceanfront building yesterday. A Southern California Gas Company foreman in the process of evacuating residents from the area of the leak was killed and five other persons were hurt. Killed was Harold Bangs, 41 years old, of Ventura.

title: 7 Major Oil Concerns Deny Curbing Competition Here
description: Seven major oil companiesTexaco, Shell, Exxon, Gulf, Sunoco, Amoco and Mobilpleaded not guilty yesterday as indictments were formally presented charging them with criminal violations of the state's antitrust laws. They were accused of restraining competition from independent gasoline dealers in the metropolitan area.

title: Contract Awards
description: Contracts for the sale of 37 million pounds of uranium oxide to the Duke Power Company, of Charlotte, N.C., and the Tennessee Valley Authority, of Chattanooga, Tenn., has been signed by Rio Algom Mines, Ltd., of Toronto. The selling price was not disclosed but the current cost of uranium oxide is between $12 to $13 a pound. This would indicate the value now of the two contracts at between $444million and $481million. The sales contracts are subject to Canadian Government approval.

title: At the Machine Tool Show: The Russians Are Here
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5  I'm, happy to see that American buyers are thinking internationally and that the old buy American attitude is disappearing, Hans Rudiger, a West Germah machine tool manufacturer said today at the 1974International Machine Tool Show.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
Surging Yanks Stir Old LoveHate Feelings in Fans
description: New York baseball fans reacted with a mixture love, hate and indifference yesterday to the novelty of having the Yankees in first place.

title: Advertising: Temblor at Doyle
description: There were sweeping management changes at Doyle Dane Berribach yesterday.

title: Rent Is a Primary Issue for Coop City
description: Along the park benches in Coop City, where Carey and Samuels shopping bags form ranks like attache cases on a commuter railroad, the voters dont knows. are running high this year.

title: Curly Hogg, 57, an Original Son of the Pioneers, Dead
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Sept. 5(AP)Jack Curly Hogg, one of the original Sons of the Pioneerssinging group, who played in many films with Roy Rogers and Gene Autry, died yesterday at the age of 57, apparently of a heart attack.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS Sept. 5, 1974
description: N. J. Weekly162603

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The rehabilitation of mandatory wageprice controls is urgent, for we cannot stop inflation without them.

title: Chung Family Playsand Tries to StayTogether
description: The two sisters and a brother who make up the Chung Trio, a violincellopiano ensemble, love to be together not only for professional reasons but also because as Koreans they have a, strong family feeling. Yet, wile their individual New York apartments are near one another in the Lincoln Center area, these days they find it hard to be in the same place at the same time.

title: Chow's Condition Said to Have Worsened
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey said in Peking last night that a high Chinese official had informed a visiting United States Congressional delegation that the condition of Chou Enlai, China's 76yearold Premier, had worsened since midsummer.

title: News Summary and Index
description: News Summary and Index

title: There Are Three Types of Inflation
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.Three decades of experience tell us that inflation is endemic to modern democratic industrial societies. Fortunately the same record indicates that these economies are nonetheless capable of yielding their citizens substantial gains in wellbeing decade after decade. But hysteria about inflation may lead to policies that keep economic progress well below its potential.

title: 2 Games Reset
description: The Yankees announced yesterday that scheduled home afternoon games against Baltimore on Sept. 18and Boston on Sept. 25 had been switched to night games.

title: Must We Follow the Leader?
description: By Tom Wicker

title: Florida Seeking to Break Condominium Lease Plan
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 5The state of Florida filed charges today against one of its biggest condominium developers in an effort to break controversial recreation leases that cost consumers millions of dollars a year.

title: Radio Shows Planned To Deal With Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5(UPI)Virginia Knauer, President Ford's consumer affairs adviser, announced today that her office would produce a series of public service radio shows designed to help Americans deal with inflation.

title: Nadjari Investigates Goldman
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, has opened his own investigation of Irving Goldman, the city's Commissioner of Cultural Affairs. The inquiry involves reported discrepancies in accounts given by Mr. Goldman and, others to city investigators, looking into Mr. Goldman's business history.

title: Eagles Blame Strike On Projected Loss
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5(AP)The National Football League player strike was blamed by the Philadelphia Eagles today for a projected $200,000 loss in six preseason games this year.

title: CITY OPERA RENDERS MIKADO WITH STYLE
description: Flexibility is one of the special and nice attributes of the New York City Opera. It is as much at home in the mythical town of Titipu as in Elizabethan England or lgthcentury Seville. On Wednesday night, its singers were romping through the patter songs of The Mikado as knowingly as they had trilled the Donizetti arias of Anna Selena the night before.

title: Deposit Outflow Rises At Franklin National
description: The Franklin National Bank lost $35million in deposits in the week ended Wednesday, figures released by the New York Clearing House Association disclosed yesterday.

title: Utilities Loans Spur Upturn at Banks Here
description: Business loan demand, bolstered again by heavy borrowing by gas and electric utilities, increased sharply at major New York banks in the week ended Wednesday, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: HUNGER A THREAT IN INDIAN DROUGHT
description: LUCKNOW, India, Sept. 3One of the worst droughts in years has struck northern India.

title: Maltese Falcon Is Stolen
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5 (UPI)  The Maltese falcon that kept Humphrey Bogart, Sydney, Greenstreet and Peter Lorre, scurrying through 90 minutes of movie thrills in 1941 was stolen today from the Los An geles County Museum of Art. The 18inch statue was on loan from Warner Bros for a show of film memorabilia. It is valued at $200.

title: 1774 Convention Reconvened in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept, 5Some things never change.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: CHICAGO GRAINS LIVE BEEF CATTLE Open Interest

title: FORD SAID TO PICK 2 FOR ENVOY POSD
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5President Ford intends to appoint Peter M. Flanigan, a prominent figure in the Nixon Administration, as Ambassador to Spain, and he has offered Senator J.W. Fulbright the Ambassadorship in London, an authoritative Administration official said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: Born in Paris in 1910, Jean Genet wrote his first novel while serving one of several prison sentences for stealing, begging and smuggling. In 1948, he was condemned to life imprisonment but was pardoned by the President of the Republic when a group of France's most eminent writers interceded in his behalf. After reading Querelle, his latest novel to be translated, feel that they made a mistake. But then the mistakes of eminent French writers are no less famous than they themselves.

title: Gilliam's Aerials Help Steelers Rout Cowboys
description: DALLAS, Sept. 5 (AP)Joe Gilliam, making a bid to unseat TerryBradshaw as Pittsbnrgh's No. 1 quarterback, threw two touchdown passes tonight to spur the Steelers to a 4115 National Football League victory over the Dallas Cowboys.

title: Money
description: INTERNATIONAL ARBITRAGE LONDON MONEY MARKET

title: Newark Storm Signals
description: Rain and a cool Mayor appear to have damped down the fire this time in Newark, that perennial crucible of urban misery. But this week's Hispanic echo of Newark's devastating 1967 black riots should serve as a warning to city and state officials everywhere and to Washingtonthat the nation's urban ghettoes once mote may be approaching a flashpoint of frustration.

title: Decision Withheld in Gym Exam SexBias Case.
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5 (AP)A State Department of Education hearing examiner withheld judgment today on a challenge to the policy of the South River Board of Education to require written physicaleducation tests for high school girls but not boys.

title: Korvette's Parent Company Seeking Six Klein Stores
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission announced today receipt of an application from the company that owns the KoFvette's department store chain to acquire six S. Klein department stores in the New York City area.

title: EHRLICHMAN MOVE IS REJECTED AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 John D. Ehrlichman's request that the Watergate coverup trial be postponed until sometime next year was denied today by Associate Justice William o. Douglas of the Supreme Court.

title: People to Sports
description: Times have changed for Steve Blass. He is now a nontoster player, a spectator in uniform laboring with Don Osborn, the Pittsburgh Pirates pitching coach, before each game to correct a control problem that led to 93 bases on halls in 56 2/3innings of minor league pitching this season. Whether Blass pitches again for Pittsburgh, where two seasons ago he was the Pirates most effective pitcher, may depend On how he responds to some eye training techniques.

title: British Economy Facing Uphill Fight
description: LONDON, Sept. 1The Sicily of the North Sea or the Pakistan of Europeas the British have been referring to their island of lateis sinking into her deepest postwar recession against a background of apprehension, despondency and resignation.

title: Pop: Suzi and Company
description: Wednesday night was a night for opening acts on the local rock n roll front, and more particularly opening acts from Britain: the first New York appearance of Bad Company, at the Schaefer Music Festival in Central Park, and Suzi Quatro's third New York performance at the Felt Forum.

title: Jesuits Accused of Bid to Oust A Priest Defiant Over Baptis
description: A group of lay Catholics vesterday accused the Jesuit leadership here of attemoting to oust without a hearing a local priest who baptized the baby of a Massachusetts mother who supported the rinht of women to decide on abortion.

title: Advance in City 13.5%
description: New York department stores chalked up sizable dollar gains in August, a survey of The New York Times showed yesterday. Stores in the city proper increased their sates by 13.5 per cent from August, 1973, while stores in the metropolitan area as a whole went ahead by 8.4per cent.

title: Prices Marked Up in Credit Markets
description: Prices of Treasury, municipal and corporate debt issues were marked up yesterday as the credit market enjoyed an easing in the cost of money.

title: Puerto Rican Clubbed at Time of Newark Clash Dies
description: NEWARK, Sept. 5A Puerto Rican man died today at Martland Hospital of a massive skull fracture suffered Monday at about the time club wilding policemen were clearing Puerto Rican demonstrators from in front of City Hall and chasing them down Broad Street.

title: COMPANY CHIEFS PAY ROSE SHARPLY IN 73
description: Compensation of corporate chief executives took the biggest jump in five years in 1973, as profits grew by the biggest percentages in 20 years, McKinsey & Co., management consultants, reported yesterday.

title: Greek Minister Tours Western Europe
description: ATHENS, Sept. 5Foreign Minister George Mavros began a tour of Western Europe today, hoping to attract political and economic support for the civilian Government that took power in Greece six weeks ago.

title: Glenmede Trust Co. to Accept An Offer by International Paper
description: The Glenmede Trust Company of Philadelphia announced yestgrday that its directors had decided to withdraw approval of the proposed merger of the General Crude Oil Company and the Dow Chemical Company and to accept the higher offer of the International Paper Company instead.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER GAIN
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market rose yesterday as investors displayed optimism because of a number of announcements believed to be bullish. These included a lowering by the Federal Reserve Board of the amount of money that banks are required to hold in reserve against some large certificates of deposit and a report of higher expenditures for plant and equipment by industry in the second quarter.

title: 5 Share Japan Golf Lead
description: NARASHINO, Japan, Sept. 5 (AP)Masashi (Jumbo) Ozaki of Japan, Walter Godfrey of New Zealand, Hsu Shengsan of Taiwan, and two other Japanese each fired sixunder par 66's today to tie for the firstround lead in the $82,508 Suntory open golf tournament.

title: Defense Cuts Urged in Poll
description: LANSING, Mich., Sept. 5(UPI)  The majority of voters polled in President Ford's old Congressional distriet believe the Federal Government should cut defense spending, a studentsponsored research group said today. The report also said that 72 per cent of the 281voters selected at random in Michigan's Fifth Congressional District mentioned inflation and the economy as the most important problems facing the nation. The poll was conducted throughout last month.

title: Take Off Tops Field For Arlington Race
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5 (AP)Mrs. Ada L. Rice's 5yearold Take Off heads a field of 13thoroughbreds named yesterday for the $100,000 added Arlington Handicap Saturday.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 5 (UPI)The dollar advanced on a broad front today, decisively recovering from its midweek setback and reaching highs for the week in Paris, Amsterdam and Milan.

title: $873Million Pact For Natural Gas Canceled on Coast
description: Cancellation of an $873million naturalgas supply contract between the Pacific Interstate Transmission Company of Los Angeles and the PanAlberta Gas, Ltd., of Canada was announced yesterday.

title: Export Market Doubles Price of Rice in the U.S.
description: The price of rice has doubled in the last year, despite record high domestic production last season, because severe shortages in importing countries have made the export market more lucrative, according to market experts.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 6, 1974
description: International German and American officials in Bonn said that the United States had sought the reaction of its 14 NATO allies to the possible appointment of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. as supreme commander of the alliance. Bonn, according to a West German Government source, has no objection. The Dutch, however, are reported trying to organize opposition to the appointment[1:5.]

title: Greenspan Sees No Cause For Extreme Pessimism
description: Alan Greenspan, the new chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, said today that he foresaw a flattened economy in the months ahead, with some increase in unemployment, but saw no reason for extreme pessimism about the economic outlook.

title: Borzov Hopes to Regain Top Form for Olympics
description: ROME, Sept. 5  After nearly two years in, semiretirement, Valery Borzov is once again a serious contender for the title of world's fastest human, which he held after winning the 100meter and 200meter dashes at the Olympic Games in Munich in 1972.

title: Skeleton Is Unearthed in Well; Thought to Be That of Mobster
description: HAMILTON TOWNSHIP, Sept. 5A state police team today unearthed a skeleton here that they speculated was the remains of a minor figure in organizedcrime operations in the state several, years ago. @The skeleton was found at the bottom of a well in a quiet residential area of, this South Jersey town of 6,445 persons. Its discovery followed by one week the unearthing of the remains of Judy Schelle of Lodi in a shallow grave in West Milford Township in Passaic County.

title: REBUFFED IN SOVIET, GRAIN EXPERTS BACK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5A group of Agriculture Department experts was called home from the Soviet Union last week because the Russians refused to approve a requested visit to survey major grain areas.

title: Greek Cypriotes Counter Turks With Charge of Mass Murder
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 5 The Greek Cypriote Government charged today that at least 130 ethnic Greeks had been murdered in cold blood by Turks in the recent fighting on Cyprus.

title: MEETINGS BEGIN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Leading economists of widely differing philosophies approached unanimity today in concluding that the time had come for the Federal Reserve Board to ease its relentlessly tough monetary policy, affecting money, credit, interest rates and, indirectly, the stock market.

title: Clean Air Issue in Hearing on West Side Highway
description: A hearing on plans for a new West Side Highway prcived to be a debate yesterday between cleanair'' advocates opposed to building an interstate super road and labor groups who favor the interstate and the jobs it would provide.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: For Voters in Coop City, Rent Is a Primary Issue
description: Along the park benches in Coop City where Carey and Samuels shopping bags form ranks like attach cases on a commuter railroad, the voters don't knows are running high this year.

title: U.S. Aid to Fight Rape in City Explored; Programs Would Be Models for Nation
description: Officials of the Law Enforcement Assistance Administration met with Mayor Beame yesterday to explore the possibility of their providing Federal funds to develop programs aimed at preventing rape and improving the treatment of rape victims here.

title: People in Sports ExAce of Pirate Staff Roots From the Dugout
description: Times have changed for Steve Blass. He is now a nonroster player, a spectator in uniform laboring with Don Osborn, the Pittsburgh Pirates pitching coach, before each game to correct a Control problem that led to 93 bases on balls in 56 2/3innings of minor league pitching this season. Whether Blass pitches again for Pittsburgh, where two seasons ago he was the Pirates most effective pitcher, may depend On how he responds to some eye training techniques.

title: 3 More Held in Kidnapping Of Mexican Chief's Kinsman
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 5(Reuters)The police have arrested three more men in the kidnapping of the 83yearold fatherinlaw of President Luis Echeverrfa Alvarez

title: Britain's Prime Minister Opens Election Campaign
description: BRIGHTON, England, Sept. 5Prime Minister Harold Wilson opened hiS campaign for the general election expected next month with a plea for British unity in place of the divisions that have been so conspicuous here over the last year.

title: Rivals for Governor Get Small Crowds
description: Pointing up what many politicians believe is extreme voter apathy, Howard J. Samuels and Representative Hugh L. Carkr, drew Small and unresponsive audiences yesterday to what were billed as major noontime rallies in the garment center and downtown Brooklyn just five days before the Democratic gubernatorial primary.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: Hubbell Robinson, TV Executive Active in CBS Prozraminz, Dies
description: Hubbell Robinson, a broadcasting figure for 30 years and a former vice president of programs for CBSTV, died Wednesday of lung cancer. He was 68 years old and lived at 525 Park Avenue.

title: Commodity Price Index Fell 5.7 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 230.6from 236.3 last week.

title: NIEETINGS BEGIN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Leading economists of widely differing philosophies approached unanimity today in concluding that the time had come for the Federal Reserve Board to ease its relentlessly tough monetary, policy, affecting money, credit, interest rates and, indirectly, the stock market.

title: Bakery in Paterson Sues in New York On School Contract
description: A Paterson, N. J., bakery that was the lowest bidder for contract to supply bread and rolls to New York City public schools sued yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan to compel the Board of Education to accept its offer.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: HOHOKUS, Sept, 5Dr. Gerald Dederick was having a poor golf round with some friends recently at Arcola, his home club, and someone in the foursome said, You're still in the operating room, doctor.

title: A Test Finds Public Less Honest Than Police
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association released yesterday the results of an integrity test that is said showed that the public was less honest than the police.

title: 7 Major Oil Concerns Deny Curbing Competition Here
description: Seven major oil companiesTexco, Shell, Exxon, Gulf Sunoco, Amoco and Mobilpleaded not guilty yesterday as indictments were formally presented charging them with criminal violations of the state's antitrust laws. They were accused of restraining competition from independent gasoline dealers in the metropolitan area.

title: O.A.S. Said to Set Vote To Lift Cuba Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6(UPI)  Western Hemisphere Foreign Ministers reportedly will be called to meet in Ecuador on Nov. 11 to vote on litfing diplomatic and economic sanctions imposed on Cuba 10 years ago.

title: Waldheim Sees the World In Crisis of Helplessness
description: Secretary General Warned of the United Nations warned yesterday that profound economic and social problems were threatening the world with crisis of extraordinary dimensions.

title: Ford Seeks a Battle Plan Against Enermy, Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 President Ford, facing growing political pressure to deal quickly with the nation's economic problems, opened the first meeting of his conference on inflation today with an appeal for action that is practical, possible and as rapid in its effect as we can reasonably expect.

title: ADM. GORDON ROWE
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 5 (AP)Rear Adm. Gordon Rowe, a pioneer in naval aviation, died Tuesday at tie age of 78.

title: H.E.W. CALLED LAX ON DESEGREGATION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The civil rights of hundreds of thousands of children are being violated because the Government has failed to desegregate schools in the Northern and Western states, a private study group concluded today after a threeyear study.

title: VOLUNTEER FORCE FOR ISRAEL URGED
description: A proposal that United States citizens be permitted to fight for Israel without risking loss of citizenship was made yesterday by Abraham Hirschfeld as he campaigned in Yiddish and English on the sidewalks of the diamond district.

title: WNCN Would Help Put Fine Music on Another Station
description: The Starr Broadcasting Group made public yesterday a plan under which the classicalmusic programing of its radio station WNCNFM could be continued on another station.

title: DEAL ON JACOBSEN OPPOSED BY TEXAS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Sept. 5Attorney General John L. Hill of Texas filed today an amicus curiae brief in United States District Court in Dallas opposing the dismissal of Federal charges against Jake Jacobsen, the Austin lawyer, in transactions involving the First Savings and Loan Association of San Angelo.

title: 71 WAR PROTESTERS CLEARED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) A Federal judge has ordered the police here to remove the arrest records of thousands of persons detained during a 1971antiwar demonstration and also to refund any bail money.

title: Extradition Request Denied
description: SPRINGFIELD, 11 Sept. 5(UPI)Gov. Daniel Walker refused today to send Albert Meredith, a convicted murderer, back to South Carolina on the ground that he has lived a model life in Illinois since escaping from prison in 1947. Mr. Meredith, who is 59 years old, began life anew in Chicago as Frank Brown, hiding his true identity until he was arrested last April 30 on a concealed weapons charge. The charge was dropped, but Gov. John C. West of South Carolina sought to extradite him.

title: Waldheim Sees the World In Crisis of Helplessness
description: ?? the range or control of any single nation or group, but he held out the hope that the United Nations could rise to meet their challenge.

title: CAMBODIA RECALLS ENVOY IN SAIGON
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Sept. 5 (UPI)  President Lon Nol recalled his Ambassador to Saigon today and convened an emergency Cabinet meeting in the dispute over an AmericanFrench oil concession off the southwest coast of Cambodia.

title: Catherine Cahill Becomes Bride
description: Catherine Grace Cahill and William Lehman Bernhard were married here yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride's uncle and aunt, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph V. Heffernan. Acting Justice Mary Johnson Lowe of the State Supreme Court performed the ceremony.

title: VICE CRACKDOWN AIMS AT HOTELS
description: Operators of four Manhdttan hotels allegedly used by prostitutes and their customers Were arrested yesterday and charged with a variety of criminal charges including promoting prostitution and maintaining a nuisance.

title: People and Business
description: The nation's bankers were counseled yesterday by a member of the Federal Reserve Board to slow their expansion and concentrate on strengthening their financial basis. In a speech in Salt Lake City, Robert C. Holland said that bankers have a heavy responsibility to avoid actions that would result in weakening the public's confidence in our banking system, particularly in difficult times like these.

title: U.S. and Soviet Will Renew Nuclear Talks in 2 Weeks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) After a sixmonth recess, the United. States and the Soviet Union will renew their talks on limitations of strategic nuclear weapons in two weeks, officials said today. The date will be announced by the White House tomorrow.

title: Miss Borinstein Wed To Raymond Cohen
description: Rosann Borinstein, daughter of Wilfred R. Borinstein of Indianapolis, was married in Yonkers yesterday to Raymond Cohen, son of Mrs. Harry Cohen of Brooklyn and the late Mr. Judge Albert E. Geeson of the Justice Court of Yonkers performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: TV: News Emmy Show Proves a Mess
description: As an even geared to bestow prestige and perhaps even a touch of dignity on television journalism, the Emmy Awards for News and Documentaries was a mess, both on camera and behind the scenes.

title: Germany Explains A $2Billion Offer Of Money to Italy
description: BONN, Sept. 5 (Reuters)The West German offer of a $2billion loan to Italy was not unique and was meant to demonstrate that Bonn approved of and supported the Italian Government's new economic policy, Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said in a television interview.

title: Goldman Investigated
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, has begun an investigation of Irving Goldman, the city's Commissioner of Cultural Affairs. Page 31.

title: Blues Reported Plentiful For Weekend Fishermen
description: AREA ABlues up to 15pounds have been a good catch near Shrewsbury Rocks with bunkers, smelt and herring getting the best results. In the same waters squid and smelt have been used to haul in fluke averaging about 10pounds. A few striped bass measuring a bit less than two feet in length are reported at Long Beach Island. Bigger stripers are running at Midway Beach and Seaside Park. At Island Beach, small blues are turning out after dark. In the southern end of Barnegat Bay, fishermen have been making nice catches of weakfish.

title: Greenspan Sees No Cause For Extreme Pessimism
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Alan Greenspan, the new chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers; said today that he foresaw a flattened economy in the months ahead, with some increase in unemployment, but saw no reason for extreme pessimism about the economic outlook.

title: Upping the Rent
description: The botch that, Goveor Wilson and the Republicandominated Legislature made of abolishing vacancy decontrol when they revised the rentcontrol laws last May is having its inevitable carryover in unfairness to tenants in New York City apartments now back under stabilization.

title: World Football League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Deaths
description: LLENMargaret (nee, Flannery). Beloved wife of the late Lt. Cmdr. Harrison Allen, USNR, Dear sister, of William attannery, dear aunt of Nancy Gambino. President of the Allen Travel, Service, Inc., 565 5th Ave., N.Y. 10017. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave. at 81st St., Saturday and Sututay, 2.5 and 7.19P.M. Service Monday, 10:30 A.M. Interment Long Island National Cemetary. ARELilian Major, Sept. 2, 1974. Wife of Geoffrey, Harford, Ct., formerly of Huntington, L.I. at the home of daughter, Clad Bare, Gillett St., Hartford, gave her body to science, Smith College graduate.

title: Exit Sikkim
description: The principle of sanctity of states, large and small a principle imbedded in the United Nations Charter and long championed by India among othershas been rudely violated by New Delhi's decision virtually to annex her tiny Himalayan protectorate, Sikkim.

title: Queens Candidate Says He Got A Check for Voting for Olivieri
description: A Queens Democratic state committeeman said last night that he had given the State Senate's Select Committee on Crime a sworn statement that he had received a $1,500 check from an official of the Olivieri campaign last June, in return for his vote for Antonio G. Olivieri for the Democratic endorsement for Lieutenant. Governor at the state committee meeting.

title: Ford Is Firm for an Amendment To Let States Act on Abortions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5President Ford continues to favor a constitutional amendment permitting the states to enact legislation on abortion, his spokesman said today.

title: Eastman Kodak Expanding
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 5 (UPI)The Eastman Ko'ak Company's Arkansas Eastman subsidiary will build a $30million plant at Batesville, Ark., to make hydorquinine and organic intermediate chemicals. The plant will employ 200 persons when finished and about 500 persons during construction. Hydroquinine is used in making photographic and certain other chemicals.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of White House Conference on Problem of Inflation
description: ?? ever had the economy heading for a middling recession, and what we as forecasters to make our forecasts come truehope for is that you will concern yourself both with the employment objective and the price objective, take the middleoftheroadish kind of policy and let us go through another mild recession which is sort of inevitable. And a year or two later the economy would be back to some kind of normal. Thank you.

title: Dining: Exasperating Service
description: In the interest of trying to look a skinny 17 again, I have been attending a gym class three times a week since my last birthday. But on a recent Thursday morning I skipped the hour of sweat and strain for which I was scheduled because I had had dinner the night before at Barbetta's. I was all tuckered out, having built up more muscle in an evening of wigwagging for service at this restaurant than my gym instructor had been able to manage for me through more conventional calisthenics over a period of months.

title: Queens Candidate Says He Got A Check for Voting for Olivieri
description: A Queens Democratic state committeeman said last night that he had given the State Senate's Select Committee on Crime a sworn statement that he had received a $1,500 check from an official of the Olivieri campaign last June, in return for his vote for Antonio G. Olivieri for the Democratic endorsement for Lieutenant Governor at the state conunittee meeting.

title: Layne Glad For His Call Back Home
description: In his old gymnasium, once the home of the country's champions but now a place with crumbling walls, Floyd Layne returned to City College yesterday as the seventh coach in its 70year basketball history.

title: ARCHBISHOP LOSES APPEALS IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 5An Israeli court ruled today that the Greek Catholic Archbishop of East Jerusalem must remain in jail until charges involving the smuggling of weapons to Palestinian guerrillas have been resolved.

title: Elizabeth Courtney Dead; Dressmaker for Film Stars
description: HOLLYWOOD, Sept. 5 (UPI)  Elizabeth Courtney, a dressmaker to film stars for more than 40 years, died yesterday of cancer. She was 69 years old.

title: Protesters Assail 'Filthy Textbooks In West Virginia
description: CHARLESTON, W, Va., Sept. 5 (UPI)  Hundreds of coal miners, ignoring orders from their leaders, stayed off their jobs today and joined protesters demanding the removal of rotten, filthy textbooks from area schools.

title: French Union Asks Occupation of Liner As Talks Collapse
description: PARIS, Sept. 5The French maritime union tonight dialled on its members to occupy the liner France if the Government did not rescind its decision to take the ship out of service next October.

title: Tanner Upsets Smith
description: Ken Rosewall said: I don't think Vijay realized I was in a hurry.

title: Red Sox Lose 7th in Row, Leave Yanks at Top Alone
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP)Gorman Thomas's tworun nurner in the ninth inning tonight gave the Milwaukee Brewers a 43 victory over Boston and knocked the reeling Red Sox out of first place in the American League East.

title: 4 U.S. Crews Advance to Semifinals
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, Sept. 5  American crews qualified in the repechages today in four of five events for the semifinals of the world rowing championship. With those that qualified yesterday included the eightoared boat, the United States oarsmen have spots in 10 of Saturday's 11 semifinal races.

title: Bernstein Captivates Tokyo Audience
description: TOKYO, Sept. 5Leonard Bernstein and the New York Philharmonic captivated an audience here last night.

title: GEORGE H. OWEN, 62, OF FOREIGN SERVICE
description: George Hodges Owen, a retired Foreign Service officer, died Tuesday at his home in Washington. He was 62 years old.

title: Wings Name DeJordy
description: DETROIT, Sept. 5 (UPI)Denis DeJordy retired as an active goalie today and joined the Detroit Red Wings of the National Hockey League as an assistant coach, specifically to tutor their young goaltenders. DeJordy, 35years old, played in 316N.H.L. games during his 15year pro career.

title: Rivals for Governor Get Small Crolvds
description: Pointing up what many politicians believe is extreme voter apathy, Howard J. Samuels and Representative Hugh L. Carey drew small and unresponsive audiences yesterday to what were billed as major noontime rallies in the garment center and downtown Brooklyn just five days before the Democratic gubernatorial primary.

title: BELL WINS ROUND ON RATE
description: NEWARK, Sept. 5  The Board of Public Utility Commissioners rejected today a demand by the State's Public Advocate that the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company s request for a $155million rate increase be dismissed.

title: U.S. SOUNDING OUT ALLIES ABOUT HAIG As CHIEF OF NATO
description: BONN, Sept. 5The United States has sounded but its 14NATO allies in Brussels on the naming of Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. as supreme commander of the alliance and of United States forces in Europe, according to German and American officials here.

title: F'roxmire Citing Failures, Asks Study of U.S.Soviet Space Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Senator William Proxmire has urged serious reexamination of plans for a joint United StatesSoviet manned space flight next year in view of repeated failures in the Soviet program.

title: AUTO SALES SHOW AUGUST REBORE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 5Sales of new cars, down by 20 per cent or more all year, regained some of the lost ground in August although domestic dealers stil reported deliveries were off 2.6per cent for the month.

title: GOING OUT
description: HIT AND MYTH We are all subject to myths, by Jove, but now the Museum of Modern Art is doing something about it. That institution is the host this fall of an exhibition of 20 prints, 18 illustrated books and and 2sculptures called Gods, Heroes and Shepherds, in which you'll be able to see how some contemporary artists chose to interpret Gre

title: Examination in Pi racy Case
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)A courtappointed psychiatrist began today an examination of a 20yearold Providence man who held, an Eastern Airlines pilot as hostage for three and a half hours yesterday in the cockpit of a DC9 at Logan International Airport. Marshall Collins, accused of air piracy, is being held in lieu of $250,000bail.

title: Viennese Protesting Use of City As Center for Emigrating Jews
description: VIENNA, Sept. 5A Red Cross center that provides transit facilities for Sovier Jews emigrating to Israel has been moved from a rural Iocation to al building in Viennato the immediate outcry or residents who say it is a se curity risk to the neighborhood.

description: Britain is sinking into her deepest postwar recession against a background of apprehension, despondency and resignation. Details on Page 45.

title: Report Shows Rise of 6% In Seven Serious Criirles in Year
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 5 (AP) Serious crimes rose 6 per cent in the United States last year, with the biggest increases in suburbs and rural areas, the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported today.

title: BEAME IS ABSOLVED IN HOSPITALS AUDIT
description: Dr. John L. S. Holloman Jr., president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, said yesterday that Mayor Beame was not responsible for the delays in the audit negotiations between the corporation and the city's voluntary hospitals.

title: Stocks Gain Sharply
description: The stock market made its biggest advance yesterday in almost a month although trading was light Some favorable economic developments helped push the Dow Jones industrial average up 22.76 points. Page 43.

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 5 (Reuters)The British Army last night handed back control of street lighting in the border village of Newry to local electricity officials, at the demand of the Irish Republican Army, the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland announced.

title: Courageous Approved by Measurers
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 5Courageous received a goodboatmaking seal of approval today from an international jury and will defend the America,'s Cup without modification against the Australian challenger, Southern Cross, beginning on Tuesday.

description: LOTTERY NUMBERS Sept. 5, 1974

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Budget Director Retiring Oct: 1The retirement, effective Oct. 1, of State Budget Director Walter Wechsler after 35 years of stategovernment service was announced by Governor Byrne. He said Mr. Wechsler's knowledge and experience would be missed., The Governor did not name a successor to the $42,500ayear job, but there has been speculation about Deputy State Treasurer Clifford Goldman. As budget director, Mr. Wechsler, who will be 61 years old this month, also holds the title of State Controller.

title: Cypriote Foes in an Enclave of Amity
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 5The two units of young soldiersone Greek Cypriote, the other Turkish Cypriote face each other in official hostility across the ceasefire line that divides this capital.

title: 1774 Convention Reconvened in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5Some things never change.

title: Who's To Blame?
description: By James Reston

title: Florida Seeking to Break Condominium Lease Plan
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 5The state of Florida filed charges today against one of its biggest condominium developers in an effort to break controversial recreation leases that cost consumers millions of dollars a year.

title: Libya and Brazil Sign Pact
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 5(UPI) The Libyan Government and Brazil's Petrobras company signed an oil productionsharing agreement today under which the Brazilian company pledged to spend $35million on exploration over the next five years.

title: Union Chief Reelected
description: Arthur. L. Harckham has been reelected president of the Service Employes. Local 32B for an additional three years. The local represents 45,000 service employes in commercial and residential buildings in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.

title: Japan Captures 3 Swim. Medals
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 5(AP)Japan's swimmers won three more gold medals, cracking the Asian Games record twice today in two events, and North Korea kept up its sharpshooting.

title: The Pop Life
description: For all the annoyance and grief occasioned by its allnight final's, the American Song Festival must be credited with at least one thing the discovery of Tim Moore, whose song Charmer won the grand prize.

description: 52Story Building Is First Special 5th Ave. Zone Zoning Created in 71 Onassis to Live There

title: SCHOLARSHIP ROLE OF ISRAEL QUERIED
description: A prominent Jewish academician yesterday challenged the concept that Israel was central in the cultural life of Jews.

title: About New York Romance of the Sea, Ashore
description: The ocean liner has become a rare bird in New York harbor. No longer do battleships anchor in line in midHudson: The procession of ships seems shorter, as seen from the crossbay ferry.

title: Dance: Ze'eva Cohen
description: Loneliness and psychological desolation in a variety of styles gave a somewhat somber tone to the New York Dance Festival at the Delacorte Theater on Wednesday evening. But if the outlook was bleak, the performing of it wasn't.

title: Portugal Near Pact to Free Mozambique
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 5(Reuters)  Samora Machel, head of the Mozambique Liberation Front, sat down here today with Foreign Minister Mario Soares of Portugal to put the finishing touches to an independence settlement that would end 10 years of guerrilla warfare in Mozambique.

title: STATE AUDIT FINDS WIDE OVERBILLING BY NURSING HOMES
description: State auditors going over a sampling of nursinghome accounts have reported $4,623,288 in unwarranted claims to Medicaid. These ran the gamut from the debatable to the apparently fraudulent, and from the petty to the exorbitant.

title: 2 Schools in Lakewood Desegregated;
description: LAKEWOOD, Sept. 5School resumed in this Ocean County municipality today, with the district using a stateordered desegregation plan for the first time after parents of white students failed yesterday in a lastminute effort to block the plan.

title: What Gerald Ford Has Done to George Wallace
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.Although it is largely intuitive so farrit strikes me that Gerald R. Ford's major political achievement during his first dazzling days in office has been to ( Jetty remove Gov. George Wallace permanently from the scene as a major force in American Presidential politics.

title: Japanese Embassy Attacked By Demonstrators in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Friday, Sept. 6 (AP)Scores of Angry South Korean demonstrators ransacked the Japanese Embassy here today, broke windows, tore the Japanese flag from the roof and set fire to an embassy car.

title: Canada Announces New Policy To Protect Uranium Supplies
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 5Canada announced today new policies on uranium exports to protect the supply of the mineral for domestic users.

title: U.S. Official Assures Russians Ford Will Press for Trade Bill
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5A United States trade official assured his Soviet counterparts today that President Ford was pressing for swift enactment of legislation to grant an improvement of trade terms to the Soviet Union.

title: ALCOA IS RAISING CANSHEET PRICES
description: The Aluminum Company of America notified its customers yesterday that it would raise prices of aluminum can sheet by 3 cents to 4 cents a pound, effective Sept. 23.

title: A Mental Outpatient Charged in Sodomy, Stabbing of Boy, 13
description: An outpatient of the Bronx Psychiatric Center, formerly the Bronx State Hospital, was being held yesterday for sodomy and the attempted murder of a 13yearold Bronx boy who was stabbed repeatedly with al screwdriver.

title: Red Smith
description: Muhammad All and his retainers are back in the Pennsylvania bush, where the Great Jawbone is preparing for a fistfight in the African bush with George Foreman. Ali interrupted his exercises the other day to go make speeches and spar in Salt Lake City, where Foreman and Joe Frazier also performed for the benefit of African drought victims. Gene Fullmer, the former middleweight champion, was there with his manager, Mary Jensen, who had on display a round boicing ring that he has designed. Ali stepped in for a turn of shadowboxing and said, Hey, man, I like this. Nobody can get me in a corner. If and when Foreman traps him in one of the four corners of the ring in Kinshasa, Zaire, All will be one with Nineveh and Tyre.

title: Too Solid Concrete
description: Shakespeare has become a beloved institution in Central Park; a full moon above the Belvedere is perfect for the Bard. But the proposal to build a 2,500seat concrete replacement of intransigent permanence for the present Delacorte Theater has been greeted with justifiable protest. Would that this all too solid concrete would melt.

title: SENATE CLEARS BILL ON OILTANKER PLAIT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI Urged to keep oil from be ing a political weapon,. the Sen ate approved today a bill tc require that part of Unite( States oil imports be curie( in American tankers. The vote was 42 to 28.

title: Leaders of TV and Films Meet City Officials on Raising Output
description: A newly formed group of leaders from the city's motion picture and television industries met for the first time yesterday with city officials in an effort to increase production, which has been declining here over the last several years.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HAZEL PARK, Mich., Sept. 5 (UPI)They kept the $100 window open at Hazel Park for 15 minutes after the final race last night, but no one showed up to claim a trifecta payout of $49,653.90. The previous record, $42,033for $2, was paid at Waterford Park in Chester, W. Va., last year.

title: 4 U.S. Crews Advance to Semifinals
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, Sept. 5  American crews qualified in the repechages today in four of five events for the semifinals of the world rowing championship. With those that qualified yesterday included the eightoared boat, the United States oarsmen have spots in 10 of Saturday's 11 semifinal races.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Market's Gain Is the Biggest Since Aug.7
description: Favorable economic developments helped the stock market yesterday register its biggest advance in almost a month in much lighter trading.

title: BEAME NAMES AIDE LIAISON ON SCHOOLS
description: Frank J. Verderame, a Brooklyn politician who dropped out of high school but resumed his education and went on to win accounting and law degrees in college, was appointed yesterday as Mayor Beame's liaison representative with city schools and colleges.

title: Goldman Investigated
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, has begun an investigation of Irving Goldman, the city's Commissioner of Cultural Affairs. Page 31.

title: STEPHEN J. WHITE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept 5 Stephen J. White, who retired in 1955 as vice president for finance of the former Niagara Alkali Company of New York, a chemical manufacturer, died today at the Greenwich Hospital. He was 91years old and lived at 84 Glenville Road.

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER FOR COMMODITIES
description: Farm commodity futures moved with little clear purpose yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, but closed generally higher.

title: Matuszak's Playing Fate Still Unsettled in Court
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 5 (AP)The future career of John Matuszak will be undecided at least until Saturday, a state district court judge ruled today.

title: New Training Base Poses Problem
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 5  The New York Giants have another unfinished home.

title: Council Told It Can't Prevent Rent Rise
description: The City Council was advised by the city's chief law officer yesterday that it lacked the authority to roll back rent increases that landlords were permitted to charge on new leases in as many as 400,000apartments here.

title: 200 Years Ago: a Mix of Ideals and Economics
description: It was 200 years ago yesterday that the First Continental Congress convened in Philadelphia to discuss mutual problems concerning the British colonies. The 56delegates of the 12 colonies (Georgia was not represented but sent her best regards) were not thinking of revolution. None of them would have been mad enough to have thought that about half a year later the colonies would be at war with England. But they did have grievances, and they did want redress of those grievances, and they helped set in motion a chain of events that nobody could have foreeen.

title: Peak Capital Outlays Expected; July Consumer Credit Expanded
description: Government reports showed yesterday that businessmen were holding to plans for a substantial increase in capital spending this year and that the rate of growth in consumer credit expanded in July.

title: FIAT CHIEF FEARS REDS IN COALITION
description: ROME, Aug. 5 The president of the Fiat Motor Company said today that the participation of Communists in the Italian government would lead to a rapid withdrawal of our country from the Western world.

title: French Ask Parley of Market Nations
description: PARIS, Sept. 6  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing, seeking to draw European nations closer together and otamine ways to deal with current economic and financial disturbances, has invited the heads of government of the eight other Common Market states to informal talks in Paris Sept. 14.

title: JAPANESE VESSEL SEIZED OFF MAINE
description: PORTLAND, Me., Sept. 6The Coast Guard has seized a 150foot Japanese fishing vessel, charging she violated American territorial waters off the Maine coast.

title: The Case For Not Voting
description: Is anybody going to vote In this year's elections? Probably. Old habits die hard and old maxims keep ringing in the ears long after their absurdity has been universally conceded. This is why citizens always vote, whether they know what they are voting for or tot. They were taught years ago that not voting was bad citizenship, and that society would approach its nearest to perfection when every eligible voter went to the polls and did his duty.

title: Hirschfeld Endorsed by TroyAlmost
description: Maintaining that a commitment is a commitment, an exuberant Abraham Hirschfeld, who is seeking the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, scurried about the corridors of City Hall yesterday to announce an endorsement that he had learned moments earlier he would not get.

title: JESUIT DISMISSED ON ABORTION ISSUE
description: The Jesuit order has dismissed a priest who baptized the son of a Massachusetts mother who advocated a woman's right to choose abbrtion.

title: Inflation Advice Given
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 6  Reginald H. Jones, chairman of the General Electric Company, called here today for tightened fiscal restraint combined with a loosening of monetary restraint in order to avoid a deep recession.

title: Dismissal Plea for Jacobsen Is Denied
description: DALLAS, Sept. 6 (AP) A Federal judge denied a Government motion today to dismiss Federal charges against Jake Jacobsen, a lobbyist, in return for his testimony against former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally.

title: Ellen Tuck French Guest Dead; Wife of J. J. Astor 3d for 9 Years
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 6Mrs. Ellen Tuck French Guest, long prominent in Newport and New York society, died yesterday at her Newport home at 11 Berkley Avenue. She was 58years old.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: Shooting of Mongoloid Under Inquiry The police in East Orange are investigating the shooting of a 16yearold Mongoloid youth who had been wielding a threefootlong saber. The youth, Robert Moses, was in satisfactory condition at East Orange General Hospital. He was shot Monday by Patrolman Reginald Grant. The police said the boy had been chasing a group of youngsters with the sword when several policemen saw him, and tried to stop him. They said the boy then started moving toward Patrolman Grant and the other policemen.

title: PLEDGE TO NIXON LINKED TO GREEK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The sum of $20,000 in cash which Mrs. Hejen D. Bentley, the Federal Maritime Commission chairman, carried to the Nixon campaign in 1972 originated with a Greek shipping owner, according to Senate Watergate committee files.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BOONTON, Sept 6What a difference a year makes.

title: French Accuse Protesters
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Sept. 6 (UPI)The French Government charged a Goleta, Calif., couple yesterday with misdemeanor offenses stemming from their sevenhour, family occupation of the French consulate here. Joseph Berenguer, wife, Charlotte, and their four children, aged 5 to 18, barricaded themselves inside the consulate Tuesday, saying the French Government owed them $20,000 for a business they owned in Algeria and were forced to abandon during the 1962 FrenchAlgerian war.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEES KISSINGER TWICE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller spent a busy day today, meeting twice with the Secretary of State, once with President Ford, and once with the chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: 2 Jump Classes To Tinker Toy
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Sept, 6Tinker Toy, owned by the Country Club Stables of Delray Beach, Fla., moved into a commanding lead for the amateurowner jumper championship today at the opening session of the threeday North Shore horse show at the Old Field Club:

title: AMEX PRICES TAKE A MIXED COURSE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange yesterday finished mixed while those in the overthecounter maket ended higher.

title: Katangan Soldiers Stay On in Angola
description: LUANDA, Angola, Sept. 6(Agence FrancePresse)Beside the Portuguese flag flying over the Chimbila military camp in eastern Angola there still flutters a 10yearold souvenir of yet another African war: a blue flag with a yellow diagonal and a yellow star.

title: ELEANOR PLATT DIES; SCULPTOR WAS 64
description: Eleanor Platt, a sculptor who executed busts of many prominent Americans, died Aug. 30in her studio at 50 West 77th Street. She was 64 years old.

title: Teachers in Westbury Strike After Talks Fail
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 6The Westbury Teachers Association went on strike today, after a fruitless allnight negotiating session with the school board. Dr. Francis P. McDermott, Superintendent of the Westbgry schools, said only a small percentage of the 304 teachers involved reported to work this morning in seven schools that serve 4,500 children.
