description: Sept. 10, 1974GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: FORD SAYS 11BILLION IS LIMIT FOR TRANSIT
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 9 (AP)President Ford said today that the energy crisis had made it clear that the nation must give high priority to building mass transit systems that people want to use, but he said that $11billion in spending over the next six years was the most he would approve.

title: S. LYTTON SCOTT
description: S. Lytton Scott, founder and retired partner of the accounting firm of Scott Mickelson, died yesterday of cancer at his home in River House, 435 East 52d Street. He was 71 years old.

title: Steelers Van Dyke Traded to Packers
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 9 (AP) The Pittsburgh Steelers traded an AllPro guard, Bruce Van Dyke, to the Green Bay Packers today for an undisclosed 1976 draft choice. Van Dyke, 30 years old, suffered a calf injury in the Steelers third preseason game and has not played or practiced since.

title: Sports. News Briefs
description: The American League's proposal to play approximately 15 regularseason games in Washington next year will not be put into effect, it was announced yesterday by Lee MacPhail, the league president.

title: CLASH 011 WORDING
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 9Former President Nixon successfully beat back White House efforts to lave him make a full and revealing statement of his role in the Watergate affair in conjunction with his pardon, reliable sources disclosed today.

title: Connors, Mrs. King Win Singles Crowns Ire U.S Open Tennis
description: Jimmy e Connors, overwhelmingly, and Billie Jean King, excruciatingly, became the United States Open tennis champions yesterday. The title was the first for Connors and the fourth for Mrs. King at Forest Hills. Each won $22,500, an automobile and other prizes.

title: JAMES ROBERTSON SR.
description: James W. Robertson Sr., lawyer who retired two years ago from the legal staff of the Pepsico Company of New York after 30 years of service, died yesterday at St. Peter's Medical. Center, New Brunswick, N. J. He was 61 years old and lived at 1355 Kearney Drive, North Brunswick.

title: They Attended the Benefit Looking as If It Were Fall Already
description: The calendar said yes and the weather said no, but it wasn't really a contest. The calendar won, as it was bound to do with fashion involved. A lot of women Were dying to show off their new fall outfits and they did it was an ideal opportunity  the first of the seasonal round of fashionable fashion shows.

title: Construction Problems Hinder Soviet Dam
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 9Completion of the world's largest hydroelectric power dam is being hindered by some perennial problems of the Soviet construction industry, including inadequate living conditions, a high labor turnover and shortage of working equipment.

title: Japans Ruling Party Feeling Pinch as Business Cuts Contributions
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8Japan's governing Liberal Democratic party, after years of spending money as if the party coffers had no bottoms is in a financial crisis.

title: PRICES IMPROVE IN BOND MARKETS
description: Prices improved yesterday in the corporate, Government and taxexempt bond markets in what dealers described as a response to the move last week by the Federal Reserve Board to provide a moderate easing in the credit markets. They pointed to the Fed's reduction of reserve requirements on fourmonth and longer certificates of deposits from 8 per cent to 5 per cent.

title: Trevino Defeats Player In World Series of Golf
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 9The playoff of a playoff ended this morning as Lee Trevino beat Gary Player by one stroke to win the World Series of Golf.

title: A DISPUTE ARISES OVER ELEMENT 106
description: For the third time in a decade a dispute has arisen between scientists at Dubna in the Soviet Union and at the University of California aat Berkeley as to who was first in synthesizing a new element.

title: Dodgers Win on Homers, Rookie Pitching
description: Steve Garvey, who has been a major asset to the Los Angeles Dodgers in their quest of the Western Division pennant this season, smacked a tworun homer, and Ron Cey, another of their young Turks, hit a threerun homer in pacing the Dodgers to an 81 victory over the Braves in Atlanta last night.

title: As Failures Rise, Bankers Make Bid for Confidence
description: BASEL, Switzerland; Sept. 9 Western central bank authorities sought ways today to lift public confidence in the banking system following reverses suffered by dozens of banks in the last nine months.

title: Wood, Field & Stream Patience and Light Test Line
description: Persistence, as well as skill, plays an important role in successful fishing, and none knows this better than Dr. Einar F. Grell of New York.

title: Soviet Docking System Failed on Soyuz Flight
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)The first official explanation of the trouble on last month's Soyuz 15 spaceflight was made here today by the commander of Soviet astronaut training. A new automatic, remote controlled docking system failed and prevented the craft from linking with the Salyut space station, he said.

title: Reports of Nixon Ill Health Are Questioned by Visitors
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 Several persons who have recently visited former President Richard M. Nixon cast doubt today on reports that he is in poor health, one of the reasons cited by President Ford yesterday in granting Mr. Nixon an unconditional pardon.

title: JERSEY BILL AIMS AT UTILITY PRICES
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9 A bill that would freeze all public utility rates for six months was Voted out of an Assembly committee today in a legislative response to widespread public criticism of soaring utility costs.

title: Court Queen and Women's Lib Symbol
description: If fans had forgotten that Billie Jean King, spearhead of World Team Tennis, publisher of Women Sports magazine and women's lib activist, was also a great tennis player they were reminaed of it yesterday when she won the final of the United States Open. It was her fourth singles title at Forest Hills. She won her first in 1967.

title: Primary Election Ticket
description: The recommendations of The Times on candidates today's Democratic primary election are recapitulated below. Candidates whose names are followed by an asterisk are incumbents.

title: 2 City Schools Boycotted for Incomplete Renovations
description: Parents at a school in the Bronx and a school in Queens, irate because construction work had not been completed, (ept their children home yesterday.

title: Prosecutor Baffled By Shooting Deaths of 2 in Somerville
description: SOMERVILLE, Sept. 9  The Somerset County Prosecutor, Stephen Champi, said today that his office had not yet determined how or why two local men, who were friends, had been shot and killed here yesterday.

title: Court to Hear Imperiale In Rail  Crossing Protest
description: A New Jersey Superior Court Judge yesterday ordered State Senator Anthony Imperiale, independent of Essex County, and several Belleville municipal officias to show cause why they shouldn of be prevented from physically blockading an ErieLackawanna Railroad crossing at the BellevilleBloomfield boundary as part of their continuing protests against the rairoad's removal of some crossing gates.

title: WORLD COMMENT ON PARDON MIXED
description: LONDON, Sept. 9News of the Presidential pardon for Richard M. Nixon was printed on front pages around the world today, but comment was relatively sparse and mixed.

title: Forego, 126, Top Weight In Marlboro.
description: The weights assignments for the 11 horses in the $250,000 Marlboro Cup at Belmont Park on Saturday were revealed yesterday by the New York Racing Association. Kenny Noe, the racing secretary and handlcapper for the N.Y.R.A., made the assignments last week before departing for Paris where he planned to meet with European authorities on a revision of the scale of weights in thoroughbred competition.

title: Stage: At the Chichester
description: CHICHESTER, England, Sept. 9Twelve years ago the Chichester Festival Theater opened its doors. First under Laurence Olivier and then, three years later, under John Clements, the Festival grew and flourished. But now Lord Olivier and Sir John have left, and this season for the first time a new director, the Australian actor Keith Michell, was at the helm. It seems to have been none too happy a ship.

title: Woman Dies in Crash
description: SOMERSET, Pa., Sept. 9 (UPI) A Frenchwoman visiting this country was killed today when a pickup truck in which she and two other Frenchwomen were riding Was struck by a tractortrailer in heavy fog on the Pennsylvania Turnpike. The other women and two men ridin'g in the pickup were hospitalized The dead woman was not immediately identified.

title: Dr. Choi Doo Suri, 80, Dies; ExPremier of South Korea
description: Dr. Choi Doo Sun, a former Premier, newspaper publisher and until two years ago president of the Korean Red Cross, died yesterday at his home in Seoul. He was 80 years old.

title: Engelhard Dividend Raised
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation announced yesterday it had lifted its quarterly dividend to 15cents a share from 12 cents a share on its common stock. The new rate is payable Sept. 30 to shareholders of record Sept. 20.

title: 67 Leftists Seized At Secret Meeting In Spanish Convent
description: MADRID, Sept. 9 (Reuters) The police in Barcelona said today that they had arrested 67 leftists holding a speret political meeting in a nearby convent.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW A DECLINE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped yesterday as traders showed little inclination to view the pardon of former President Richard M. Nixon as bullish news.

title: Westgate Trade Suspended
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today it was suspending trading in the Westgate California Corporation for 10 days. The commission had just lifted a longterm suspension of the company on Friday. A commission spokesman said both actions were taken at the request of the trustee for the trouble company.

title: Manhattan Cable Testing Pay TV For Limited Offer
description: Manhattan Cable Television, Inc. (formerly Sterling Manhattan), the system that serves the lower half of Manhattan, has begun testing its first paytelevision service before offering it to certain subscribers later this month.

title: People and Business
description: Thomas E. Kauper, Assistant Attorney General in charge of the Antitrust Division of the Justice Department, urged Congress yesterday to reevaluate the role that regulatory agencies play in industrial competition.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: At first glance, it looked like the most heavily guarded art show in the city. As it turned out, however, the men and women in uniforms were the artists themselves. They were standing proudly with their work as Cop Art 74 opened at Police Headquarters in lower Manhattan.

title: Events Today
description: JANE STEVENS, mezzosoprano, Trinity Church, 12:45.

title: Aramco Denies Americans Will Sell Shares to Saudi
description: A spokesman for the ArabianAmerican Oil Company denied here, yesterday a magazine report from Beirut, Lebanon that the four American petroleum concerns that own 40 per cent of the company had agreed to a 100 per cent takeover by the Government of Saudi Arabia.

title: Lockheed Aircraft Increases Earnings
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, Burbank, Calif., announced last night its net earnings for the second quarter and for the six months ended on June 30, both showing gairis.

title: CHANGE PROPOSED IN GASPRICE LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Federal Power Commission proposed today to let small producers of natural gas charge 50 per cent more than the national ceiling price for large producers. The price now is 43cents a thousand cubic feet.

title: U.S. Open Tennis
description: Boh Lutz, San Clemente, Calif., and Stan Smith, Sea Pines, S.C., defeated Patricin Corneio and Jaime Filial, Chile, 63, 6:3.

title: New Indictments Expected In Fort Lee Bribery Inquiry
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Sept. 9This may not be another Carson City or Sacramento, but for almost two decades, this sleepy, slightly rundown town atop the Palisades has been as much of a bonanza to the right people as any mining, town in the Old West.

title: PARDON PRAISED BY ROCKEFELLER
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller, who said last week that he believed former. President Richard M. Nixon should be treated like any other citizen, said yesterday that President Ford's pardon of the former President was, an act of conscience, compassion and courage.

title: Assembly Bill Asks a 6Month Freeze On Public Utility Rates in the State
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9A bi that would freeze all publi utility rates for six months was voted out of an Assembly committee today in a legislativ response to widespread publi criticism of soaring utilit costs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city sold $600million in revenue anticipation notes yesterday at an average interest rate of 8.437 per cent, which was slightly below the record of 8.586 per cent interest on an $800million note sale last July 17. Yesterday's notes were awarded to a syndicate headed by First National City Bank and the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: European Security Parley Resumes; EastWest Differences Still Wide
description: GENEVA, Sept, 9 (Reuters)The European Security Conference resumed fullscale negotiations here today after a sixweek recess.

title: Prisoners Appeal to Ford
description: CRANSTON, R.I., Sept. 9 (AP) The national Prisoners Reform Association telegraphed President Ford today asking for pardons for its members. Romeo Gabriele, a director of the prisoners group, whose national headquarters is at the state prison here, said he sent the telegram after learning of Mr. Ford's pardon of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Some in White House Misled terHorst, Friends Say in Explaining Why He Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9J.F. ter Horst's abrupt resignation as Presidential press secretary was described today by close friends as having been prompted, at least in part, by his feeling that he had been misled by certain White House officials.

title: Rail Employe Pleads On Calzadilla Ransom
description: NEWARK, Sept. 9 (AP)A railroad worker indicted for absconding with $50,000 in ransom money raised by the father of John Calzadilla, who was kidnapped last March 6, pleaded guilty to a lesser charge today and promised to pay back $3,900he spent.

title: Mrs. Dean Plea to Ford Seeks Aid for Husband
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) Mrs. John W. Dean 3d called on President Ford today to denionstrate the same compassion for her husband that Mr. Ford showed in pardoning Richard M. Nixon.

title: HEATH HERE TO SEE FORD ON INFLATION
description: Edward Heath, the leader of the British Parliamentary Opposition, said here yesterday that inflation was the most serious problem facing not only Britain but the Western world.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
description: LONDON METAL MARKET

title: Aid to Farmers Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)] The Senate passed a resolution today calling, on all Federal agencies to give top priority to encouraging production of fertilizer, fuels and other materials needed by farmers.

title: Treasary Bills Off At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON; Sept. 9Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Turkish Cypriote Chief Sees TakeOver of Greek Holdings
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus; Sept.9, (AP) Vice President Rid Denktash, the leader of the Turkish Cypriote community, today predicted a virtual economic takeover Of Greek assets in northern Cyprils, but added nonGreek foreign interests and foreignowned property would not, be touched.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, Sept. 9, 1974Petition filed by:

title: NEWS INDEX
description: Page

title: Verrazzano Welcomes First Freshmen
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Sept. 9Verrazzano College opened for its first academic year here today with 42 students, eight fulltime faculty members, five buildings, two dormitories and a conviction that there is room in the American educational spectrum for an oldfashioned small liberal arts college.

title: Nixon's  Mistakes,
description: In explaining his decision to grant an unconditional pardon to Richard Nixon, President Ford fell back on the popular explanation that the buck stops here. The trouble with the application of Harry Truman's famous definition of Presidential responsibility to the case at hand is that the buck had not yet reached its proper stopping place in the Oval Office.

title: New Jersey Sports Tough Act to Follow
description: Clifton High's football team was unbeaten and untied last year en route to a recordbreaking iseason that extended its winning streak to 19 games, the longest current victory string in New Jersey schoolboy football.

title: BONN AIDS GREECE WITH $70MILLION
description: BONN, Sept. 9The West German Government has granted Greece about $70million in development aid to be spread over the next three years, a spokesman announced today.

title: Antuofermo Tops Moyer On a Decision at Garden
description: Vito Antuofermo gained unanimous 10round decision over Denny Moyer of Portland, Ore, in a middelweight fight at Madison Square Garden last night. The 22yearold native of Bari, Italy, had no trouble defeating the experienced Moyer, who was in his 132d fight. Referee Arthur Mercante favored Antuofermo by a 721 margin. One judge, Jack Gordon, gave every round to Antuofermo and the other, Harold Lederman, scored it 91.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 10, 1974
description: As jubilant white settlersmany of whom were heavily armedand a coalition black politicians strengthened their grip on Lourengo Marques, the capital of Mozambique, they formally urged Portuguese officials to modify an agreement made Saturday to give control of the African territory to the black insurgent movement. [1:4.]

title: Saudi Arabia and Iran In OilPrice Stalemate
description: TAIF, Saudi Arabia, Sept. 7King Faisal of Saudi Arabia called off a recent large oil auction, designed to force a reduction in the world price, because of strong antagonism toward the measure by other oil producers, according to Saudi Government sources. In return for suspending the auction, the Saudi sources said that Algeria, which had objected to the auction in a Getter from President Houari Boumediene to King Faisal, had agreed to support the Saudi view that there should be po increase in the posted price of oil before next year.

title: Health Insurance Plan Asks 11.1% Rise in Premiums
description: Citing inflation in the cost of delivering medical services, the Health Insurance Plan of Greater New York asked yesterday for an average 11.1 per cent premium increase in the next 12 months.

title: Bridge: An Upside, Down Dummy Puts New Angle Into Competition
description: Defenders are sometimes called upon to answer the riddle: When is a dummy not a dummy?

title: Pardon for What?
description: Far from writing The End on the tragedy of Watergate, President Ford's sweeping pardon of former President Nixon has only muddied further the ambiguities and uncertainties left in the wake of that whole lamentable episode. A more divisive and distasteful outcome could scarcely be imagined.

title: BELL SYSTEM RULING REAFFIRMED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) The Government told the Bell System today that it must provide interconnections for domestic satellites as well as the specialized common carriers that use ground telephone lines.

title: DR. HUGO S. DELUCA
description: Dr. Hugo S. DeLuca of 325Hunter Street, Woodbury, N. J., an orthopedic surgeon, died Sunday at the University of Pennsylvania Hospital, Philadelphia, following surgery. He was 44 years old.

title: City Aide to Run Nassau County Hospital
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 9The appointment of Donald H. Eisenberg, acting executive vice president of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation as the new superintendent of the Nassau County Medical Center, was announced today by County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: AWE SETS MARK IN SAES AND NET
description: Avnet, Inc., reported yesterday record results for the fiscal year ended June 30 and the highest sales and earnings for the final three months of the year for any quarter in its history.

title: Dr. Clarence Senior Dies at 71;. Educator Aided Puerto Ricans
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Sept. 9Dr. Clarence Senior, a former member of the New York City Board of Education and an expert on migration, died here last night of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 71 years old.

title: AUSTRIANS PLANNING TO RELOCATE CAMP
description: VIENNA, Sept. 9 (UPI)City authorities said today that they planned to relocate a Red Cross transit camp for Soviet Jews to minimize the risk of Arab guerrilla attacks that might endanger families living near by.

title: Market Place Bearish Report Hits Gold Bugs
description: There must be tens of thousands of investors who have been rewarded by putting their faith in gold shares in a bear market that offers few havens.

title: Belmont Race Charts
description: Yonkers Raceway Results

title: PRICES ARE DELAYED ON 75 MODEL FORDS
description: DETROIT, Sept. 9The Ford Motor Company said today it was delaying until later in the week setting firm prices for 1975 model cars and trucks.

title: Yale Art Volumes Will Be &moved To a Safer Buildig
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 9The 53,000 volumes of Yale University's Art and Architecture LiIbrary are to be moved to a new site later this week because of the health threat posed by asbestos particles falling from the ceiling.

title: Pro Transactions
description: Pro Transactions

title: Kennedy Urges China Join Next Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9(Reuters)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy proposed today that China be included in all future arms control negotiations between the United States and the Soviet Union. The Massachusetts Democrat said China's inclusion mould be a good way for the United States to demonstrate its recognition of China's importance as a major power.

title: Dow Tumbles 14.94 to 662.94
description: Investors continued concern about the economy and over President Ford's decision to pardon Richard M. Nixon sent the stock market down sharply yesterday in slow trading.

title: AN INDICTED JUDGE RESIGNS HIS POST
description: Newton M. Poyer, a Bronx Civil Court judge who was indicted last December on charges of conspiracy to fix a murder case, has resigned, effective Saturday, lawenforcement sources revealed yesterday.

title: INDIA IS ACCUSED OF PRISON ABUSES
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 9Three hundred foreign academics and other intellectuals have signed a protest condemning the Indian Government's detention of political prisoners.

title: Ashland to Reduce Prices of Gasoline; Steel Is Increased
description: The Ashland Petroleum Company said yesterday it would cut its gasoline price by a cent a gallon, effective today. A spokesman said this would be the second consecutive month it had cut prices despite high crude oil and operating costs. Ashland a division of Ashland Oil, Inc., operates stations in 19 states east of the Mississippi River, including upstate New York and Pennsylvania.

title: Conde Nast Publications Appoints New President
description: Conde Nast Publications has named as its president Robert J. Lapham, wha had been vice president and general manager. He takes that title from Perry L. Ruston, who will remain chairman for the rest of this year. Mr. Lapham has been with the company since 1954 when he joined Vogue. The other publications are House & Garden, Glamour, Mademoiselle and Bride's Magazine.

title: Sirica Disbands Panel on Electronics, But jaworski May Seek Experts Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 9A panel of six electronics experts, assembled by the United States District Court to study White House tape recordings, has been disbanded by the court but may be kept at work by the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski.

title: Abortion Veto Overridden
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. $ (AP)  The Senate voted 41 to 8 today to override Gov. Milton Shapp's veto of a bill that would require a woman to ob, tam her husband's consent before receiving an abortion. The House must now vote the meas. ure.

title: VOTERS TO CHOOSE CANDIDATES TODAY IN STATE PRIMARY
description: The eightmonth long Democratic gubernatorial primary campaign ended last night with the candidates making their final appearances at clubhouse rallies but with the real campaigning going on behind the scenes with massive telephone, and personal canvassing operations designed to get out the vote.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet will present three new productions during its fourweek fall season at the City Center. The New York premiere of Leonide Massine's Pulcinella will take place opening night, Oct. 9. The ballet, first presented in 1920 by Diaghilev's Ballets Russes, has a score Igor Stravinsky  and sets and costumes by Pablo Picasso, recreated for this production by Rouben TerArutunian.

title: Yanks Top Red Sox, 63, Lead by Game
description: BOSTON, Sept. 9  The New York Yankees won their going first game in Fenway Park 20in more than a year tonight year when they overpowered the Boston Red Sox, 63, and re streak gained sole possession of first place with 22 games left to play.

title: Soviet Dam Hindered
description: Completion of the world's largest hydroelectric dam is being hindered by some perennial problems of, the Soviet construction industry. Details on. Page 57.

title: U.S. ASKS $7MILLION IN SHIPBUILDING SUIT
description: NORFOLK, Sept. 10 (AP) The Federal Governinent has sued the Norfolk Shipbuilding and Drydock Corpot'ation, asking damages that could exceed $7million for what the Navy contends were losses stemming from illegal ractices.

title: Private Business Helps Out Driver Education Courses
description: Driver education, one of the more costly subjects taught in our schools today, is heavily assisted by private business, the Associated Press reports.

title: Only Laver Is Left for Connors
description: At Forest Hills yesterday there was no call of Linesmen ready? Play! But the empty stadium seemed to be echoing the incredible barrage of shots laid down by Jimmy Connors in his annihilation of Ken Rosewell in the men's final of the $271,000 United States Open championships.

title: SANDERS REPORTS LARGE DEFICITS,
description: Sanders Associates, producer of electronics equipment and systems, reported yesterday huge losses for the quarter and fiscal year ended. July 31 and blamed the deficits on monopolistic marketing practices by the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: New Books
description: Does Anyone Else Have Something Further to Add? Stories About Secret Places and Mean Men, by R. A. Lafferty (Scribners, $6.95).

title: 2 Channels to Televise inflation Conference
description: Channels 13 and 21, through the facilities of the Public Broadcasting Service, will provide live television today of the White House conference on inflation, starting at 9:30 A.M.

title: Washington StarNews Deal Delayed by Contract Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 The sale of controlling interest in The WashingtonStar News to Joe L. Allbritton, a Houston banker, was postponed today because of a dispute over a union contract.

title: Nearby Golf Results AT GLEN OAKS CLUB
description: Justine Cushing, Meadow Brook, defeated Mrs. Gordon McGrath, Piping Rock, 3 and I; Mrs, Sanford Goldzier, Cold Spring, defeated Mrs. Andrew Sage, Piping Rock, 19 holes; Mrs. Thorne Dempsey, St. George's defeated Mrs. L. Ugelow, Glen Oaks, 5 and 4; Mrs. Alvin Bakst, Fresh Meadow, defeated Barbara Finkelstein, Fresh Meadow, 2 and 1.

title: Scott Paper Unit Closing
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 10 (UPI)The Scott Paper Company, citing the increased cost of raw materials, announced yesterday it was discontinuing paper and plastic cup operations at its plant in Eddystone, Pa. About 300 employes will be affected by the shutdown which is to be completed by the end of the year.

title: Dogdom's Governing Group Installs First Women
description: History was made at the quarterly meeting of the American Kennel Club yes terday when three women took their places as delegates.

title: P.O. & E. Stock Offering Set
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 10 (UPI)The Pacific Gas and Electric Company announced today it was filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission a proposed offering of 5,923,503 shares of common stock to its shareholders.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: COUGH COUGH Her name is Violetta, and she has appeared in a lot of versions of the story known mostly as Camille. But it's hard to imagine a more bizarre rendition than the one presented by the Ridiculous Theatrical Company at the Evergreen Theater (4770504), 53 East 11th Street. For this Camille stars Charles Ludlam in a drag performance that takes plenty of spoofing shots and yet handles the story very seriously.

title: Belmont Race Charts
description: Tuesday, Sept. 10. 14th day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Sunrise in Mozambique
description: It is an occasion for great relief if the rebellion by a group of white settlers against the agreement for the independence of Mozambique has been quashed, as Portuguese authorities now report. There was no chance that the uprising could succeed; but its prolongation would risk additional largescale bloodletting, racial conflict and outside intervention.

title: Yanks Win in 12th On Johnson Clout
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10  The New York Yankees carried their revival to new dramatic heights tonight when they tied the Boston Red Sox in the ninth inning and defeated them in the 12th on a home run by Alex Johnson in his first day as a member of the cast.

title: Shipping/Mails MI Hours Given In Eastern Daylight Time
description: AFRICAN SUN (Farrell), Dakar Sent. 21, Monrovia 27, Lagos Ocl. 3 and Matadi 12; sails from Joralemon St. Brooklyn.

title: CITY'S JOB LOSS PUT AT 316,500 SINCE 69
description: Over the last five years, New York City has lost almost a third of a million jobs, with the number of people employed here as of June falling to only slightly more than 3.5 million.

title: Jersey Station Offers Time To 58 Congress Candidates
description: The New Jersey Public Broadcasting network has offered 30 minutes of primeevening television time to each of the 58 candidates in the state running for seats in the United States Congress.

title: StolenBase Comparison For Brock and Wills
description: A chart of the final 14 stolen bases by Maury Wills as he set the major league record in 1962 as compared to Lou Brock's 1974 progress toward that record:

title: Oil on the Fire
description: One admirable attribute of impartial arbitration a means of settling labormanagement disputes is that the arbitrator seeks to interpret contract obligations in a way that will promote orderly and constructive future relationships between employer and unionized employes.

title: Ainphetamine Ring
description: The Federal authorities said last night that th:ey had broken network responsible for distributing all illegal amphetamine tablets in the United States. They began unsealing 102 Indictments in. 11 cities and arieeting sus pects. Page 25

title: 2 Asian Games Athletes Dropped for DrugTaking
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Sept. 10 (AP)Iran captured eight of the 10 gold medals in GrecoRoman wrestling at the Asian Games tonight and was awarded four in weightlifting after one Japanese and one North Korean were disqualified for taking prohibited drugs.

title: POPE NOMINATES 22 FOR BISHOPS SYNOD
description: ROME, Sept. 10The Vatican announced today the nomination by Pope Paul VI of 22 members to the synod of bithcps that will open here Sept. 27.

title: DR. HUBERT E. Aga MINERAL ECONOMIST
description: Dr. Hubert E., Risser, a mineral economist who, had been a special adviser and assistant to the director of the United States Geological Survey, died Friday of cancer at his home in Reston, Va. He was 60 years old.

title: Jewish Woman Released By Soviet Reaches Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 10 (Reuters) Silva Zalmanson, freed after having served four years in Soviet prison camp for attempted hijacking, received tumultous welcome when she landed at Ben Gurion International Airport here today.

title: Thousands in Seoul Again Try to Attack Japanese Embassy
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 10 (AP)Ten thousand demonstrators converged on the Japanese Embassy today for the second day in succession, but the police again fired tear gas to drive them back. The crowds made several futile attempts to break through the lines guarding the embassy, but the cordons held.

title: Nearby Golf Results AT GLEN OAKS CLUB
description: Justine Cushing, Meadow Brook, defeated Mrs. Gordon McGrath, Piping Rock, and 1; Mrs. Sanford Goldzier, Cold Spring, defeated Mrs. Andrew Sage, Pining Rock, 19 holes; Mrs. Thorne Dempsey, Si. George's, defeated Mrs. L. Ugelow, Glen Oaks, 5 and 4; Mrs. Alvin Bakst, Fresh Meadow, defeated Barbara Finkelstein, Fresh Meadow, 2 and 1.

title: Realty Leaders in Metropolitan Area Shocked by Extent of Alleged Offenses
description: Realestate industry leaders and observers in the metropolitan area expressed shock yesterday over the indictments of Investors Funding Corporation and four of its top officers, But they appeared to be disturbed more by the breadth of the alleged offenses than by the handing up of the indictments.

title: Extent of Alleged Offenses Shocks RealEstate World
description: Realestate industry leaders anr observers in the metropolitan area expressed shock yesterday over the indictments of Investors Funding Corporation and four of its top officers. But they appeared to be disturbed more by the breadth of the alleged offenses than by the handing up of the indictments.

title: Radio
description: Talks, Sports, Events

title: Wildlife Laws Are Hindering The Collectors
description: Bill Blass was lucky in his encounter with Customs agents over a conservation law. Nelson A. Rockefeller was not.

title: REALTY COMPANY INDICTED IN PLAN FOR FT. LEE BRIBE
description: NEWARK, Sept. 10Investors Funding Corporation of New York and four of its top officials were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of authorizing payments of $1.4million in bribes to try to win approval of plans for a $250million highrise commercial project near the George Washington Bridge in Fort Lee.

title: FIRST ESCAPE MADE FROM SOMERS PRISON
description: SOMERS, Conn., Sept. 10 (AP) A 29yearold inmate scaled three walls under the cover of a heavy morning fog today and became the first person to escape from Connecticut's maximum security prison, authorities reported.

title: U.S. Weighs Status of Nuclear Warheads in Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Sept., 10Officials in both the Pentagon and the State Department are debating whether American nuclear warheads should be left in Greece. Officials agree that legally they should have been removed when the Greeks withdrew from the military command of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: A Victory for Reds, but Dodgers Stay in the Pink
description: The Cincinnati Reds kept pace with the Dodgers last night by beating the San Diego Padres, 52, in Riverfront Stadium behind the sixhit pitching of Don Gullet.

title: TORTURE IN CHILE SAID TO CONTINUE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 10  Amnesty International charged today that the torture of political prisoners was continuing in Chile a year after the coup d'tat that overthrew President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: A BUCHEN BRIEFING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The White House counsel, Philip W. Buchen, said today that the granting of a pardon to former President Richard M. Nixon can imply guiltthere is no other reason for granting a pardon.

title: Walter Washington Leads D.C. Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Walter E. Washington took a narrow lead in the race for Mayor tonight as the District of Columbia began the process of choosing its first elected government since the years following the Civil War.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Murderer of Priest Threatens the Judge Who Sentenced Him
description: A convicted killer threatened a State Supreme Court justice yesterday after the young man had been sentenced to from 25 years to life imprisonment for the 1973 murder of a Roman Catholic priest in Queens.

title: Advertising: Super Superman?
description: He's the hottest property I've seen in 35 years, said Anson Isaacson of Chicago, who is handling licensing agreements for Evel Knievel, motorcyclist turned parachutist over the Snake River Canyon in Idaho. He'll probably exceed any other property, including Superman, Mr. Isaacson added.

title: TEXTBOOK PROTEST HITS PUBLIC BUSES
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 10 (AP) The Charlestonarea public bus system was virtually shut down today by pickets protesting the use of school textbooks they say are unAmerican and antiChristian.

title: Bill Offering Is Reduced
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Treasury announced today a surprise reduction of its weekly bill offering for next week and probably the following week as well.

title: SARAH CORCORAN
description: Sarah Corcoran, a retired teacher, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N.Y. She lived at 35 Parkvidw Avenue, Bronxville.

title: Beleaguered Franklin National Leaving Midtown Headquarters
description: The beleaguered Franklin National Bank, which has lost more than $1.5billion in deposits since its financial problems were disclosed last May, said yesterday that it could no longer afford its executive headquarters in midtown Manhattan.

title: Bridge: Weichsel and Snontag Impress, But Fail to Win Team Berths
description: The selection of the North American team for the 1975 world team championship was determined strictly by the results of playoff matches in Washington at the beginning of the month. If the selection had been based on the performance of the individual pairs, as measured by objective judges, Peter Weichsel and Alan Sontag of New York would surely have earned their first chance at a world team title.

title: 48 ARE INVOLVED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 President Ford is studying the possibility of pardoning those persons convicted or accused of crimes in the Watergate and related scandals, a Presidential spokesman said today.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: Genetic Puzzle Solved, Scientists Say
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Scientists reported today that they had deciphered and synthesized most and perhaps all of the code that governs the turning on of the hereditary instructions in a gene.

title: No Early Drop Seen In British Inflation
description: LONDON, Sept. 10Britain's chief financial officer predicted today that British inflation, recently running at 17 per cent year, would remain in double figures for at least two more years and perhaps longer.

title: Oslo GoSlow Policy Casts Pall on Oil Fair
description: STAVANGER, Norway, Sept. 5 Three hundred exhibitors and thousands of oilmen gathered early this month in this small city on the southwest coast for the nation's first oil fair.

title: Censored Matter in Book About C.I.A. Said to Have Related Chile Activities
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Central Intelligence Agency, citing national security, censored the first printed account of some of the agency's clandestine activities against President Salvadore Allende Gossens of Chile from a recently published expos of the intelligence establishment, wellinformed sources said today.

title: Law to Restrict Abortions Is Enacted in Pennsylvania
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 10 (AP)A bill intended to curtail abortions that are not necessary to save a woman's life or health became Pennsylvania law today when the House voted 15737 to override Gov. Milton J. Shapp's veto of the measure. The Senate overrode the veto yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: It wasn't Forest Hills, but the first outdoor Garcia Youth tennis tournament held recently at Princeton University had some similarity to the United States Open championships. It was a showcase for young players who had made outstanding records in intercommunity play throughout New Jersey during the summer, and some them looked as if they could become future stars.

title: HEARST CORP. PICKS A GENERAL MANAGER
description: Frank A. Bennack Jr., publisher since 1967 of the Hearstowned San Antonio Light, was named general manager of newspapers today by the Hearst, Corporation.

title: Clark: Controversial Man
description: Ramsey Clark, a softspoken Texas liberal, was one of the most admired and denounced Nen in Washington during his service as Attorney General in the administration of Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: Mailmen Join in Wishing Someone a Happy Birthday
description: OMAHA, Neb, (AP) Mrs. Steven Peterson of Columbus, Miss., mailed a birthday gift to her mother, Mrs. William Gilter of Omaha.

title: ExOyster Bay Aide Is Accused of Extortion in New Indictment
description: A Federal grand jury inl Brooklyn handed up a new extortion indictment yesterday against Gerard Trotta, the former Public Works Commissioner of the Town of Oyster Bay, L.I., after the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York withdrew the original one.

title: Zaretzki, Democrtic Leader in state Sinse 1957, Is Defeated by Leichter
description: Senator Joseph Zaretzki, the Democratic leader in the State Senate since 1957, last night, conceded defeat to Assembly man Franz S. Leichter in his hid for renomination to a 14th term.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: People and Business
description: The conditions are now ripe for a return flow of American manufacturers who went abroad to produce goods to export back to this country Robert W. Sarnoff, chairman of the RCA Corporation, said yesterday at a union convention in Kansas City.

title: Additional Price Rises Possible for Uniroyal
description: Uniroyal, Inc., the country's third largest tire maker, has increased its prices on original equipment tires  those sold to automobile manufacturers  and additional increases are not out of the question.

title: Reform Democrat to Face Sargent in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10Michael Dukakis, a Democrat represcenting the new politics, won the right tonight to challenge incumbent Republican Francis W. Sargent for the governorship.

title: Ford Appoints Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP)Warren S. Rustand, an AllAmerican basketball player at the University of Arizona in the midnineteensixties, has been named appointments secretary to President Ford. Mr. Rustand, 31years old, was scheduling director on Mr. Ford's VicePresidential staff.

title: Business Briefs
description: Mutual savings banks in New York State had a net outflow of $514million in August compared with an outflow of $602million in July, the Saving Bank Association reported yesterday.

title: SUIT BY S.E.C. NAMES U.S. TANK CAR CORP.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 10 (AP)The The Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit today in Federal District Court icharging U.S. Tank Car Corporation of Seattle and its president with multimillion  dollar fraud.

title: WRVR WILL PRESENT NEW OLDTIME RADIO
description: WRVRFM radio will present a new fall lineup of shows its evening Festival of Oldtime Radio beginning Sept. 16.

title: 10 Nations Plan Bank Aid To Shore Up Confidence
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Sept. 10 Western monetary authorities, in a move to shore up financial confidence and prevent a collapse of the international banking structure, announced today that means are available and will be used if and when necessary to help banks that get into trouble through no fault of their own.

title: PLAN IS ASSAILED IN BOTH PARTIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 10 There. Was solid, bipartisan opposition in Congress today to the idea of a blanket Presidential pardon for onetime aides of Richard M. Nixon who have been charged with Watergate offenses.

title: Volunteers Fill Captains Vote Breach
description: In the face of a low turnout in the Democratic party primary yesterday, the organizations of the two candidates for Governor rode herd all day on husge getoutthevote drive's and found that they often had to rely on their own volunteers as local party, captains lagged in their efforts.

title: 10 Nations Plan Bank Aid To Shore Up Confidence
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Sept. 10 Western monetary authorities, in a move to shore up financial confidence and prevent a collapse of the international banking structure, announced today that means are available and will be used if and when necessary to help banks that get into trouble through no fault of their own.

title: BOMB IN TWA CRASH DOUBTED BY CORONER
description: ATHENS, Sept. 10 (Reuters) The Athens coroner cast doubt today on the possibility of sabotage by a bomb in the crash Sunday of a Trans World Airlines plane in which 88 people died.

title: CYPRUS EXCHANGE IS REPORTED NEAR
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept 10 (Reuters)Greek and Turkish Cypriote leaders are expected to agree on the quick release of sick and wounded prisoners and students by both sides when they meet here tomorrow, two days ahead of schedule, well informed sources said today.

title: British Query Hussein on Sale Of Weapons to South Africa
description: LONDON, Sept. 10 (Reuters) Britain was said today to be extremely disturbed by reports that Jordan has secretly sold Britishsupplied weapons to South Africa, and London has taken up the matter with King Hussein and his Government.

title: Settlers Abandon Mozambique Fight
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Sept. 10In the face of growing black anger and mob violence, white settler resistance to a plan to turn this Portuguese territory over to the black guerrilla Front for the Liberation of Mozambique collapsed suddenly today.

title: Meany Sees Boycott Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) George Meany, the president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, renewed his support Monday for the United Farm Workers efforts to organize grape and lettuce workers and asserted that the boycott against nonU.F.W. products was having an impact.

title: Democratic Race Is Close For Senator in Colorado
description: DENVER, Sept. 10Gary Hart, who managed Senator George McGovern's 1972 Presiidential campaign, took an early lead tonight over two rivals, in a close race for the Democratic nomination for senator in Colorado's primary election. The winner will run against Peter H. Dominick, a Republican, in November.

title: A BUREN BRIEFING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10.The White House counsel, Philip W. Buchen, said today that the granting of a pardon to former President Richard M. Nixon can imply guiltthere is no other reason for gratiting a pardon.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Stanley Majowski, a former Linden City Councilman, pleaded guilty to one count of an indictment charging that he operated a $500aweek numbers game at American Cynamid, his place of employment. Mr. Majowski, who resigned from the Council after his indictment last April, told Union County Judge James H. Coleman that the game had netted about $5,000 a year since 1969.

title: State School Aide Named
description: TRENTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)Howard E. White Jr., former assistant superintendent of schools in Baltimore, today was named assistant director of the Office of Equal Educational opportunity in the State Deparment of Education.

title: New Platforms Due At 11 City Stations On the Penn Central
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority announced yesterday that work would start this week on construction of highlevel platforms at 11 stations in the city on the Penn Central's Harlem and Hudson commuter lines.

title: Memo on Nixon By Jaworski Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The following memorandum to Leon Jaworshi, the Watergate special prosecutor, from his deputy, Henry S. Ruth Jr., was given to President Ford while the President was reaching a decision to grant a full pardon to former President Richard M. Nixon:

title: INCUMBENT UPSET IN RHODE ISLAND
description: PROYIBENCE, R. L, Sept. 10 (AP)A freshinan, State Representative, Edward P. Beard of Cranston, upset the incumbent United States Representative, Robert O. Tiernan, today in Rhode Island's Second District Democratic primary.

title: FORD GIVES HEATH WARM WELCOME
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10President Ford told Edward Heath today that he wanted very close relations with Western Europe, the British Conservative leader said after a onehour discussion at the White House.

title: Jeering of Kennedy Called a Disgrace By Senator Brooke
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts, said today that the treatment of his Democratic colleague, Senator Edward M. Kennedy, at an antibusing rally yesterday was a disgrace.

title: Lenient Policy Is Proposed For Pregnant Servicewomen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Defense Department has proposed a more lenient policy to permit servicewomen who become pregnant to remain on active duty.

title: Giants Cut Randy Johnson, Evans and Thompson
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 10The New York Giants continued their summer shakeup today by cutting seven more players from last year's team, including Charlie Evans, the Players Association representative, and Rocky Thompson, the No. 1 draft choice three years ago.

title: Portugal Formally. Grants GuineaBissau Freedom
description: LISBON, Sept. 10 (Reuters)Portugal today formally recognized the independence of the Republic of GuineaBissau.

title: Britain Shows a Rise In Payments Deficit
description: LONDON, Sept. 10 (Reuters  Britain's balanceofpayments on current account widened in the second quarter to 1.1billion ($2.4billion) from a deficit of 985billion ($2.3billion) in the first quarter, the Treasury reported.

title: Congressmen Win New England Races
description: CONCORD, N. H., Sept. 10Representatives Louis C. Wyman of New Hampshire and Richard W. Mallary of Vermont won Republican nominations tonight to succeed, respectively, Senators Norris Cotton and George D. Aiken.

title: Tory Platform Is Leaked, to Party's Ire
description: LONDON, Sept. 10With Britain's general election a month or so away the Conservatives narrowly ousted from office last February, are off and running, but three incidents in recent days have disrupted the steady hum of the Tory machine.

title: TALLY A SURPRISE
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey scored a surprisingly easy victory over Howard J. Samuels yesterday to win the Democratic gubernatorial nomination. Mr. Carey will oppose Governor Wilson in November.

title: Suffolk Democrats Pick O'Brien in D.A. Primary
description: YAPHANK, L. I., Sept. 10Henry F. O'Brien, the regular party candidate, overwhelmingly defeated Frederic Block, the challenger, in the Suffolk County Democratic primary for District Attorney tonight to run against the Republican incumbent.

title: Governor Cats Ribbon At Brooklyn Hospital
description: As Democrats were voting for their candidate for Governor throughout the state, Governor Wilson, the incumbent Republican, was in Brooklyn yesterday to cut a ribbon, opening the new treatment and healthcare center at Wyckoff Heights Hospital.

title: Ratchford Victor in Connecticut Race
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 10 The former Speaker of Connecti cut's House of Representatives William R. Ratchford of Dan bury, captured a Democratic nomination for Congress to night in a runaway primary election victory over Frani Santaguida, the party leader in Waterbury and the choice en the Democratic Congressior a convention last July.

title: Following Ford's Lead, Judge Frees 2 Offenders
description: GRAND FORKS, N. D., Sept. 10 (Reuters)A county judge has released a drunken driver and a traffic violator in response to President Ford's pardon of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The Arena Stage in Washington is commencing its 25th anniversary season with repertory productions of Death of a Salesman and Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? beginning Oct. 18. They will be joined by The Front Page, and all three will be performed in repertory through Feb. 16, Julius Caesar and a new adaptation of The Dybbuk also will be performed at the Arena.

title: Excerpts From Nixon Lawyer's Memorandum Against Any Indictment Move
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Following are excerpts from a memorandum submitted to the Watergate special prosecutor on Sept, 4 by Herbert J. Miller Jr. arguing in behalf of former President Richard M. Nixon against any move to indict Mr. Nixon. The memorandum was released by the White House today.

title: Police Hold Demonstration
description: GLOUCESTER CITY, Sept. 10 (AP)Offduty policemen in this Camden County community demonstrated today at the four main entrances to the community in support of a demand for an 11 per cent pay increase, plus additional fringe benefits. Patrolman James Wilson, a spokesman for the local Policemen's Benevolent Association, said other offduty patrolmen and their families would demonstrate outside City Hall.

title: U.S. Says 102 Indictments Break Amphetamine Ring
description: A network allegedly responsible for distributing all illegal amphetamine tablets in this country has been broken, Federa drug officials said last night.

title: U.S. Indicts 5 Partners Of Orvis for Conspiracy
description: Five partners in the defunct stock brokerage firm of Orvis Brothers & Co. were indicted yesterday on charges that they had falsified the company's records, overstated its capital and used securities owned by customers to obtain bank loans for the compady.

title: FASHION TALK
description: If a gently flared skirt that stops immediately below the knees is revolutionary, then it's time to man the barricades.

title: Ethiopian Prelate Favors Reforms by Armed Forces
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 10  The Patriarch of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church expressed discreet acquiescence with the reforms being engineered by the armed forces here in delivering a New Years Eve message tonight.

title: GuineaBissau's Rebel Leader
description: Look at him, an African chief of state said a few weeks ago of the leader of GuineaBissau; young, handsome, a fashion plate, and so confident. He knows his way around here betMan ter than a lot of elder African in the leaders.

title: MariaLuisa Duke Wed To F. A. de Peyster 3d
description: MariaLuisa Biddle Duke, whose father, Angier Biddle Duke, is Commissioner of the New York City Department of Civic Affairs and Public Events, was married yesterday afternoon to Frederic Ashton de Peyster 3d, whose ancestor, Abraham de Peyster, was Mayor here from 1692 to 1694.

title: About 100 Dolphins Die in Maine Alter Being Trapped in a Cove
description: EDMUNDS TOWNSHIP, Me., Sept. 10Nearly 100 whitesided dolphins have died after becoming trapped in a small cove on the west side of Dennys Bay here.

title: All Council Incumbents Appear to Be Winners
description: All of the City Council incumbents being challenged in primaries appeared to have won yesterday most of them by overwhelming margins.

title: World War Mine Detonated.
description: BROOKING, Ore., Sept. 10 (UPI)  A fourman Navy ordnance team yesterdaydetonated an armed Japanese World War II mine dredged up by a fisherman.

title: FORD MOTOR PRICES GRANADA AT $3,698
description: DETROIT, Sept. 10The new Ford Granada will carry a base price of $3,698 for two doors and $3,756 for four doors and the new Mercury Monarch a starting price of $3,764 and $3,822 respectively officials of the Ford Motor Company announced today.

title: Bond Prices Are Steady as Pace Slows
description: The trading pace slowed yesterday and prices remained steady for the most part in the Government, taxexempt and corporate bond markets. Two new offerings sold out quickly in the corporate sector where some recently issued obligations gave up a little of the ground gained in the two preceding trading sessions.

title: New Beef Grading Urged For Leaner, Chdaper, Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Department of Agriculture proposed today a new grading plan for beef that could lead consumers to eat leaner cuts and save millions of bushels of costly feed grains each year.

title: After the Pardon
description: To the Editor: It will be surprising if the unseemly haste and absolute nature of President Ford's decision to pardon Mr. Nixonbefore any charges had been brought and before any trialdo not prove to be a momentous political mistake.

title: Esposito Assesses System: It Stinks
description: Meade H. Esposito, the leader of Brooklyn's shaken regular Democratic organiza, tion, sourly sized up the peculiar twostage New York system of choosing party candidates after last night's primary in which voters rejected every one of the official statewide designees of the state convention.

title: Contracts Awards
description: The Alyeska Pipeline Service Company said yesterday at Valdez, Alaska, that more than $1billion would be spent over the next three years on construction of shipping terminal near that city for handling crude oil from the TransAlaska Pipeline. The terminal will be built, on about 1,000 acres of land across the harbor from the port of Valdez. Site preparation is under way and the terminal is expected to be ready to receive oil in 1977. More than 2,500 workers will be involved at the height of construction.

title: Monday's Fights
description: New York (At Felt Forum)Vito Antuofermo, 161 pounds, New York, outpointed Denny Moyer, 160, Portland, Ore., 10 rounds.

title: U.S. Reviews Cuba Policy Alter Signals by Havana
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 The United States has undertaken a review of its entire Cuban policy in the light of recent signs that Premier Castro is interested in starting a dialogue with this country.

title: RESOURCES CONCERN IS SUED BY THE S.E.C.
description: RENO, Nev., Sept. 10 (UPI)The Securities and Exchange Commission has, filed suit in Federal court alleging Standard Resources, Inc., of Carson City, Nev., used schemes, devices and artifices to defraud, in connection with the sale of more than 300,000 shares of common stock.

title: Nastase Triumphs By 61, 75
description: CEDAR GROVE, N.J., Sept. 10 Displaying moments of brilliance and lapses, topseeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania defeated Belus Prajoux of Chile, 61, 75, in the first round of the $50,000 Perspectus tennis tournament at the Bradford Bath and Tennis Club tonight.

title: A.C.L.U. SCORES LAW ON FUND DISCLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 10 Federal campaign laws that require political parties to disclose the names of their contributors violate constitutional guarantees of privacy and freedom of association, the American Civil Liberties Union charged today.

title: U. S. Exhibit in Austria Set
description: VIENNA, Sept. 10 (UPI)The Department of Commerce will stage its first major commercial exhibition in Austria on goods for environment protection next month, and United States Embassy spokesman said today. Twenty United States companies will participate in a combined United States stand under the sponsorship of the Department of Commerce's office of International Marketing, the spokesman said. The exhibition will be staged from Oct. 23 to 26 in Graz, Province of Styria, in southern Austria.

title: Mutual Fund Omits Dividend
description: BOSTON, Sept. 10 (AP)The board of directors of Keystone Custodian Funds voted today to omit the 10cent dividend for the third quarter, the concern announced. The fund said it needed to conserve cash in light of unsettled conditions of the securities market which has resulted in a decline in assets.

title: Mr. Nixon Resigns Again
description: In transmitting Richard Nixon's decision to resign from the California bar, his attorney has explained that the former President will be busy with matters other than law. The obvious implication is that, since Mr. Nixon will have neither the time nor the inclination to practice the profession, it would be pointless for him to retain his license.

title: 2 Asian Games Athles Dropped for DrugTaking
description: TEHRAN, Iran, Sept. 10 (AP)Iran captured eight of the 10 gold medals in GrecoRoman wrestling at the Asian Games tonight and was awarded four in weightlifting after one Japanese and one North Korean were disqualified for taking prohibited drugs.

title: Gubernatorial Race Tally
description: Gubernatorial Race Tally

title: Mrs. Grasso Asks Controls On Rising Electrical Rates
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 10 (AP) United States Representative Ella T. Grasso proposed today a number of controls for soaring electricity rates, including a requirement that all electric utilities add two public representatives to their board of directors.

title: Labor Chiefs, on Eve of White House Meeting, StandFirm for Pay Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Top labor leaders, scheduled to meet at the White House tomorrow on the inflation problem, appear in no mood to moderate their pay demands while real wages lag and tight money policies continue.

title: The Pardoner's Tale
description: Whan that August with his summer Men alle watch Judiciayre Hearyngs Til one Lord pilgrymage to San Clemente And folk do get a newe Presydente.

title: Settlers Abandon Mozambique Fight
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Sept. 10In the face of growing black anger and mob violence, white settler resistance to a plan to turn this Portuguese territory over to the black guerrilla Front fo; the Liberation of Mozambique collapsed suddenly today.

title: Fodor Is First Artist Invited by Fords
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10A young American concert violinist who recently shared top honors in the Moscow Tchaikovsky competition will become the first visiting artist to perform in the White House since President Ford took office.

title: Houston Firemen Warned Over a Sick Call Protest
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)City officials threatened disciplinary action today against 300 firemen calling in sick to protest pay and working conditions. The officials said the city had adequate manpower to meet emergencies.

title: Courageous Easily Captures Opening America's CupRace
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 10 The America's Cup is safe, quite safe. Southern Cross, the most expensive yacht ever to challenge for the 123yearold trophy, proved to be a dud today as courageous, the defender, trounced the Australian vessel in the first race of the series by 4 minutes 54 seconds.

title: PODELL LOSES BID FOR RENOMINATION
description: Defeat by Solarz Is Viewed as Setback for Esposito's Brooklyn Organization

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The New York Stars begin the second half of their World Football League season tonight (WOR, Channel 10:30 P.M.) in Portland against the Storm. The Stars, winners of six of their last eight games, have a 64 wonlost record. They beat Portland, 3816, last month. Portland has won its last two games after losing seven of its first eight games.

title: Prefontaine Runs Third
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 10 (AP)  Steve Prefontaine finished behind Lasse Viren of Finland, the winner, and Anders Gaerderud of Sweden in a 5,000meter race today. Prefontaine was timed in 13 minutes 27.4 seconds, Viren in 13:26 and Gaerderud 13:26.6.

title: Fast flight Delayed
description: LONDON, Sept. 10 (AP) The attempt of the Lockheed, SR71 to fly from Britain to Los Angeles in about four hours has been delayed at least a day for routine maintnance, the United States Air Force said today. The craft, which set a New YorktoBritain record of 1 hour 55 minutes. 42 seconds on Sept 1, had been scheduled to fly back tomorrow.

title: 48 ARE INVOLVED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 President Ford is studying the possibility of pardoning those persons convicted or accused of crimes in the Watergate and related scandals, a Presidential spokesman said today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: MORGENDIAU LEAD IS OVERWHELMING
description: Former United States Attorney Robert M. Morgentliau overwhelmingly won the Democratic nomination for District Attorney of New York County yesterday over Richard H. Kuh, who has held the job since Governor Wilson appointed him on February 13.

title: Sadat Hints Canal Opening Is Not Linked to Israelis
description: PORT SAID, Egypt, Sept. 10 (AP)President Anwar el Sadat indicated today that he planned, to open the Suez Canal to shipping even if the Israelis refused to withdraw further from their positions in the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Centennial Paperback Brings $1Million
description: Random House's editor in chief said yesterday that paper back rights to James Michener's Centennial had been sold to Fawcett for $1million, which he said was the record price for a novel. But his assertion was disputed by the president of Viking Press.

title: RABIN IS ASSURED BY FORD OF HELP
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10President Ford welcomed Premier Yitzhak Rabin of Israel to the White House today with a strong public pledge that the United States remained committed to Israel's survival and security.

title: G.O.P. Rebuffs Sandman In Attempt to Resolve Debt
description: TRENTON, Sept. 10 The Republican State Committee refused todayz to let bygones be bygones and decided instead to hold, Representative Charles W. Sanchan Jr, responsible for his $120,000 gubernatorial campaign debt.

title: Aussie Owner Blames Purely Human Error
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 10 Like a drape falling from a statue at a sculpture unveiling, the opening leg of an opening America's Cup race usually makes everything clear in a hurry.

title: Penalty for a Tax Evader: 30 Days Community Work
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 10 (AP) rA woman who pleaded guilty to incometax evasion must donate 30 days of community work as her penalty.

title: People in Sports
description: Larry Costello, coach of the Milwaukee Bucks, signed a multiyear, contract yesterday to remain with the National Basketball Association club.

description: Commmittee on World Disarmament Conference10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Dennis P. O'Connor Dies; ExMayor of Hartford, 81
description: Dennis Paul O'Connor, formealy Mayor of Hartford and a state attorney general, died Monday at his home in Hartford. He was 81 years old.

title: Eban Starts New Career At Columbia
description: In the British accent that became familiar to countless listeners to debates at the United Nations, the politicianturnededucator analyzed the world body yesterday as a forum for the, expostion of policies, not an agency for the preservation of security.

title: Vuchsberg Is Apparent Winner in Democratic Race for 2 Seats on Appeals Court
description: With 79 per cent of the vote in, Jacob D. Fuchsberg was the apparent winner of one of two Democratic nominations for two State Court of Appeals judgeships.

title: U. S. CITES 3 MAKERS OF ZIPPER SLIDERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP) Three manufacturers of zipper sliders were indicted by Federal grand jury today on pricefixing charges.

title: Notes on People Friedheim, Pentagon Spokesman, Will Be a Lobbyist for Amtrak
description: A principal spokesman for the Department of Defense during much of the war in Vietnam, Jerry W. Friedheim, Is resigning to become spokesman and Congressional lobbyist for Amtrak, the public corporation that runs the country's passenger rail lines.

title: New Tension in Bonn As Spy Inquiry Starts
description: 4 Men at Stage Center

title: Westchester's Fraction Dispute Resolved in Favor of Democrats
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 10 Supreme Court Justice John C. Marbach apparently ended Westchester's great fraction crisis today, ruling that twothirds of 17 is 12not 11when it comes to voting by the Board of Legislators.

title: Growing Dossier
description: Hopes lot an open Pesidency, marked by candor and forthrightness, threaten to become casualties of Mr. Ford's mishandling of the Watergate aftermath.

description: In Memoriam

title: Lockheed Aircraft Plans Repair Plant in Greece
description: ATHENS, Sept. 10 (Reuters) The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation is to build and operate an aircraft maintenance and repair plant in Greece, sources in the Ministry of Coordination said today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary a id Index, Page 47

title: MRS. GANDHI ACTS TO RAISE MORALE
description: MADRAS, Sept. 10Prime Minister Indira Gandhi climbed atop a platform on the beach here last night and told thousands of South Indians that the nation was facing tremendous difficulties but that the democratic system would endure.

title: Red Smith
description: James Cagney, the ruthless killer in Public Enemy and other celluloid classics, is a man of peace who is not gratified by the spectacle of one man punching another man's brains loose. However, he grew up on 73d Street in New York playing baseball and football and basketball, and he understands that man is a competitive animal.

title: TORTURE ASSAILED IN PERU'S PAPERS
description: LIMA, Peru, Sept. 10The Peruvian press has embarked on a broad campaign to end police torture and obtain effective legal guarantees for prisoners. And, in a rare display of tolerance for a LatinAmerican military regime, the Government has not only condoned the campaign but joined it.

title: Court in Tennessee Upsets Law on Teaching Evolution
description: NASHVILLE, Sept. 10 (AP)  Tennessee's 1973 Genesis law, which rekindled memories of the John. Scopes monkey trial, has been held unconstitutional.

title: Ban on Toplessness On L.I. Struck Down
description: A North Hempstead, L.I., town ordinance prohibiting barmaids, waitresses and female entertainers from appearing in certain public establishments with bare breasts was struck down yesterday by a Federal judge in Brooklyn.

title: Betsy Levitt Is Bride Of Alan D. Cohn Here
description: Betsy Levitt, director of public relations at Kenyon & Eckhardt, Inc., the advertising agency, was married here yesterday to Alan D. Cohn, a widower and partner of Wertheim & Co., Inc., investment bankers. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony in his study at Temple EmanuEl.

title: In Turkey, An Exodus By Greeks
description: ATHENS, Sept. 10It was 19 years ago to the day when we fled Turkey after a night of terror, leaving behind our business, our house and our son, the old woman recalled. He was 24 then, and today he still believes that the Greek element must not be wiped out of Constantinople, she added, referring to the Turkish city known since 1930 as Istanbul.

title: STOCKSFALL2TO1 AS DOW SLIPS 4.77
description: An absence of favorable economic news yesterday continued to depress stock prices for the second consecutive session, although the trading pace increased slightly.

title: Wholesale Giants Changes Is Arnsparger's Gamble
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 10Any time you're around a negative atmosphere, Randy Johnson was saying today, it's hard to shake it.

title: DISTRICT 1 BOYCOTT LOSES SUPPORTERS
description: A boycott of a Lower East Side school by parents protesting the removal of the school's coprincipals, both open supporters of Luis Fuentes, lost some steam yesterday as 550 of the 1,150 enrolled pupilS showed up for classes. On the opening day of school, MoInlay, 300 pupils attended.

title: Miss Mann Reelected
description: DALLAS, Sept. 10 (AP)Carol Mann was reelected president of the Ladies Professional Golf Association today.

description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
