title: Melchior Wankowicz, Writer, Dies
description: WARSAW, Sept. 10 (AP)Melchior Wankowicz, a PolishAmerican writer who had been a controversial figure in Poland, died today, the Polish Press Agency reported. He was 82 years old.

title: Caged, Like Vietnamese, for Us All
description: PITTSBURGH  Most Americans would like to believe that the war in Indochina is over. It is an unlanced boil on the national consciencethere are too many wheelchairs in sight, too many empty places at the dinner table to forget entirelybut as a nation we would prefer to consider the problems of inflation and the recoilstituting of honest government than the problems of atrocity; war crimes and guilt.

title: How Agnew's Life Has Changed: No Limousine, but Some Comfort
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The man who might have been President of the United States resides these days in a quiet Maryland subdivision and drives to work at a walkup office in a suburban shopping center.

title: Amphetamine Ring
description: The Federal authorities said last night that they had broken a network responsible for distributing all illegal amphetamine tablets in the United States. They began unsealing 102 indictments in 11 cities and arresting suspects. Page 25

title: WALDHEIM URGES TALKS ON CYPRUS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 Kurt Waldheim, the United Nations Secretary General, blamed Turkish and Greek political leaders today for relying too heavily on the presence of the United Nations peacekeeping force on Cyprus instead of working for a political settlement on the island.

title: Augelli Working With G.M.
description: NEWARK, Sept. 10 (AP)The General Motors Corporation office here has announced that former United States District Court Judge Anthony T. Augelli has begun his new job as an arbiter for company disputes with dealers. Mr. Augelli, 72 years old left the Federal judgeship he had held for 13 years in July, saying he was dissatified with his $40,000ayear salary. There have been reports that G.M. is to pay him about twice that amount, although the company did not reveal his salary in its announcement.

title: Sports Today
description: Meta vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadloWHN, 8:05 P.M.)

title: Jupiter Mainly Liquid Hydrogen, Data From Pioneer 10 Indicate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI)The planet Jupiter is a spinning ball of liquid hydrogen with a turbulent interior and raging atmospheric storms. And the mysterious Great Red Spot on the planet may be the vortex o a 25,000milelong tornado that has been towering above Jupiter's cloud belt for hundreds of years.

title: BANK OF SUFFOLK DROPS MERGER BID
description: Arthur T. Roth, chairman of the Bank of Suffolk County, said yesterday that his board of directors had withdrawn its offer to merge with the First National Bank of Glen Head. The contemplated merger, he said, could not be effectuated because issues arose that could not be re solved.

title: Norton Co. Raises Prices of Tantalum; British Steel Acts
description: The Norton Company announced yesterday at Newton, Mass., that it was rising prices by 20 per cent on its tantalummill products, effective immediately. For example, prices of capacitor grade tantalum powder Price will go up by $6 Changes a pound, or 15 to 20 per cent, effective Oct. 1. Tantalum is used in making semiconductors.

title: Kindergarten: Fun and Games or a Little More?
description: These days, some mothers go into kindergartens demanding that their fiveyearOlds be taught to read instead of making a visit to a firehouse or that they learn to add figures instead of playing house.

title: State Environmental Aide Urges Ban on FloodArea Constructiont
description: TRENTON, Sept. 10A controversial plan to control land use in floodplain areas throughout New Jersey was set forth here today by the State Environmental Commissioner, David J. Bardin.

title: Television
About New York
description: New York is, of Bourse, one of the world's biggest package deals of tension, conflict and often, to our amazement, tenderness. In all this there is an amalgam of bewilderment and confusion that makes tragedy comic and, sometimes, comedy tragic. Take the following case in point.

title: Olga Baclanova Is Deadat 74; Starred in Films and on Stage
description: Olga Baclahowa, the Russian, born stage and motionpicture actress, died Friday at Vevey, Switzerland. She was 74 year old.

title: GREECE AND TURKEY MAY GET U.S. JETS
description: WASHIGTON, Sept 10 (Reuters)  The Defense Department today awarded the McDonnell Douglas Corporation a $225.8million contract for F4E fighters, most of which are believed destined for Greece and Turkey.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal grand jury in Brooklyn handed up a new extortion indictment against Gerard Trotta, the former Public Works Commissioner of the Town of Oyster Bay, L.I., after the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York withdrew the original one.

title: At P.S. 75, the Children Will Find Their Own Pace
description: What kids learn in kindergarten they can't teach in books. They learn how to face a crowd of strangers when mommy walks out the doot. They learn how to weigh the merits of sharing a cubbyhole, how not to volunteer an answer you don't know and how to say Hello, everybody in Spanish by singing it.

title: PLAN IS ASSAILED IN BOTH PARTIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 There was solid, bipartisan opposition in. Congress today to the idea of a blanket Presidential pardon for onetime aides of Richard M. Nixon who have been charged with Watergate offenses.

title: Italian Referees Protest
description: MILAN, Italy, Sept. 10 (AP) About 160 soccer referees in Italian amateur leagues resigned today, protesting increased fan violence.

title: U.S. Five Tops Soviet
description: LANDOVER, Md., Sept. 10 (AP)David Thompson, the allAmerican from North Carolina State, tossed in 30 points tonight, leading the United States AllStars to an 8272 victory over the Soviet Union national team in the final game of their sixgame basketball series. The United States squad won five of the games.

title: Prefontaine Runs Third
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 10 (AP)  Steve Prefontaine finished behind Lasse Viren of Finland, the winner, and Anders Gaerderud of Sweden in a 5,000meter race today. Prefontaine was timed in 13 minutes 27.4 seconds, Viren in 13:26 and Gaerderud 13:26.6.

title: Appellate Panel Votes to Disbar D'Auria in Bench Improprieties
description: Appellate Panel Votes to Disbar D'Auria in Bench Improprieties

title: Farasopoulos, Safetyman, Waived by Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Sept. 10If no one claims Bill Buckley on waivers by 4 P.M. tomorrow, he and his wife will pack their clothes in their car and drive to Dallas where he will look for a job.

title: Mets Lose. As ]Expos Fnd Skid,64
description: The Montreal Expos ended their losing streak at seven games last night by beating the Mets, 6.4, at Shea Stadium. However, the Mets staged a ninthinning uprising that came close to changing the outcome.

title: Mandel and Mathias Chosen in Maryland
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 10Gov. Marvin Mandel, a Democrat, land Senator Charles McC. Mathias, an antiNixon Republican, easily won renomination in today's primaries here.

title: BREZHNEV MEETS INDIAN MINISTER
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 10Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, today met separately with senior representatives of two nonaligned countries with which the Soviet Mon has been cultivatins closer ties.

title: Gov. Askew Sweeps Primary in Florida; Millionaire Wins in G.O.P. Senate Race
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 10 Governor Reubin Askew, one of the South's new breed politicians, won a runaway victory today in the Democratic primary in his bid to become the state's first Governor to serve consecutive fouryear terms.

title: ECONOMIC WARFARE IS URGED BY CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 10 (UPI) China's leading economic official urged developing countries today to use petroleum and other raw materials as weapons of commercial warfare against the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: The Pardoner's Tale
description: President Ford obviously realized his decision to grant former President Richard M. Nixon) a full, free and absolute parj don for all Federal crimes Mr. Nixon committed or many have committed would provoke some opposition and criticism. But he seems to have utterly failed to perceive that it would produce a real shockeven in the business and investment community.

title: Temple Five Loses
description: ORTHEZ, France, Sept. 10 (AP)  Don Blackman and Phil Hickman, former Rhode Island University basketball players, led a local team to 7561 victory over a touring Temple University team tonight.

title: REALTY COMPANY INDICTED IN PLAN FOR Ft LEE BRIBE.
description: NEWARK, Sept. 10Investors Funding Corporation of New York and four of its top officials were indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of authorizing payments of $1.4million in bribes to try to win approval of plans for $250million highrise commercial project near the George Washington Bridge in Fort Lee.

title: Dance: A BatDor Debut
description: LONDON, Sept. 10There are two dance companies in Israel. The older and betterknown is the Batsheva Dance Company, which has been seen twice in New York. It was founded by the Baroness Batsheva de Rothschild. Six years ago the baroness founded the BatDor Company. The name means contemporary in Hebrew and, like the Batsheva Company itself, it has made considerable use of American choreographers.

title: jaworski Denies He Plans to Resign, and Aide Doubts Wide Defections by Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Leon Jaworski personally denied today rumors that he was about to resign in the wake of a pardon for former President Richard M, Nixon.

title: Paris: Surprise Garden at Les Halles
description: PARIS, Sept. 10President Valery Giscard d'Estaing recently added an unexpected chapter to the tumultuous history of Les Hanes. When the Paris central market moved to a southern suburb, the City Council, prodded by the Government, voted to tear down the 14 glass and castiron buildings erected by architect Baltard in the eighteenfifties to house the belly of Paris, despite vehement protest from people who insisted  and for a while proved  that they could profitably be recycled. The chief reason given by the authorities was that to preserve them would have made the construction of the Regional Express Subways central station, which is to be located at this spot, far too expensive.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Senate Votes Bill to Provide $3.1Billion in Health Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP)  The Senate passed a $3.1billion bill today to extend for four years Federal aid for neighborhood health centers, community mental health centers and migrant health centers.

title: Ally Garrett Puts Sparkle Into Songs At the Rainbow Grill
description: Kelly Garrett exudes so much sparkle and vivacity at the Rainbow Grill that even if she chose to pantomime her way through her songs, You Might swear she was singing. But she adds a voicea lot of voice, a Variety of voicesand the combination carries her brilliantly through a program that runs from the razzledazzle exuberance of I Got Love (which Melba Moore sang in Purlie) to the formality of an almost legitimate approach to It I Love Again.

title: GREEK AIDE PLANS TO SEE KISSINGER
description: BONN, Sept. 10  George Mavros, the Greek Foreign Minister, said in an informal conversation here today that he expected to meet with Secretary of State Kissinger in the United States later this month to discuss a possible new American initiative in the Cyprus crisis.

title: Quadrurplets Status Guarded
description: TAMPA, Fla., Sept. 10 (UPI)  The Riordan quadruplets, two of them receiving what doctors called ventilatory, or plumenary assistance, were reported in guarded condition today and doctors said the next 72 hours would be critical for them. The quadruplets, two boys and two girls, were born yesterday afternoon to Mrs. Terrance Riordan of Altamonte Springs, who was reported in excellent condition. The father is a doctor in the field of plant genetics.

title: News Summary and Index
description: White settlers in Mozambique gave up organized resistance to Portugal's decision to hand over the government to a black guerrilla movement. A short lived show of defiance by white crowds collapsed suddenly in the face of rising Neel( anger, vented in rieting and blockage of the highway to South Afriea. [Page, 1, Column ]

title: BacktoSchool Bells Chimed for Boys Wear Retailers
description: With unusually strong backtoschool business ringing in their cash registers, boys wear merchants from cities throughout the country have been in New York for the last three days preparing for the spring season.

title: Guild Bars 5 Writers From WNE
description: nel 13 was paying the writers $6,000, but was insisting on retaining unlimited reserve rights in, perpetuity. The current guild (pact provides for payment in instances of reuse. The guild official said that the major difference between Channel 13 and ourselves is the definition of a writer. We feel that when a producer writes he must be represented by an agreement.

title: To Cut Its Costs, Harris, Upham, Has Eliminated 8 of 81 Offices
description: Harris, Upham & Co., one of Wall Street's larger retail brokerage houses, eliminated eight of 81 offices in recent weeks in an effort to reduce costs.

title: Retail Sales Showed a Gain for August
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10Retail sales rose further in August after a strong gain in July, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: EXXON AND LIBYA NEAR OIL ACCORD
description: The Exxon Corporation confirmed here yesterday that it is in the final stages of negotiations with Libya for the possible leasing of new exploration areas under a productionsharing plan.

title: Conjugal Visit Suit Barred
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 10 (AP)  A federal judge dismissed yesterday a suit challenging Ohio prison rules prohibiting conjugal visits between prisoners and their spouses. District Judge William K. Thomas found that the state was not obligated by the Constitution to provide private places for marital relations.

title: LEGAL AID LAWYERS PLAN STRIKE TODAY
description: The Association of Legal Aid attorneys, following a breakdown in contract negotiations early this morning, voted 193 to 143 to strike the Legal Aid Society today.

title: Clark Upsets Party Choice To Run for the Javits Seal
description: Ramsey Clark, the Democrat whose insurgent candidacy was treated as a curiosity at the party convention, upset the party leaders choice yesterday and won the primary nomination to oppose Senator Jaeob K. Javits in November.

title: Rev. Paul O'Connor, Headed Xavier U. From 1955 to 1972
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 10 (UPI) The Rev. Paul L. O'Connor, chancellor of Xavier University here, and its president from 1955 to 1972, died today apparently of a stroke. He was 65 years old.

title: Kindergarten: Fun and Games or a Little More?
description: These days, some mothers go into kindergartens demanding that their fiveyearolds be taught to read instead of making a visit to a firehouse or that they learn to add figures instead of playing house.

description: The new season continued. The news series opening tonight:

title: Checking Out Computer Checkouts
description: CARTERET, Sept. 10Bane or bonanza? That was the question raised here today by a panel of consumeraffairs specialists about that new wave in the supermarkets, the computerized checkout counter.

title: Statement of Central Bankers
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Sept. 10Following is the text of the communiqu issued today by the Banlz for International Settlements.

title: So the Poor Little Lambs Won't Lose Their Way
description: NEW HAVENWelcome to the burdens which this largely permissive university imposes on you. A little regimentation, might be welcome. As wise teacher of mine once said, If the trains didn't run on time, more people would miss them.

title: New Beef Grading Urged For Leaner, Cheaper Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Department of Agriculture proposed today a new grading plan for beef that could lead consumers to eat leaner cuts and save millions of bushels of costly feed grains each year.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Greenspan Urges a Cut in Government Borrowing
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (AP) The new chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers said today the Administration must fight inflation by cutting Government borrowing, tightening the money supply and aiming for a Federal budget surplus.

title: Jury Picked to Try & Crane for Fraud In a Campaign Plot
description: NEWARK, Sept. 10 (AP)A jury of five women and seven men was selected today, to hear the Federal Court trial of former State Treasurer Joseph M. McCrane on charges he conspired to violate campaign laws.

title: TALLY A SURPRISE
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey scored a surprisingly, easy victory over Howard J. Samuels yesterday to win the Democratic gubernatorial nomination. Mr. Carey will oppose Governor Wilson in November. 7

title: prostitute Arrests Barred Under Ban on Loitering
description: DALLAS, Sept. 10 (AP)The Dallas Police Department has told its Uniformed officers that they may not arrest alleged prostitutes under the city loitering ordinaoce. But they can make arrests under a state law banning prostitution.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

They learn how to face a crowd of strangers when mommy walks out unite, door They learn how te weigh the merits of sharing a cubbyhole, how not to volunteer an answer you don't know arid how to say Hello, everybody in Spanish by singing it.

title: ISRAELIS CONDUCT GOLAN MANEUVERS
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 10Military maneuvers were conducted by Israel today on the Golan Heights for the first time since the war with the Arabs last year.

title: FUTURES IN SUGAR PLUMMET IN PRICE
description: World sugar futures were hit by an avalanche of selling yesterday, only a day after fears of damage to the Louisiana cane crop from Hurricane Carmen had sent prices surging upward.

title: Robert Cox Is Dead at 79; Last of the Keystone Kops
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Sept. 10, (AP)Robert Cox, last surviving member of the original Keystone Kops, died Sunday at the age of 79.

title: MORGENTHAU LEAD IS OVER WHELMING
description: Former United States Attorney Robert Mgrgenthatt overwhelmingly won the Democratic nomination for District Attorney of New York County yesterday over Richard H. Kuh, who has held the job since Governor Wilson appointed aim on Feb. 13.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced the arrest in Berea, Ky., of Michael Halsey Brown, 31 years old, in connection with the attempt last month to bomb the meditation room at the United Nations. Mr. Brown was arrested in his home town on the basis of an indictment, handed up by a Federal grand jury in New York on Sept. charging him with violation of Federal statutes relating the protection of the property of foreign goverments and international organizations and the protection of foreign officials and guests. Penalties for conviction range up five years in prison and a $10,000 fine.

title: Nightmare Compounded
description: The horrendous implications of President Ford's untimely pardon for Richard Nixon are finally becoming apparent to the White House. The official disclosure that the President is now considering pardons for all those convicted or accused of Watergaterelated crimes underscores the peril his rash action poses for every concept of justice, law and leadership in this democracy.

title: MORE SAFETY DATA ASKED ON CYCLAMATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Food and Drug Administration has told Abbott Laboratories that further proof of safety will be required before the company can resume marketing the artificial sweetener cyclamate that was ordered off the market in 1969.

title: Bronx Honor Student, 17, Is Honored Posthumously
description: Henry Schwartz, a 17yearold Bronx honor student who was stabbed to death last July as he tried to recover a bicycle that thieves had taken from a younger boy, was honored by the. Police Department yesterday with a public service citation.

title: Books of The Times
description: As far as I'm concerned, Evan S. Connell's new novel, The Connoisseur, is irresistible, and anyone else who has ever experienced the mystery of falling in love with an obscure object is bound to feel the same. It is not only that Mr. Connell has caught with charming simplicity the instant of seductionthe moment, in this case, when a middleaged insurance executive from New York named Muhlbach discovers in a knicknack shop in Taos, N.M., the preColumbian figurine that will change his life (Muhlbach, astonished, has paused. I want this arrogant little personage, he thinks with sudden passion. But why? Does he remind me of myself? Or is there something universal in his attitude? Well, it doesn't matter. He's coining home with me.).

title: Students in Salonica Burn U.S. Flag in Cyprus Protest
description: SALONICA, Greece, Sept. 10 (Reuters)  About 1,500 students demonstrated against the United States here tonight and burned the American flag in protest against what Greeks consider to be United States support of Turkey in the Cyprus conflict.

title: PANEL IS NAMED IN WNCN SWITCH
description: William F. Buckley Jr., the columnist, has designated a committee of prominent citizens to determine which of three radio stations might receive the records, the format and some $500,000 in pledges contributed to FM radio station WNCN.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN SLOW TRADING
description: Prices fell again yesterday in lethargic trading on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market as the anticipated afterLabor Day pickup failed to materialize.

title: Brock Breaks Record
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 10 (AP)Lou Brock stole second base in the seventh inning of the Cardinals game against the Philadelphia Phillies tonight and set a major league record of 105 stolen bases for one season.

title: Rhode Island College Dean
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Sept. 10 (AP)Dr. Noel J. Richards, an associate vice chancellor for academic and student affairs at the University of Wisconsin, hap been named dean of arts and sciences at Rhode Island College.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: KATHERINE HUPALO
description: Katherine Hupalo, who was for more than 40 years a leading dramatic actress in the Ukrainian Art Theater in this country, died on Saturday in the Valley Hospital, Ridgewood, N.J. She was 85 years old.

title: U. S. ROLE GROWS IN ARMING SAUDIS
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Sept. 10With billions in military sales at stake, the United States is making a determined effort to retain its position as the dominant supplier of arms to Saudi Arabia against competition from Britain, France and other Western nations.

title: ALLENDE SPURNED EXILE, TAPES SAY
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 10 (Reuters)  President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile refused to fly into exile during the military coup which brought his death on Sept. 11, 1973, according to tape recordings of conversations between the leaders of the coup. The tapes wre published for the first time today in a Santiago newspaper, on the ever of the first anniversary of the coup.

title: JUDGE, CITING FORD, GOES EASY ON A MAN
description: ROCHESTER, Sept. 10 (AP)President Ford's pardoning of former President Richard M. Nixon apparently helped Gordon L. Boerman escape a prisson sentence today.

title: Clark Upsets Party Choice To Run for the Javits Seat,
description: Ramsey Clark, the Democrat whose insurgent candidacy was treated as a curiosity at the party convention, upset the party leaders choice yesterday and won the primary nomination to oppose Senator Jacob K. Javits in November.

title: Bureaucratic Shuffle
description: Eight months after taking office, Mayor Beanie has announced plans to fulfill his campaign promise to dismantle three of the ten superagencies created by his predecessor, John V. Lindsay, in an, attempt to make New York's sprawling bureaucracy more manageable.

title: The End or Foreword?
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10The Nixon pardon is profoundly disturbing for what it forecasts about the Ford Presidency.

title: Victor a Veteran of Uphill Struggles
description: For the last few weeks Hugh L. Carey kept saying he was closing fast.

description: White settlers in Mozambique gave up organized resistance to Portugal's decision to hand over the government to a black guerrilla movement. A Shortlived show of defiance by white crowd's collapsed suddenly in the face of rising black anger, vented in rioting and blockage of the highway to Smith Africa. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Britain's Taylor Is Net Victor
description: CEDAR GROVE, N.J., Sept. 10  Roger Taylor, Britain's top player, showed signs of having recovered from an elbow injury that has plagued him more than four months as he defeated Bill Brown of San Luis Obispo, Calif., 7.5, 6.3, in the first round of the $50,000 Prospectus tennis tournament at the Bradford Bath and Tennis Club.

title: MARCOS STRESSES LOYALTY OF ARMY
description: MANILA, Sept. 10President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that the chiefs of the Philippine armed forces had made a pact with him at the time they instituted martial law almost two years ago that they would always submit to a civilian head of state.

title: Holy Cros Board Chairman
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Sept. 11 (AP) Donald P. Moriarty of Summit, N.J., a 1952 graduate of Holy Cross College, has been named chairman of the Holy Cross Board of Trustees. Mr. Moriarty is a partner in the New York investment firm of William A. M. Burden & Co.

title: Accord Near on Dock Pact
description: GALVESTON, Tex., Sept. 11 (AP) Negotiators worked on final language today after announcing that West Gulf deepsea longshoremen had agreed tentatively to terms for a new three  year contract. The talks were recessed overnight and

title: Rare Unity Appears in Turkey After Cyprus Victory
description: Major national problems, such as stability of democratic government, military interference in political life and the strains of inflation and labor strife in a rapidly industrializing economy are all seen here in a new and more optimistic light.

title: 2 ExOfficers of Pennsy and 3 Others Indicted on FundConspiracy Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP)  Two former Penn Central Railroad officers and three other men have been indicted on Federal charges of conspiring to misapply $4.2million in Penn Central funds.

title: STUDY IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11President Ford is not giving consideration to blanket amnesty or pardons for the Watergate defendants, spokesmen for the President said today.

title: Kunstler, In Tears, Gives 2 Indians Case to Jurors
description: ST. PAUL, Sept. 11 (UPI)William M. Kunstler, the lawyer, placed the fate of the Wounded Knee leaders, Dennis J. Banks and Russel C. Means, in the hands of a jury today and left the podium in tears.

title: Senate Unit Backs Envoys To East Berlin and Paris
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (Reuters)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today unanimously approved the nominations of new envoys to East Germany and France.

title: Ford Excels As Stars Beat Storm
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 11 (AP)A running back, Jim Ford, scored twice on 1yard runs and the New York defense did the rest as the Stars defeated Portland 3415, tonight for their second World Football League victory over the Storm this season.

title: HAROLD L. SCHWARTZ
description: Harold L, Schwarti, a lawyer with Saxe, Bacon, Bolan & Manley, died yesterday of a heart attack in Hackensack, New Jersey, Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Rutherford, N. J.

title: DOCTORS PROTEST NEW STATE RULES
description: TRENTON, Sept. 11 (AP)Angry doctors interrupted a speaker at a public hearing here today with shouts of lies, false and deMands to debate hm, forcing the hearing examiner to repeatedly ask for quiet.

title: Double Shooting in Family
description: ADA, Okla, Sept. 11 (UPI)A woman confined to a wheelchair apparently shot her 11yearold daughter and then shot and killed herself yesterday, according to the Pontotoc County sheriff's office. James L. Shirley returned to his home in Vanoss, west of Ada, from driving a school bus to find his wife dead and their daughter, Holly, critically wounded, a deputy, Presley, Snow, said. The girl was listed in serious condition at an Oklahoma City hospital.

title: Doubleday Rejects Plan By a Dissident Heiress
description: A motion by a dissident Neale Doubleday Kings, the publishing heiress, to have one of her lawyers added to the board of the company her family founded, Doubleday & Co., was voted down yesterday at the concern's annual meeting.

title: The Worst Possible Harm
description: PARIS  The day the Civil War ended, I remember being on the main plaza of Ciudad Rodrigo. I was seven years old. A pubiicaddress system kept playing Generalissimo Francisco Franco's last war communiqu: The war is over.

title: Dillon Says Wilson Frustrates Inquiry On L.I. Corruption
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 11Dennis E. Dillon, the Democratic candidate for Nassau County District Attorney, today charged Governor Wilson with deliberately attempting to frustrate investigations into charges of political corruption and misconduct in the county.

title: Senate Study Accuses Agency Of Inadequate Job Safety Action
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11A Senate study charges that threeyear Federal program to reduce job deaths and injuries has failed to concentrate on the most dangerous hazards, has resulted in unequal enforcement across the United States and has repeatedly ignored the mandates of Congress and the program's own rules.

title: WellSchooled Winner
description: State Senator Mary Anne Krupsak learned her politics from a succession of mentors. There was, for example, Prof. Richard Wade, who taught her political science at the University of Rochester, where she was majoring in voice. Professor Wade later led and managed the Presidential campaign of Senator George McGovern here.

title: Furs to Fend Off Cold Lavishly
description: For the women who love to get into their daytime diamonds and go to fashion shows, Tuesday was a doublefeature day. Since the shows starred mink and sable, the ladies were particularly entranced.

title: SUPPORT FOR FORD DECLINES SHARPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 President Ford's decision to pardon Richard M. Nixon and to consider pardons for other alleged Watergateconspirators has sapped his support among the general public, a special Gallup Poll indicates.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Nobody else wanted him. Not even for $20,000, the waiver price. But when Gabe Paul noticed Alex Johnson's name on the American League waiver sheet last week, the president of the New York Yankees didn't know that all the other league teams would ignore him. He didn't know that Alex Johnson, in his first game in a Yankee uniform, would hit a 12thinning home run Tuesday night for a 21 victory over the Boston Red Sox in the scramble for the American League East title. He knew only that Alex Johnson, despite a decade of discord with seven major league teams, might help the Yankees win., It was a throwback to the Yankees of two decades ago when they insured pennants by obtaining Johnny Mize or Johnny Sain in the season's closing weeks. It also was a clue to the desperation and determination of the Yankees of today to win for the first time since 1964, which happened to be Alex Johnson's rookie year. He was with the Philadelphia Phillies then but he would be traded to the St. Louis Cardinals, the Cincinnati Reds, the California Angels, the Cleveland Indians and the Texas Rangers, who last week decided to discard him.

title: SELDON AND ETAN BARD.
description: Seldon Bard, a partner in the New York law firm of Stein & Rosen, and his son, Etan R. Bard, were killed Sunday in the crash of the Trans World Airlines flight from Israel. Mr. Bard was 51 years old, and his son, in his senior year at Harvard, was 19.

title: Yanks Bow in 17th, 32, Then Win, 51
description: BALTIMORE, Thursday, Sept. 12The Yankees wound up losing nothing but weight this morning as they completed a doubleheader with the Orioles with a 5.1 decision after bowing, 32, in a 17inning opener.

title: 3 Visitors from Mexico Charged $167 for, a Taxi Ride
description: For three young nonEnglishspeaking visitors from Mexico, a taxicab ride from Kennedy International Airport to the Upper West Side yesterday morning was a $167 swindle that has forced the three to shorten their planned two weeks here.

title: GuineaBissau Recognized By U.S. as Independent
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP) The United States has recognized the newly independent country of GuineaBissau and has offered to establish diplomatic relations, the State Department announced today.

title: Legal Aid's Growth Created Problems
description: For nearly nine decades after its founding in 1876 by a group of merchants who hired one lawyer part time to provide legal assistance to German immigrants, the Legal Aid Society grew at a leisurely pace.

title: PARENTS KEPT OUT OF PUBLIC SCHOOL
description: School officials, fearful that parents of a boycotted Lower East Side elementary school might try to take over the school yesterday, refused to allow parents to accompany their children into the building.

description: Foreign Exchange

title: U.S. Plans to Send Wheat To Egypt Early Next Year
description: CAIRO, Sept. 11 (AP)The United States will supply 100,000 tons of wheat to Egypt in the first quarter of 1975, the Egyptian Government said today.

title: Goodell, Once a Forgotten Man, Is Now a Close Adviser to Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 Charles E. Goodell, who returned to Washington last January as an all but forgotten man, has become one of President Ford's closest personal advisers.

title: FRANCIS P. FLAHERTY
description: Francis Patrick Flaherty, who was manager of closure sales for Crown Cork & Seal Co. at his retirement in 1960, died yesterday of pneumonia at his home in New Jersey. He was 74 years.

title: La Mama's Latest. Production Is Annex, Just 2 Doors Down
description: La Mama is expanding. Next! month Ellen Stewart, the intrepid founder of this cornerstone of Off Off Broadway, plans to open the Annex, a theater space four times the size of the present La Mama (at 74A East Fourth Street). The Annex is two doors away (at 6668 East Fourth Street).

title: TEENAGED GIRLS TO LEAVE CENTER
description: By MURRAY SCHUMACH The city is rushing a program to remove all teenaged girls from the Children's Center, the municipal facility on Fifth Avenue and 104th Street where gangs of adolescent girls have terrorized other children and the staff and where rape, arson and thievery are frequent occurrences. Within six months, accord ing to plans of the Human Resources Administration, these severely disturbed adolescents will be sent to new facilities, that will have elaborate reatement programs and security arrangements.

title: Senators on Appropriations Unit Balk at Approving $850,000 Sought for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Senators on an appropriations subcommittee made it clear today that they would not approve the full $850,000 that the Ford Administration has requested to pay Richard M. Nixon's pension and expenses through next June.

title: ExTeacher Spends Only $103 To Win in Westchester. Upset
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 11 A former history teacher who spent only $103 in a primary campaign she had geared to the need to reduce election expenditures won an upset victory last night for a seat in the Assembly from Westchester County's 90th Assembly District.

title: Legal Aid's Growth Created Problems
description: For nearly nine decades after its founding in 1876 by a group of merchants who hired one lawyer part time to provide legal assistance to German imrnigrants, the Legal Aid Society grew at a leisurely pace.

title: Lawyer for Leftist Union Slain Near Buenos Aires
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 11 (UPI)A lawyer for a leftist labor union was found shot to death today with his hands tied behind his back in a northern suburb of Buenos Aires, police sources said.

title: RACIAL BIAS FOUND IN MORRIS RENTALS
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11 (UPI)Terming its ruling a precedent, the State Division on Civil Rights has found 18 apartmentcomplex owners in ParsippanyTroy Hills guilty of excluding blacks from their 5,600 housing units.

title: TV: Sierra, Paper Moon, Harry O,Movin On
description: The 197475 season continued. The new series opening tonight:

title: Wood, Field & Streatn
description: Waterfowlers should enjoy good, hunting this year, according to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: THEODORE O. SPAULDING
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 11 (AP)Theodore 0. Spaulding, the first black man to serve on the Pennsylvania Superior Court, died at his home Mon day. He was 72 years old and lived in Chestnut Hill.

title: AIDE OF M'GOVERN WINS IN COLORADO
description: DENVER, Sept. 11  Gary Hart was out pumping hands in front of supermarkets today, only a few hours after learning early this morning that he had beaten two rivals for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate in Colorado's primary.

title: 2 Men Seized in Hartford And Accused in Shooting
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 11 (AP)The police said two men, one of them wounded in the leg by the police, were apprehended after shots were fired at the police in the city's North end just after noon today.

title: Hopes of Consumers for Lower Beef Prices Shaken
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 Rains across the nation's major agricultural regions have improved range conditions enough both to reduce an expected heavy flow of cattle to markets this fall and to shake consumer hopes for a resulting decline in beef prices, an Agriculture Department report showed today.

title: U.S. Urges States To Permit Rises In Electric. Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Ford Administration officials told the states today that they must let electric utilities raise their rates and profits quickly so they can finance expansion of generating capacity and avoid what Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon called blackouts and brownouts and worse, economic stagnation.

title: 2 ExOfficers of Pennsy and 3 Others Indicted on FundConspiracy Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP)  Two former Penn Central Railroad officers and three other men have been indicted on Federal charges of conspiring to misapply $4.2million in Penn Central funds.

title: Witness Links McCrane To Fraudulent Invoices
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11Testimony in the taxfraud trial of Joseph M. McCrane, former New Jersey State Treasurer, began in Federal Court today. The charges against Mr. McCrane arise out of his fundraising activities in behalf of the 1969 election campaign of former Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Already stripped of much of his power, Emperor Haile Selassie lost the support of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church, which called for a blessing on the military revolutionary movement that has all but taken over control of Ethiopia. The 82yearold Emperor was also denounced anew by military leaders who sent troops to seize the palace of his daughter. [3:13.]

title: 125 in U.S. and Mexico Held In Illegal Amphetamines Deals
description: More than 125 persons accused of producing or distributing billions of illegal amphetamines were arrested yesterday throughout the United States and in Mexico.

title: New XRay Methods Spot More Sport Injuries, Aid in Treatment
description: Sports medicine is coming increasingly to rely on newer Xray techniques that are enabling doctors to detect more injuries that previously went undiagnosed. As a result, doctors are able to treat better the wide variety of injuries that occur among football, baseball and tennis players, golfers and participants in virtually all other sports.

title: McGrawHill Bars Sexism in Nonfiction
description: A new, nonsexist era is dawning at McGrawHill, one of the world's largest publishing houses. In a sweeping assault on sexist assumptions, the company will try to eliminate malefemale stereotypes from its nonfiction publicationstextbooks, reference works, trade journals, children's books and educational materials  to provide fair, accurate and balanced treatment of both sexes.

title: Harvard Professor May Be Named Aide To Ford's Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Phillip Areeda, a Harvard law professor and specialist in antitrust matters, will be named tomorrow as an assistant to Philip W. Buchen, the White House counsel, according to sources in the academic community.

title: At Paris Marxist Fete: Know How to Have Fun
description: PARIS, Sept. 11A million Strong, they came in special buses, in cars and on foot, formal in business suits with vests and informal in jeans and tee shirts, to pour through the gates of the Fte de L'Humanite, France's largest fair and the French Communist party's biggest fundraising event.

title: Japan to Send Special Envoy to Seoul
description: TOKYO, Sept. 11 (AP) The Japanese Government announced today that it had appointed Estusaburo Shiina, vice president of the governing Liberal  Democratic party, as a special envoy to South Korea to try to straighten out the dispute between the two countries.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: A college football season ticket for $1.25? A free football clinic for the entire family? Free games? There will he all that and more in New Jersey football circles this fall. In an effort to battle rising costs and fill stadiums, a number of colleges are offering bargain ticket plans, and with few exceptions, ticket prices are holding the 1973 line across the state.

title: Strike Force Aide Reprimanded For Taping Talk With Witness
description: The United States Attorney General, William Saxbe, has officially reprimanded. Michael Pollack, a lawyer with the Brooklyn organized crime strike force, whose taped conversations with a witness in the Superfecta harnessracefixing trial had been criticized by the presiding judge.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: EXCESS ROAD The granddaddy of New York City street festivals, the Feast of San Gennaro, begins today at noon in Little Italy. Go directly to Mulberry Street, do not pass go, and try not to eat anything for at least a week before arriving. For the Feast of San Gennaro is exactly that, a celebration of gustatory selfindulgence on an operatic scale.

title: Con Ed Note Issue Is Authorized by P.E.C.
description: Con Ed Note Issue Is Authorized by P.E.C.

title: Television
description: Television

title: Proposal in Newark
description: A proposal to create a division of Hispanic affairs under the office of the Mayor of Newark is expected to be sent to the Newark City Council within the next two weeks, a spokesman for Mayor Gibson said. Page 43.

title: F. T.C. Alleges 5 Store Chains Bilked ChargeAccount Holders
description: 'The Government charged today that five department  store chains with New York stores had bilked their chargeaccount, Customers out of more than $2.8million.

title: U.S. URGING RISES IN ELECTRIC RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Ford Administration officials told the states today that they must let electric utilities raise their rates and profits quickly so they can finance expansion of generating capacity and avoid what Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon called blackouts and brownouts and, worse, economic stagnation.

title: Excerpted Letter to Franco
description: Following are excerpts from a letter that Fernando Arrabal sent to Generalissimo Francisco Franco, and that, he said, was never answered.

title: Fassbender Eliminates Stockton
description: CEDAR GROVE, N.J., Sept. 11  Jurgen Fassbender of West Germany upset Dick Stockton of Dallas, 46, 62, 6.4, on clay in the second round today of the Perspectus Tennis Classic at the Bradford Bath and Tennis Club.

title: A Member of Gallo Gang Shot by Brooklyn Sniper
description: A longtime member of the Albert Gallo crime family was shot on a Brooklyn street by a sniper yesterday in what the police said was another episode in a war between rival factions of the Mafia.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE DECLINE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthe counter market finished lower again yesterday in continued quiet trading.

title: 69 Killed on Eastern Jet In a Crash Near Charlotte
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Sept. 11An Eastern Airlines DC9 jet smashed into a woods while attempting to land here early today, killing 69 of the 82 persons aboard. The plane, which was making an interImediate stop on Flight 212 from Charleston, S. C., to Chicago, cracked apart and burst, into flames on impact. Some of the 13 survivors were thrown clear and escaped with minor injuries, but others were seriously burned.

title: TEENAGED GIRLS TO LEAVE CENTER
description: The city is rushing a program to remove all teenaged girls from the Children's Center, the municipal facility on Fifth Avenue and 104th Street where gangs of adolescent girls have terrorized other children and the staff and where rape, arson and thievery are frequent occurrences.

title: Out Of the Wreckage
description: BOSTON, Sept. 11The Nixon pardon has been even more devastating in its impact than the first numbed reaction foresaw. It has aroused among ordinary people a dangerous cynicism about our institutions of law. It has shattered the hope for a period of political repose in this country. It has undermined confidence in the judgment of Gerald Ford.

title: Man Carrying Dynamite Yields in Tax Protest
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Sept. 11 (UPI)A delinquent taxpayer carrying six sticks of dynamite and a gun took an Internal Revenue Service agent hostage and held him for three hours today until he was assured a lien on his property had been lifted.

title: Radio
description: Talks, Sports, Events News Broadcasts

title: Record Sales and Net Income Reported by Campbell Soup Co.
description: Sales and earnings of the Campbell Soup Company set new records in the quarter and fiscal year ended July 28. In reporting the results yesterday from the company's headquarters in Camden, N.J., Harold A Shaub, president, said, however, that earnings in the first three quarters failed to keep pace with the increase in sales.

title: ORGANIZED CRIME FOCUS OF CHARGES
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11A special Essex County grand jury investigating organized crime activity in New Jersey today returned 12 sealed indictments charging 30 suspects with involvement in a wide range of criminal activities.

title: Corporate Profile
description: A struggle between two of the nation's largest companies the Dow Chemical Company and the International Paper Company to buy a small Houston oil and gas production and sales company, has become a suspense story.

title: HADASSAH FUNDS HIT $23.5MILLION
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 11Hadassah reported today that it had raised a record $23.5million this year to maintain and expand its network of medical and social services in Israel and to carry out its programs in the United States.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Abu Dhabi in Oil Pact
description: ABU DHABI, Sept. 11 (AP)Abu Dhabi has agreed to increase to 60 per cent from 25 per cent its ownership of Abu Dhabi Marine Areas, Ltd., the newspaper Alwhada reported today. It said the negotiations for the increased ownership of the oil company, which produces oil in the Persian Gulf state, from an offshore concession, were closed in London.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: One of the great treasures of medieval art, the Belles Heures of Jean, Duke of Berry, will be the centerpiece of an exhibition opening today at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Brussels Meeting Can't Reach Agreement on Export Credits
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 11Negotiators from the United States, the European Common Market and Japan were unable here today to reach a gentleman's agreement intended to prevent wasteful competition in giving credits to their trade partners.

title: Soviet Gram Crop Second Best Ever; Kremlin Goal Met
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP) Government experts said today that the 1974 grain harvest in the Soviet Union was estimated at 210 million metric tons, second only to last year's record crop and more than the goal set by Moscow.

title: 110,000 Messages Pour Into Washington on Pardon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 Since Sunday, when President Ford announced his unconditional pardon of former President Richard M. Nixon, about 110,000 telegrams, mailgrams and personal opinion messages have poured into Washington, according to Western Union.

title: Wilson Seeks to Rule Out Watergate in Campaign
description: Governor Wilson sought to rule the Watergate controversy out of the gubernatorial campaign debate yesterday, repearedly declining to offer his personal opinion of President Ford's pardon of former Presdent Richard M. Nixon.

title: Personal Finance
description: Thanks to the pension reform bill recently signed by President Ford, retirement provisions for selfemployed persons have been greatly liberalized. This farranging category includes such persons as farmers, shopkeepers, doctors, lawyers, writers, accountants and portrait painters.

title: Senators Already Seeking A Zaretzki Replacement
description: Barely hours after Joseph Zaretzki, majority leader of the State Senate, conceded defeat to Assemblyman. Franz S. Leichter, who sought the nomination for the Zaretzki seat, the first tentative maneuvering began yesterday among the Senate's Democrats to pick a successor to the man who has been their leader since 1957.

title: Senate Panel, 70, Rebuffs Ford On Deferral of Federal Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Setting the stage for the first Congressional confrontation with President Ford, a Senate committee voted unanimously today to reject Mr. Ford's decision to delay for three months a 5.5 per cent pay increase for 3.6 million Federal employes.

title: EVELYN F. BINGHAM
description: Evelyn Feakes Bingham, former wife of the late Wheelock H. Bingham, who was president of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc. died Tuesday at her home, 35 East 75th Street. She was 67 years old.

title: Desert Vixen, $15.60, Takes Maskette
description: Desert Vixen, the champion of her class last year as a 3yearold, demonstrated yesterday that she has returned to that excellent form. Competing in the $59,750 Maskette Handicap at Belmont Park, Harry Mangurian's colorbearer beat an excellent field over a mile with a stakes record time.

title: Mets and Cards Tied After 24 Innings
description: The Mets tied the record for the longest major league night game this morning in a contest with the St. Louis Cardinals at Shea Stadium. The score was 33 after 24 innings.

title: Carter Hawley Stores Named in Civil Complaint
description: A $35million class action civil fraud complaint has been filed by an accident insurance policy holder against the First Colony Life Insurance Company, and against the Broadway Department Store and its parent company, Carter Hawley Hale Stores, Inc., Los Angeles.

title: PROTEST BY CREW STOPS THE FRANCE
description: PARIS, Sept. 11The crew of the France stopped the transAtlantic liner and dropped anchor off Le Havre today in a new protest against a Government decision to remove the liner from service.

title: Primaries: As Usual, Most Incumbents Won
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 This was supposed to be a terl.fble year for incumbents. All of them  so the theory went  would be perceived by the voters as part of the problems of corruption and unresponsiveness rather than part of the solution. Well, it would be hard to read that pattern into yesterday's primary election returns in 13 states and the District of Columbia.

title: NEW LAW SOUGHT ON TAXDATA USE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 The Administration proposed legislation today that would make it more difficult than it is now for some Government agencies to gain access to incometax returns but that would impose no restrictions whatever on the access of the President or any of his aides.

title: ALIIRIGEIT URGES VARIABLE RATES
description: A high state banking official, predicting no letup in savings outflows, pushed yesterday for variable rate mortgages and variable rate interest on deposits.

title: HOME MORTGAGES ADVANCE IN RATES
description: Interest rates on conventional home mortgage loans from early July to early August Increased substantially, Thomas R. Bomar chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, announced yesterday.

title: Brooklyn Union Wins 19.8% Rate Increase
description: The Public Service Commission, by a 3to2 vote, yesterday authorized the Brooklyn Union Gas Company to increase its rates to 1,165,000 household gas customers in Brooklyn, Staten Island and most of Queens by 19.8 per cent.

title: Jersey Power Is Turned Down In Bid for $33Million Increase
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11  The Board of Public Utility Commissioners turned down today a request by the Jersey Central Power and Light Company for a $33.1million rate increase to go into effect on Sept. 15.

title: People and Business
description: Dark days ahead for the insurance business were foreseen by B. P. Russell board chairman of Crum & Forster, one of the nation's largest insurance companies.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Congress Returns to Find Watergate Still a Burden
description: WASHINGTON, Sept.11 The Congress that went away last month heaving sighs of relief returned in force today to find that Watergate had not gone away.

title: ALRIGHT URGES VARIABLE RATES
description: A high state banking official, predicting no letup in savings outflows, pushed yesterday for variable rate mortgages and variable rate interest on deposits.

title: Funds Are. Lacking To Televise Meeting
description: There will be no live television coverage of today's regional White House conference on inflation in Atlanta. The two previous sessions, in Washington, were televised over the Public Broadcasting Service.

title: HIDDEN TIRE PRINT CATCHES A SLAYER
description: An ax murderer in Britain has admitted his guilt after learning that the tires of the car in which he hid his victim's body had left an imprint made visible by ultraviolet light. He was then sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: Books of The Times
description: Euphoria is what I feel when I find a writer who uses language as if it had never been debased, as if it came shining and newly minted from the best of all possible dictionaries. When I realize that I will not have to uncrumple this muchcrumpled thing, that an author has freely given me his meaning with all the generosity of which English is still capable, I feel as Robert Frost did after reading D. H. Lawrence's poems: I wanted to go to that man, he declared, and say something to him.

title: 26 Die in Zambia Bus Crash
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 11 (Reuters)Twentysix persons, including a member of Parliament, were killed on Monday in what is believed to be Zambia's worst bus disaster. President Kenneth Kaunda declared a day of national mourning.

title: British Cigarette Ads Carrying Tar Content
description: LONDON, Sept. 11 (AP)Cigarette advertisements in Britain began carrying an indication of the tar content today as a result of the Government's antismoking campaign.

title: Albania Said to Purge Defense Chief in Dispute
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 11 (Reuters)The Albanian Defense Minister, Beqir Balluku, has been stripped of all Government and Communist party posts, authoritative Yugoslav sources said today.

title: Bridge:
description: In small tournaments away from the big metropolitan areas it is not uncommon for one or two players to dominate the proceedings and capture two or three titles. In New York tournaments, however, the fields are bigger and the players more expert, so that the competition is fierce. Double victories are rare and triples almost unheard of.

title: McCrane Trial Witness Tells of Bogus Invoices
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11The former head of a Cherry Hill public relations concern testified today that he had issued fictitious invoices to several companies at the direction of Joseph M. McCrane, the former State Treasurer, as a means of raising money for William T. Cahill's 1969 gubernatorial campaign.

title: Rockefeller to Disclose His Net Worth
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 The Senate Rules Committee voted today to ask Nelson A. Rockefeller to make a full public disclosure of his net worth before the committee opens hearings on his nomination as Vice President. The panel also decided today to start the hearings on Sept. 23.

title: Excerpts From Talks by Ford and Meany
description: Let me at the outset wish, you all a good morning and to express my deep appreciation for your attendance at this very important and critical meeting.

title: Bethlehem Steel Says It May Need Pricing Increases
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation warned yesterday that it might raise prices again this year if costs kept rising and threatened coal strike materialized.

title: MorgenthauKuh Contest To Be Repeated on Nov. 5
description: A rerun of the bitter contest for District Attorney of Manhattan was scheduled yesterday for the Nov. 5 general election between Robert M. Morgenthau, now holding both Democratic and Liberal nominations, and District Attorney. Richard H. Kuh as Republican nominee.

title: Nets in Marathon; Yanks Beaten in 17, Then Take 2d Game
description: The Mets and St. Louis Cardinals played the longest night baseball game, on record last night as they went into the 25th inning at Shea Stadium tied at 33.

title: U.S. Sets Special Duties On Some Shoe Imports
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11The Treasury, announced today that it would impose special countervailing duties on imports of shoes from Spain and Brazil on the ground that the governments of those two countries were subsidizing their exports, mainly through special tax rebates.

title: Events Today
description: TODD WILSON, organist, St. Thomas Church, 12:10.

title: Ralph Ogden, 79, Founded Storm King Arts Center
description: Ralph E. Ogden, a manufacturer and art patron, died yesterday at Cornwall (N. Y.) Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at Glenoden Farm, Mountainville, N. Y.

title: Ukrainian Injustice
description: Despite alternating tactics of persuasion and oppression, the Soviet authorities in Moscow still find themselves stymied by the tenacity of the dissident nationalist movement in the Ukraine, second most populous republic of the Soviet Union.

title: KISSINGER MEETS ISRAEL'S PREMIER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 Premier Yitzhak Rabin of Israel began a round of talks today with Secretary of State. Kissinger and later told newsmen that he was confident the United States would meet Israel's security requirements as part of an overall effort to insure peace in the Middle East.

title: Ford Uses Golf as Example in Reconciliation Plea
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Sept. 11President Ford renewed his appeal tonight for understanding and reconciliation as he dedicated an enterprise called the World Golf Hall of Fame here in the sandhills of North Carolina.

title: Government in Chile Announces A Relaxing of Military Pothers
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 11 (Reuters)Chile's military Government marked the first anniversary of the overthrow of President Salvador Allende Gossens today by announcing the ending of some of the absolute martial powers it has been exercising.

title: Relative Describes Nixon As in Pain and Depressed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP)Former President Richard M. Nixon is in physical pain and remains way down, very depressed despite the pardon he received, a member of his family reports.

title: BOSTON IS TENSE ON EVE OF BEN
description: BOSTON, Sept. 11 This tense city faces the opening of school tomorrow with the prospect of a massive boycott by whites over courtordered busing to achieve integration.

title: U.S. Sets Loan to Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 11 (UPI)The United States signed a $17.2million loan agreement today with South Korea to assist in expanding production of rice and barley. The agrement was signed by the Korean Deputy. PremierEconomic Planning Minister, Tae Wan Sun, and Michael H. B. Adlier, director of the Agency for International Development in Korea.

title: Bonn Cabinet Votes $340Million in Aid To Building Industry
description: BONN, Sept 11The West German Cabinet decided today to pump nearly $340million into the building industry, which has been hardhit by two years of high interest rates and antiinflationary policies.

title: Pound Foolish
description: Community colleges throughout the country serve a highly specialized and vital role in making higher education responsive to the need for skilled, suhprofessional manpower. In a city as big as New York, with thousands of young people who need an opportunity escape from poverty through the acquisition of marketable skills, the twoyear community college is the appropriate and often the only answer.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: NEWS INDEX

title: SUPPORT FOR FORD DECLINES SHARPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 President Ford's decision to pardon Richard M. Nixon and to consider pardons for other alleged Watergate conspiratots has sapped his support among the general public, a special Gallup Poll indicates.

title: Pennsylvania Ballet Grows in Brooklyn
description: The lure of New York draws dancersaway from ballet companies all over the country, but the Pennsylvania Ballet is trying to put that magnetism to use for its own benefit. The company hopes to propel itself into national prominence by making regular appearances at the Brooklyn Academy of Music while maintaining its home for the rest of the year at the Philadelphia Academy of Music.

title: Barkum Is Healthy, Rusty and Eager for Jets Opener
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., Sept. 11 When Jerome Barkum plays wide receiver for the Jets, he's the target for Joe Namath's passes and for defensive backs ferocious tackles. Sometimes, though, Barkum makes other people his targets, as when he pours water on them from 10 floors up in the Hofstra University dormitory.

title: Del Gaizo No Stranger to Giants Huddle
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Sept. 11Jim Del Gaizo is convinced that being traded to the New York Giants couldn't have worked out better for me.

title: 69 Killed on Eastern Jet In a Crash Near Charlotte
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Sept, 11An Eastern Airlines Dcjet smashed into a woods while attempting to land here early today, killing 69 of the 82 persons aboard. The plane, which was making an intermediate stop on Flight 212 from Charleston, S. C., to Chicago, cracked apart and burst into flames on impact. Some of the 13 survivors were thrown clear and escaped with minor injuries, but others were seriously burned.

title: LEFKOWITZ PLANS FUELPRICE STUDY
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that his investigation of oil company pricing practices would look into the reasons for differences between fuel prices in New York City and Nassau County and the rest of the country.

title: CYPRIOTES AGREE TO FREE CAPTIVES
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept. 11 (Reuters)Talks between Greek Cypriote and Turkish Cypriote leaders got off to a hopeful start today with agreement on the release on both sides of youths, teachers and the sick and wounded who are prisoners.

title: State Primary Returns Are Unusually Incomplete
description: Unofficial returns were unusually incomplete in this year's statewide primary election, with six Congressional and nine State Senate nominations anion the undecided races when cooperative newsgathering of vote tallies ended at 3:15 P.M. yesterday.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX

title: Basque Killed in Clash
description: BILBAO, Spain, Sept. 11 (UPI)  One person was killed and five wounded in two downtown gun battles today between policemen and Basque separatist guerrillas. The dead man was a Basque separatist.

title: 8 SENATORS ASK FULL NIXON DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Eight members of the Senate Judiciary Committee asked the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, today to include a full and complete record on former President Nixon's involvement in the Watergate scandals when a final report on the prosecutor's work is made to Congress.

title: Newark Council Will Get Plan for a Hispanic Aide
description: NEWARK, Sept. 11A proposal for the creation of a division of Hispanic affairs under the office of the Mayor is expected to be sent to the City Council within the next two weeks, a spokesman for Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson said today.

title: Colt Brings $73,000 At Keeneland Sale
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 11 (AP)The Keeneland Fall Yearling Sale completed its afternoon session today and reported 731 colts had been sold at an average of $10,712 during the three days of the sale.

title: SENATE PANEL TRIMS SOCIAL PLAN FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP)The Senate Appropriations Committee approved today a $32.9billion appropriation for the Labor and Health, Education and Welfare Departments, which was $630million less than the Administration had requested.

title: Morgenthau Triumph
description: In the race for the Democratic nornination for Manhattan District Attorney, Robert M. Morgenthau's threetoone triumph over incumbent Richard Kuh makes him a heavy favorite in their rematch in November when Kuh's name will appear in the Republican column.

title: Maryland Picks 2 Women For Senate and Governor
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 11It was Ladies Day at the polls in Maryland yesterday.

title: Paradoxical Primary
description: New York's Democratic voters have upset the backstabbing manipulations of party leaders in a primary that serves as a forceful reminder to political strategists everywhere that nobody can take the electorate for granted in this postWatergate election season.

title: Six in Church Group Die
description: AUSTIN, Minn., Sept. 11 (AP) A minister and five members of his congregation were killed today when a twinengine airnone exploded and plummeted into a cornfield 12 miles northwest of Austin. They were identified as the Rev. Eugene Whitcomb, 41 years old, the pilot; Gary Larson, 27; Thomas Carp, 19; George Davis, 35; Stephen Held, 20, and Charles Hakes, 26, all of Rockford, Ill.

title: Ford Pledges More Job Funds In a Blunt Session With Labor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 President Ford, opening a blunt giveandtake discussion with the nation's most powerful labor leaders, said today that he was taking immediate action to make more Federal money available for public service employment.

title: France's Crew Rebels
description: The crew of the liner France stopped the ship and dropped anchor off Le Havre last night to protest the Paris Government's decision to remove the vessel from service. There were 1,266 passengers aboard. Page 7.

title: Senator Church to. Press C.I.A. Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Declaring that deception of Congress has become a habit, Senator Frank Church said today he would turn over any misleading testimony in the hearings on policy toward Chile to the Justice Department for investigation into possible perjury.

title: GROCER SHOT DEAD IN EAST NEW YORK
description: A 48yearold Brooklyn grocer was fatally shot during a holdup attempt last night.

title: American Kennel Club To Increase Fees Oct. 1
description: The fees to register dogs, litters, transfers and duplicates are going up at the American Kennel Club. It will be the first increase for fanciers in five years.

title: Jersey Group Seeks Voters Rejection Of Casino Gambling
description: TRENTON, Sept. 11A newly formed committee of state legislators, present and former law enforcement officials, church spokesmen and private citizens opened what it called a grassroots campaign today to oppose casino gambling in New Jersey.

title: PIERRE L'ESPERAKCE
description: Dr. Pierre L'Esperance, a Canadian cancer specialist who was doing research at the SloanKettering Institute here, was among those killed Sunday when a Trans World Airlines jet crashed near Greece.

title: Official Death Toll Is 100 as Violence in Mozambique Subside
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, Sept. 11Violence and rioting appeared to subside here today as the Portuguese territory of Mozambique moved nearer to selfgovernment under black, leadership.

title: Volkswagen Plans Layoff
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Sept, 11. (AP)  Volkswagen announced its seventh layoff of the year today. The West German auto producer Said 49,000 workers would be hid off from Sept. 23 to Sept 2.

title: Marcos Frees Some Foes As an Act of Compassion
description: MANILA, Sept. 11Former Senator Jose W. Diokno, a principal political foe of President Ferdinand E. Marcos, was released today after nearly two years of detention.

title: Second Race Is Off, SecondGuessing On
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 11A blanket of fog that showed no respect for either side forced an early cancellation of America's Cup action today, keeping the fleet in port and the reality of Southern Cross in doubt.

title: The Vietgate Solution
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 11  After an eighteenmonth orgy of recrimination, the White House floated a trial balloon for an orgy of forgiveness didn't stay up for long.

title: County Leaders Appear Winners in Two Parties
description: Democratic and Republican county leaders in the city whose posts are at stake this year appeared yesterday to be assured of reelection, on the basis of returns from Tuesday's primary.

title: 2 TEACHER STRIKES ARE SETTLED ON LI,
description: MINEOLA, LI., Sept. 11Teacher strikes in two Nassau County school districts ended today when agreements were reached on new contracts.

title: 6 Die in Plane Explosion
description: AUSTIN, Minn., Sept. 11 (AP) six persons aboard a twinengine private plane werg killed today when it exploded inn the air and plunged to earth, the authorities said. Identities of the dead were not immediately known.

title: Back to Politics
description: President Ford's grant of a prethature unconditional pardon to Richard Nixon and the subsequent contradic tory White House statements on possible pardons for other Watergate characters appear to have shattered the ceasefire between Democrats and Republicans, which briefly had created at least the semblance of a national coalition to deal with the transition of power and with urgent domestic problems.

title: Meeting Today on Inflation To Discuss Housing Woes
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 11While labor and the economy were being discussed in Washington today, final preparations were under way here for the next session in President Ford's series of economic meetings, which will be held here tomorrow and will deal, with the severely depressed housing industry and construction generally.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Star BoxOffice Films Cashing In as TV Winners
description: For all the new program series that make up a television season, the heavy ammunition for mass audience at the networks remains a product created for another medium, the boxoffice movie.

title: Lazard Will Plan Eastern Air Finances
description: Eastern Airlines, encouraged by the recent switch from huge operating losses to profits but still burdened by heavy debt, retained Lazard Freres & Co. yesterday to devise a longterm formula for restructuring its finances.

title: Fassbender Eliminates Stockton
description: CEDAR GROVE, N.J., Sept. 11  Jurgen Fassbender of West Germany upset Dick Stockton of Dallas, 46, 62, 64, on clay in the second round today of the Perspectus Tennis Classic at the Bradford Bath and Tennis Club.

title: Senate Votes 85 fo 0 For 55 M.P.H. Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP)The Senate voted 85 to 0 today to make the 55mileanhour national speed limit permanent.

title: ETHIOPIA MILITARY ASSAILS EMPEROR
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 11  The Military group that has continued to increase its control of Ethiopia broadcast a denunciation of Emperor Haile Selassie today and sent troops to seize the palace of his daughter.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 11 (AP)V. S. Chauhan won India's first gold medal and set an Asian Games decathlon record with 7,395 points today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Aug. 26 editorial on the world's oil crisis emphasizes, as you have commendably done in the past, the need for conservation and cooperation by the oilimporting countries to cut demand, share supply, arrange adequate financing of the skyrocketing costs of imported oil and expand efforts to get oil prices reduced. But once again your concern with the worldwide implications of exceptionally high and clearly disruptive oil prices neglects major component of the strategy urgently needed to persuade the oilexporting countries to reduce their prices. The same component is essential to persuading producers of other critical materials in the socalled Third World to opt for constructive policies on the production and pricing of the materials they control.

title: 3 Visitors Pay $167 for a Cab Ride
description: For three young nonEnglishspeaking visitors from Mexico, a taxicab ride from Kennedy International Airport, to the Upper West Side yesterday morning was a $167 swindle that has forced the three to shorten their planned two weeks here.

title: NILSSON CANCELS RECITAL IN ANGEP
description: Birgit Nilsson, the Swedish dramatic soprano, has withdrawn from Lincoln Center's Great Performers series amid a Wagnerian dispute involving charges of blackmail and suggestions of duplicity.

title: Calvin Klein Puts Together Resort Clothes for Just Having Fun
description: Seventh Avenue, which is showing its resort collections, had a hit yesterday morning and several hundred jaded retailers stayed in their seats applauding madly until Calvin Klein, looking rather ashen, came out to take a bow. He hadn't left his workroom in fotir days, he explained to those who pressed around, calling him the American Saint Laurent.

title: U.S. Says Soviet Vessels Are Cruising Off Hawaii
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11 (AP) The Pentagon said today thata Soviet Naval force was cruising in the waters off the Hawaiian Islands for the first time since 1971.

title: Ethiopian Military Assails the Emperor
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Sept. 11  The military group that has continued to increase its control of Ethiopia broadcast a denunciation of Emperor Haile Selassie today and sent troops to seize the palace of his daughter.

title: Met. Golf Lead Shared by Four
description: OCEANSIDE, L. I., Aug. 11A native of Argentina, Carlos Puebla of the Meadows Golf Club in Lincoln Park, N. J., shared the lead today after the first round of the 59th Metropolitan open with a threeunderpar 69 over the 6,590yard Middle Bay course.

title: People in Sports
description: Anders Haugen, now 86 years old, and a pioneer member of the Lake Tahoe (Calif.) Ski Club, will finally receive the bronze medal he won at the first Winter Olympics in Chamonix, France, in 1924. He originally was placed fourth in the jumping, behind Thorlief Haug of Norway. But at a reunion of the Norwegian team last February, Thorlaf Stromstad, who had won two silver medals at the games brought a copy of the official results showing that Haugen had made the longest jump of the day and that the scores had been added incorrectly. So Haugen will become the first American ever to win an Olympic ski medal.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A newspaper deliverer has filed a suit in Superior Court in Freehold seeking to overturn Ocean Grove's 104yearold law against worldly employment on the Christian Sabbath. The plaintiff, Robert E. Schaad, said he and his predecessors had been delivering Sunday newspapers in the parly morning for years with the consent of the local police and the Ocean Grove Camp Meeting Association, which runs the town. He was given a temporary restraining order allowing him to stay in business while the suit is tried.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Many snack foods, as nutritionists keep saying, are bad for your health. They are also usually bad for your pocketbook. On top of all that, sometimes they do not even fulfill their function of satisfying a sweet tooth or quelling a hunger pang.

title: Labor Leaders Ask Ford To Spur Economy, Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11Labor leaders attending the second White House conference on inflation here today advocated steps to stimulate the economy and create more jobs rather than a continuation of antiinflation policies that they contended would worsen the recession.

title: Economic Gloom Pushes Stocks Lower
description: The stock market continued in the doldrums yesterday for the third consecutive session as investors concern over the state of the economy pushed prices lower in quiet trading.

title: Wood, Field&Stream
description: Waterfowlers should enjoy good hunting this year, according to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: DOROTHY STEADMAN
description: Dorothy Marie Fawick Steadman, the wife of Charles W. Steadman, board chairman and president of the Steadman Security Corporation, a Washington investment concern, died Tuesday of cancer at the Washington Hospital Center. She was 59 years old and lived in Palm Beach, Fla., Washington and New York.

title: BIG ASKEW VICTORY SPURS TALK OF 76
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 11 The size of Gov. Reubin Askew's victory in yesterday's Democratic primary in Florida has rekindled speculation that he may be a possible VicePresidehtial candidate in 1976 despite his statement that he wants only to be Governor.

title: Lectures Relate Classics to Modern Idiom
description: Tales of strange appetites await lunchtime strollers at the Museum of Modern Art these days, with talk of such things as Cronos eating his Titan kin or Prometheus being gnawed at by Zeus's crows.
