Dolphins, Fit Again, Beat Bills
JORDAN REBUFFS EGYPTSYRIA BID
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: ATTACKS WILSON RETREAT
description: Representative Hugh L Carey, the recipient last wee of several strongly worded at tacks from Governor Wilson'. camp, went on the attack him. self yesterday and accused hit Republican opponent of ad. vocating big buildings and big highways without considering environmental issues.

title: Bridge: SecondHand Plays Require Haste to Avoid Aid to Rivals
description: Secondhand plays by the defender represent an area in which many go astray. Players know that in general they should play secondhand low, but they pick the wrong moments to breach this old whist rule. What makes it more difficult is that secondhand plays must be made quite promptly to avoid giving useful information to the declarer.

title: Islanders, North Stars Tie
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept. 22 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars and the New York Islanders battled to a 22 tie last night in an exhibition game. Ralph Stewart and Doug Rombough scored for the Islanders.

title: Autumn Arrives Here At 5:59 A.M. Today
description: Heralded by a spell of unmistakable fall weather, autumn makes its formal debut here today for a threemonth engagement.

title: Choloma: Impoverished Little Town That Perished Under a Wall of Mud
description: CHOLOMA, Honduras, Sept. 22We woke up and the water was already up to our waists, the young woman said. We climbed onto the roof of our house, but the roof collapsed, and three of my little sisters were swept away.

title: Scapegoat for Inflation
description: In a series of regional gatherings, representatives of much of American industry have been trying to pin a large share of the responsibility for inflation on government efforts to clean up the environment. Their arguments are for the most. part misleading; they are selfserving and potentially harmful to the country.

title: Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: KENNEDY REVEALS HIS PLANS TODAY
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy will disclose his political plans this morning, and there are strong indications that he has decided not to seek the Presidency in 1976.

title: Howfield's Kick Decides As End Brings Dispute
New Jersey Briefs
description: Faced with a courtordered Dec. 31 deadline, and under growing pressure from several mayors, state legislators will meet in small groups this week to try to come up with new proposals to produce revenues to finance public education.

title: Park Seems Ready to. Ease Seoul Curbs
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 19  Political adversaries of President Park Chung Hee are stirring again. But the President, instead of cracking down, appears ready to give them some freedom if they don't step over a carefully been line it has been drawn politically quiet here since the death of the President's wife by an assassin's bullet on Aug, 15. Korean energies and emotions have been directed against Japan, where, it was charged, the assassination conspiracy had been plotted.

title: Deserters Processed for Discharge
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 22The calls came in slowly first The voices were often tense and untrusting, revealing men and occasionally women who were hesitant to give real names or addresses and sometimes suspicious of the conditional amnesty offered by pres. ident Ford.

title: SYNAGOGUE HOLDS A CONSECRATION
description: A Torah scroll was carried yesterday under a wedding canopy lifted aloft by four members of the Sutton Place Synagogue as the 75year. old Orthodox congregation consecrated its groundbreaking for a new house of worship on East 51st Street.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: When the Legislature authorized a $2 surcharge on the state's automobile insurance policyholders the other day, to cover the liabilities of the insolvent Gateway Insurance Company, it appears that it left some room for variables in the assessment.

title: India Ousts Soviet Union In Davis Cup
description: POONA, India; Sept. 22 (AP)India, led by the Amritraj brothers, advanced to the 1974 Davis Cup final by defeating the Soviet Union today in their semifinal series.

title: Study Here Shows More Living Alone Throughout the City
description: Asserting that New York City was becoming more and more composed of oneperson households, a study by the research department of the Community Council of Greater New York has said that from 1960 to 1910, the number of such households rose by 199,000, or almost 39 per cent.

title: Instant Replay Is Not Umpire's Best Friend
Green Revolution Passes Over Asia Without Expected Upheaval
description: LOS BANOS, Philippines, Sept. 20Studies in half a dozen Asian countries show that the introduction of revolutionary highyielding rice varieties is not making the rich richer and the poor poorer, as many social scientists had predicted it would.

title: Police Say Stricter Gun Rules Have Reduced Number of Killings by Officers
description: The Police Department says that stricter firearms guidelines and revised training procedures have sharply reduced in the last two years the number of civilians shot to death by policemen and the frequency with which the police use their weapons.

title: Supplies for Honduras Collected in New York
description: The Honduras Emergency Committee issued an appeal yesterday for food, clothing, medicine, and other supplies to aid more than 50,000 persons left homeless in the wake of the hurricane designated Fifi.

title: Service for Cyprus Dead
description: Foreign Minister George Mavros of Greece and Spyros Kypriatou, of the Cyprus delegation to the United Nations, attended a memorial service at the Cathedral of the Holy Trinity yesterday for victims of, the recent war on Cyprus.

title: NonWage Aid to Workers Proposed
description: A novel plan aimed at fighting inflation by helping workers catch up on their lost purchasing power through means other than wage increases will be presented today by a leading Democratic economist to the minisummit on inflation.

title: Italy's First Lady: Effective Booster for Her Country's Fashions
description: When President Giovanni Leone of Italy pays a state visit to Washington on Wednesday, the slender, attractive woman with the thick, dark wavy hair at his side is bound to command more than the usual attention.

title: U.N. Aide Arrives in Peking For Talks on Environment
description: PEKING, Sept, 22Maurice Strong, the Canadian head of the Nairobibased United Nations Environment Program, arrived here tonight as a guest of China's new Environment Protection Office.

title: Advertising
description: New York has joined a growing list of markets that have established their own advertising selfregulation system modeled after the threeyearold National Advertising Review Board.

title: 2 Inmates Held in Stabbing
description: WINDSOR, Vt., Sept. 22 (AP) Two unidentified inmates at the Vermont State Prison are being held in connection with the stabbing of a prison guard, according to the authorities. Warden Paul Davallou said George Sanborn, guard, was supervising prisoners in the arts and crafts area of the prison when he was attacked and stabbed yesterday afternoon. Mr. Sanborn was treated and released from a local hospital.

title: HILDA SEGALL
description: Hilda Segall, mother of Earl Ubell, news director of WNBCTV, died Saturday of a heart attack at her home, 1503 East 98th Street, Brooklyn. She was 69 years old.

title: CITY COLLEGE GETS $400,000 FROM U.S.
description: Robert Marshak, president of City College, announced yesterday that the Federal Government had awarded a $400,000 grant to the college's controversial new accelerated medicaltraining programs.

title: Moses Is Honored on L.I. His Service to Parks
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I, Sept 22On a private estate that he helped make obsolete, Robert Moses was honored tonight for his contribution to public parks.

title: YONKERS POLICEMAN DIES OF GUN WOUND
description: YONKERS, Sept. 22A 34yearold Yonkers patrolman died this morning of a gunshot wound he received Tuesday night when he interrupted holdup at an A&P supermarket here.

title: Dr. Dorothea McCarthy, 68, Child Psychologist, Dead
description: Dr. Dorothea McCarthy, child psychologist who taught in Fordham University's graduate department of psychology for 40 years, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N.Y. She was 68 year old and lived at 85 Dartmouth Avenue, Yonkers.

title: 7 Narcotics Dealers Flee U.S. Jail Here; Inside Aid Suspected
description: Seven narcotics dealers, including two major French heroin smugglers, escaped from the Federal House of Detention on West Street here yesterday afternoon in what authorities described as a we'llplanned, wellexecuted operation that suggested the complicity of prison personnel.

title: FASTTRIAL BILE PUSHED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Despite powerful judicial opposition, influential House leaders are pressing for final passage of a controversial bill that would ultimately require Federal courts to bring a criminal defendant to trial within 90 days of his arrest or dismiss the charges against him.

title: Jacqueline Susann Dead at 53; Novelist Wrote Valley of Dolls
description: Jacqueline Susann, whose 1966 book, Valley of the Dolls, became the world's bestselling novel and made her name a household word, died of cancer Saturday night at Doctors Hospital. She was 53 years old.

title: Guyana to Tax Reynolds
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Sept. 22The Government of Guyana announced over the weekend that it would introduce legislation Wednesday imposing a levy of $7million on bauxite produced in 1974 by the Reynolds Mines Guyana Ltd., a subsidiary of the Americanowned Reynolds Metals Company.

title: Man, 53, Has Heart Attack And His Car Kills Pedestrian
description: A 74yearold Bronx man was killed yesterday evening on a walkway beside the Major Dee gan Expressway when a driver in a northbound lane suffered a fatal heart attack and lost control of his car, the police reported.

title: Families Routed by Fire Are Relocated
description: At least 40 families that werel, evacuated from an.Upper West Side apartment building Saturday night during a fivealarm fire remained in hotels today, and others presumably remained with friends or relatives.

title: Meeting Today Meant to Find Consensus
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Setting the stage for President Ford's summit conference, to begin Friday, 28 of the county's leading economists will meet in New York tomorrow to iron out as broad a consensus as possible on the major policy options in the fight, against inflation.

title: SelfInflicte Wounds
description: The disclosures of covert C.I.A. erations in Chile raise questions two distinct levels: Was the particular activity against the Allende Government justified? In general, is it wise for the United States to intervene surreptitiously in the internal politics other countries?

title: Argentine Leftist Murdered
description: BAHIA BLANCA, Argentina, Sept. 22 (AP)An 18yearold construction worker, who was a member of a leftist Peronist organization, was kidnapped by six armed men and killed today, the police reported. They said the kidnappers evidently were rightwing terrorists. The youth was identified as Luis. Jesus Garcia.

title: FORD PLAYS TENNIS, THEN GOES GOLFING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 (AP)  After spending four and a half hours on a golf course, President Ford disclosed tonight that he had also taken up tennis.

title: Deserters and Evaders Plan an Amnesty Boycott
description: TORONTO, Sept. 22A group of American draft evaders and deserters, opening what they hope will become a worldwide campaign, spent the weekend here planning a boycott of President Ford's conditional amnesty program.

title: Agency Is Said to Slash Oil Overpaying Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22The Federal Energy Administration has scaled back sharply its estimate of how much the public overpaid for.oil and gasoline as a result of a, regulation that let refiners recover twice certain costs on some crude oil.

title: Jenner Asserts Jaworski Has Tapes With Surprises
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 22 (AP) The former minority counsel to the House Judiciary Committee said today that the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, has White House'tapes not yet made public that provide surprises about Watergate.

title: A. J. GREENOUGH, AST PENNY HEAD
description: Allen Jackson Greenough, lifelong railroader who presided over the Pennsylvania Railroad in its final years, died Saturday of cancer at St. Luke'S Hospital. He was 69 years old and maintained homes in North Salem, N.Y., and County Clare, Ireland.

title: One Man's Fact Is Another's Fact
description: There can be no cRestion but that the economy is in trouble. But in what kind of trouble? It is generally simply called inflation. The many economists assembled recently at the first of several White House conferences have, by their own admission, not produced one single new idea about how to deal with inflation.

title: White House Reported to Have Been Unaware of Extent of Tax Fraud Inquiry on Ford Envoy to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 22 Justice Department lawyers hi vestigating a tax fraud case recommended that the Govern. ment seek an indictment of Benton L. Becker a month before the lawyer was sent to California by the White House to inform Richard M. Nixon that he would be pardoned, according to wellplaced sources.

title: (Reprinted from yesterday's late editions.);
description: OXNARD, Calif., Sept. 2. (AP)The veteran actor Walter Brennan, who won three Acad emy Awards, died Saturday night after a long battle with emphysema. He was 80 year old.

title: KENNEDY REVEALS HIS PLANS TODAY
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy will disclose his politiCal plans this morning, and there are strong indications that he has decided not to seek the Presidency in 1976.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: George Harrison, the former Beatle, has scheduled a sevenweek concert tour of 27 cities starting Nov. 2, a spokesman said last night.

title: Wine Challenging the Hallowed Martini
HONDURAS HURRICANE TOLL REPORTED TO REACH 5,000; FLOODS SLOW RELIEF WORK
description: SAN PEDRO SULA, Honduras, Sept. 22Honduran rescue officials today ordered the mass cremation of bodies to prevent epidemics and further deaths in the wake of the hurricane that officials estimate left, 5,000 people dead, about 60,000 homeless and a number of communities under water.

title: Barber Wins; Ohio Golf by 3 Strokes
LOUIS W. LIGHT DIES; HEADED LANE REALTY
description: Louis W. Licht, founder and president of the Lane Realty Company of Forest Hills, Queens, and a lawyer in Manhattan and Queens, died yesterday at his home, 87.15 Barrington Street, Jamaica Estates, Queens. His age was 70.

title: SENATE VOTE SHOWS LEFT TILT IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, Sept, 22Elections were held today for nearly onethird the members of France's respected but relatively uninfluential Senate. They produced what appeared to be a slight shift toward the left.

title: SYLVIA SOULE MOORE
description: Sylvia Soule Moore, wife of the Rev. Charles O. Moore, rector of St. Giles's Episcopal Church in Northbrook, Ill., and former priest in charge at the Church of the Resurrection here, died of, cancer Saturday in Northbrook. She was 40 years old.

title: Regulating the Risks
description: The Congress is now completing action on three separate bills aimed at tightening Federal regulation over different forms of investments. These measures hold promise of setting up better safeguards for the investing public as well as for the financial structure of the nation.

title: Meredith Completes Hike
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., Sept. 22 (AP)James Meredith, who integrated the University of Mississippi more than a decade ago, walked into Vicksburg today to finish a 50mile, overnight hike from Jackson to promote voter registration. Mr. Meredith, wounded by gunfire on a similar march in 1966, is attempting to qualify as an independent candidate for Congress.

title: 7 Narcotics Dealers Flee U.S. Jail Here; Inside Aid Suspected
description: Seven narcotics dealers, including two major French heroin smugglers, escaped from the Federal House of Detention on West Street here yesterday afternoon in what authorities described as a wellplanned, wellexecuted operation that suggested the complicity of prison personnel.

title: Greek Elections Expected Soon, and Parties Begin to Prepare
description: ATHENS, Sept. 22Elections will almost certainly be held in Greece within the next two months, even if little progress is made toward settling the Cyprus situation.

title: Capozzoli Continues As PassKick Star
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Sept. 22At 11 years old, Tony Capozzoli was the national champion in the PuntPassandKick competition. Now he is 16 and, if there were a competition for his age group, he would probably be the champion again.

title: ORGANIZED LABOR, SPLIT IN PRIMARY, SWINGS TO CAREY
description: Organized labor In New York State, whose support was split three ways in the primary election, appears to be rallying behind Representative Hugh L. Carey, the Democratic nominee for Governor, in increasingly substantial numbers.

title: STATES AND CITIES OPPOSE AID CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22Sixty Governors, Mayors and county officials from across the ?? are scheduled to appear tomorrow at another of the Ford Administration's pre?? anti inflation conferences and are expected to be tufted on at least one point their opposition to cuts in Federal aid to state and local govemments.

title: Ronnie Ammerman Wed
description: Ronnie Lynn Ammerman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Ammerman of Monticello, N.Y., was married yesterday noon at the Plaza to Arthur Selig Kirsch, son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Kirsch of Westbury, L.I. Rabbi Jerome K. Davidson of Great Neck, LI., performed the ceremony. The bride is an alumna of the Rhode Island School of Design. Her husband graduated from the University of Rhode Island and received an M.B.A. degree from the Bernard Baruch College here.

title: Cost of Fixing Old Car Has Risen Sharply, Too
description: At a time when prices for new cars are keeping many Americans out of showrooms, motorists across the country are discovering a hard fact at their local garage: The cost of fixing their old cars has risen 10 to 25 per cent or more this year.

title: Second Poll in Britain
description: Britain is entering its second election campaign of 1974 facing its worst economic crisis since the war. Yet the electorate is either so apathetic or so dubious that new elections will produce a government capable of governing effectively that Prime Minister Harold Wilson almost apologized in announcing Oct. 10 as polling day. Although the Labor, Conservative and Liberal parties concur on the dimensions of the crisis, particularly on the perils of an inflation that approaches an annual rate of 20 per cent, none of the three offers anything very new for resolving it.

title: DRY SOUTH INDIA GREETED SOURLY
description: MADRAS, IndiaThe heart of South India has become dry, austere and puritanical, but businessmen, hawkers, taxi drivers and officials do not seem to believe it.

title: World Bank Gives Bleak View Of Future for 800 Million Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 22 The. World Bank said today that without a major effort by the richer nations some 800 million impoverished people in poor countries stood little hope of improving their lives for the rest of this decade.

title: French Trucks Jam Traffic
description: PARIS, Sept. 23 (AP)Hundreds of truck drivers staged a goslow strike on the outskirts of Paris and other French cities today to back their.demand for higher rates. The slowdown caused traffic jams on main highways. The truckers. say that sharply increased operating costs and Governmentcontrolled trucking rates are threatening many small operators with bankruptcy.

title: Greensboro Golf Raises Top Prize
description: GREENSBORO, N.C. (UPI)  Officials of the Greater Greensboro open golf tournament have added $5,000 to the title purse of the 1975 event and raised the top prize $1,000 to $45,000, making the event the sixth richest, professional golfers association event in the nation.

title: Not Guilty Plea in Theft
description: Robert Lopez, 20 years old, of 2284 Second Avenue, pleaded not guilty yesterday in State Supreme Court to robbing John F. Kennedy Jr. of his bicycle in Central Park last May 14. Acting Supreme Court Justice Irving Lang set Oct. 4 for motions the cast.. Mr. Lopez, who eras unable to make bail, wai returned to prison.

title: Nixon Enters the Hospital For Treatment of Phlebitis
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Sept. 23A physically fatigued Richard M. Nixon was admiitted to Memorial Hosspital Medical Center today, 45 days after his, resignation as President, for extensive tests ana treat ment of a flareup of chronic phlebitis condition in his leftleg.

title: 9 Belmont Jockeys to Appeal $250 Fines for Refusal to Ride
description: The nine jockeys who refused to ride in the seventh race on the program at Belmont Park on Saturday were fined $250 each yesterday by the stewards. As soon as the news was given to them, the riders said they disagreed with the ruling and decided unanimously to appeal.

title: Mr. Kennedy Steps Aside
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy's statement renouncing any intention to run for President in the foreseeable future has elicited a strong sigh of relief throughout the country. There is little question that his decision was right and that it did remove some very real and very serious national anxieties.

title: Excerpts From Statement by Rockefeller to Senate Panel on Family and Finances
Princeton Professor Is Ford's Choice to Head WagePiice Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23President Ford has chosen Albert E. Rees, a Princeton Ljniversity economist, to be executive director of the new Council on Wage and Price Stability. A White House announcement was understood today to be imminent,

title: Administration Planning to Ask Standby Authority on Oil Needs
Some N.F.L. Standouts Doing Well, Some Fading
description: Duane Thomas came back, part way at least. Bubba Smith went back. Jack Youngblood stepped further up while Pat Sullivan got ready to step on. Those four names were in the news on the second Sunday of National Football League play.

title: WILLIAM F. GLACKEN, A FREEPORT MAYOR
description: Wiliam F. Glacken Sr., who operated an insurance agency in Freeport, L. I., for 40 years and who twice. served that village as Mayor in the nineteenfifties, died Sunday at Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre, L. I. His age was 62.

title: RUMSFELD LIKELY TO REPLACE HAIG
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 Donald Rumsfeld, Ambassador to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, will replace Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr, as President Ford's top staff aide, Government sources said today.

title: Sakharov Is Operated On
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 23 (Reuters) Andrei D. Sakharo, the physicist, was hospitalized today for an emergency operation for appendicitis, his wife said. Doc tors said the operation had been a success and his condition was satisfactory, she added.

title: Catena, Through Lawyer, Affirms Refusal to Talk
description: TRENTON, Sept. 23 The lawyer for Gerardo Catena, a reputed Mafia leader who, has been jailed since early 1970 for refusing to answer questions about organized crime for the State Commission of Investigation, told the state Supreme Court today that his client would remain silent about the same questions if ordered to appear in court.

title: Kennedy Rules Out 76 Presidential Race
description: BOSTON, Sept. 23Senator Edward M. Kennedy, the heir to one of the great family traditions in American politics, removed himself without qualification tdday from the 1976 Presidential contest.

title: Case of the 8 Dead Women: Detective Is Transferred
description: The head of the Police Department's Fourth Homicide Zone was reassigned yesterday after a departmental investigation reported that detectives had failed to recognize the overall pattern of killings in the deaths of eight women in a West Side hotel during the last year and a half.

title: Husband and Wife. Die In South Jamaica Fire
description: A husband and wife died last night when fire swept their twostory frame house in the South Jamaica section of Queens. The victims were identified as Lyman J. Holley, 50 years old, and his wife, Ruby, 49, of 130.32 149th Street.

title: U.S. Budget Cuts Opposed By Governors and Mayors
Rules on Lobbyist Disclosure Passed, but Delayed by a Suit
description: TRENTON, Sept. 23 (AP)The State Election Law Enforcement Commission today adopted regulations to require disclosure by lobbyists of how much they are paid. and how much they spend to influence government decisions. The regulations will take effect Wednesday but cannot be enforced because of an existing court order.

title: HONDURAS IN PLEA FOR HURRICANE AID
description: SAN PEDRO SULA, Honduras, Sept. 23.(UPI)Honduran officials appealed today for food, helicopters and gasoline to aid hundreds of thousands of hurricane victims threatened with starvation and disease.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad All is still doubtful the world heavyweight fight against George Foreman will be held on Oct. 30, (Oct. 29 in New York). It mould be a miracle, said Ali yesterday, a day before the oneinch adhesive clamp over Foreman's eye was scheduled to be taken off. Whatever Ali's motives, he might have been trying to jar the champion psychologically,. 'Ali admitted he has gained 6poundS since the injury to Foreman's eye. He said he would need three weeks of hard work to get back into condition.

title: Large Imports Appear Essential To Easing of India's Food Crisis
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 23India's grave food situation has deteriorated further in the last two weeks. Millions are facing hunger in several northern states.

title: Economists Fail to Agree At Meeting on Inflation
description: Twodozen leading econoNew mists met here yesterday in an effort to reach agreement on proposals for President Ford's inflation summit at the end of the week, but ended the day without having reached any major consensus.

title: Transcript of Kennedy Statement on 1976 Plans
HINT ON FOOD AID IGNORED BY INDIA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz let India know as recently as last week that this country would be receptive to a request for food aid only to have the suggestion turned aside, a Government aide said today.

title: WORLD CURBS SET FOR NUCLEAR SALES
description: VIENNA, Sept, 23  The world's major exporters of nufear materials have drawn up a list of equipment that they will supply to other countries only after receiving assurances that it will not be diverted for explosive purposes.

title: For Opera in Europe, Ticket Prices Can Hit CNotes
description: While anyone wanting box for eight at the opening of the Metropolitan Opera last night had to pay $700or $87.50 a seat  ticket prices for opera in New York still have not reached the peaks touched in some European cities.

title: Hyndman Captures Senior Golf Medal
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Sept. 23 (AP)  William Hyndman 3d of Hunting Valley, Pa., the defending champion, shot today to take medal honors in the 20th annual United States senior amateur golf tournament.

title: 2 More Dolphins Sign With W.F.L.
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 23 (AP)The World Football League's Birmingham Americans announced the signing today of two Miami Dolphin players, Tim Foley and Bob Kuechenberg, for the 1975 season. Both were given multiyear contracts, but actual figures were not disclosed.

title: Commodity Loans Aid Poland
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)The Agriculture Department announced today loans of $28million to Poland for the purchase of United States farm commodities. The loans, which bear commercial interest rates and must be repaid over a maximum of three years, are financed by the department's Commodity Credit Corporation, Officials said the arrangement would allow Poland to buy $8million of cotton, $4million of tobacco, $10million of Tice and $6million of tallow.

title: People and Business
description: Arthur D. Lewis, chairman of the United States Railway Association, said economic problems and the character of railroads in the Northeast make it difficult to put together a profitable railroad system in this region.

title: Gov. Judge Forfeits Bond
description: HELENA, Mont., Sept. 23 (AP)  Gov. Thomas L. Judge has forfeited $300 bond and lost his biggame hunting privileges for six months in connection with the illegal killing of a spike bull elk Sept. S. Missoula Justice of the Peace J. G. Lamortaux declared the bond forfeit when Mr. Judge did not, appear at a hearing on Monday.

title: CITY COLLEGE GETS $400,000 FROM U.S.
description: Robert Marshak, president of City College, announced Sunday that the Federal Government had awarded a $400,000 grant to the college's controversial new accelerated medicaltraining programs.

title: Jaya Wadiyar Bahadur Dies; Former Maharaja of Mysore
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 23Jaya Chamarajendra Wadiyar Bahadur, former Maharaja of Mysore, died today in Bangalore of bronchial pneumonia. He was 55 years old.

title: Chess Karpov Keeps His 1to0 Lead As Korchnoi Misses a Chance
WATERRATE RISE ASKED IN SUBURBS
description: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 23  The Portchester Water Works Company pressed its request for a 43 per cent rate increase at a Public Service Commission hearing here today. The company's request, submitted last August, affects its Port Chester, Rye and Rye Town customers, who already pay the secondhighest rate in the country and are fighting the move. The last increase was granted in 1970 and an initial hearing on the new application was held Aug,

title: EUGENE SHAW
description: Eugene Shaw, executive vice president of the Lerner Stores Corporation, died Sunday in White Plains Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 135 Hillair Circle, White. Plains.

title: JESSICA VALENTINE
description: Jessica Bunker Valentine, former librarian at the University of North. Carolina and Bryn Mawr College, died Sunday night at Chester County Hospital, West Chester, Pa. She was 73 years old and lived at KendalatLongwood, a retirement home in Kennett Square, Pa.

title: Coast Final Is Captured By Connors
British Stockholders Urged To A'ccept Arab TakeOver
description: LONDON, Sept. 23 (AP)One of Britain's leading real estate companies has recommended to its shareholders that they agree to a deal that would bring about the first takeover of a major British company by oilrich Arabs.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES RISE DAILY LIMIT
description: With the harvest of soybeans and corn fast approaching in the Middle West, jittery futures traders bid prices up sharply yesterday on reports of frost in the growing areas.

title: TANAKA IN CANADA FOR TRADE TALKS
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 23Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan held talks today in an effort to establish a firmer relationship between their two countries.

title: Doctor Aids Educator But Both Die Soon After
description: POTSDAM, N.Y., Sept, 23 (AP)  The chancellor of Clarkson College and the doctor who attempted to revive him during ceremonies here died Saturday.

title: Conferees Agree on a New Unit To Regulate Futures Trading
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (UPI) HouseSenate conferees agreed today to establish an independent, fulltime commission outside the Agriculture Department to regulate the nations $500billion,ayear commodity futures trading industry.

title: Visitors Get a Peek at Fort Knox GoldIt's There
description: FORT KNOX, Ky., Sept. 23 The Treasury Department opened the United StateS Bullion Depository to visitors for the first and possibly last time today and gave.them a glimpse of $22billion worth of the stuff that dreams are made of.

title: Refugees at Relief Center Tell of Devastated Towns
description: TOCOA, Honduras, Sept. 231 Refugees continued to arrive in this northern Honduran town today with reports that their villages had been destroyed and all their belongings lost in the hurricane that struck here last week.

title: The Women's Forum  Coming to Terms With Power'.
description: The women's power structure in the city has joined forces to make itself heard collectively and more effectively.

title: ROCKEFELLER LISTS TOTAL HOLDINGS AT $218MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 Nelson A. Rockefeller, on the opening day of hearings by the Senate Rules Committee on his nomination as Vice President, said today that he hoped the myth or misconception about the Rockefeller family financial empire and its influence would be exposed and dissipated.

title: FUNERAL HOMES FACE AN INQUIRY
description: Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein, alleging a coldblooded scheme by at least one undertaker here to engage in bodysnatching and to defraud the city of money for burial costs, said yesterday that he would introduce legislation to regulate the funeral industry.

title: Books of The Times
description: James Herriot and I are repeating ourselves: his second book is much the same as the first, and I enjoyed it just as much. I would have supposed that after having read one account of the life of a young, veterinary surgeon in the hills of England's Yorkshire during the late nineteenthirties I would have had enough, but apparently I haven't. If Dr. Herriot writes a third book on this subjectas he probably will I'm sure I'll read and enjoy that one too.

title: News Summary and Index
Nixon's John Charles Luniren
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Sept. 234V. John C. Lungren, became the man In the middle. today, a key figure in the dispute over access to Richard M. Nixon. Like the former President, whom he. has served as, personal physician since 1952, Dr. Lungren, guards his.privacy. He had declined until today to speak to the press,. since the announcement last week that he would treat Mr. Nixon for phlebitis at the Memorial.Hospital Medical. Center here starting today

title: Factories First, Then Homes In New Town Arising Upstate
description: BALDWINSVILLE, N.Y.Factories first Then houses.

title: Local Officials Fear That Cities, Will Bear Brunt of Ford Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Why us?

title: Harlem Bank at Critical Point But Hopes to Pull Up
description: Hit by inflation and still suffering from a lack of skilled banking professionals, the 10year old Freedom National Bank, the oldest black bank in the state, has reached a critical juncture in its development, according to its top officer.

title: BIG IMPACT MARKS MERCURY'S 2 SIDE!
description: A study of pictures sent tc earth by Mariner 10 indicate: that the planet Mercury wa: once struck with such fora that the impact not only pro. duced a crater 800 miles wide but also left scars directly opposite that area of the globe.

title: Tennis a Sport for All Seasons
description: If you think the tennis season ended with Forest Hills, you're not keeping your eye on the ball. The men's and women's circuits go on 12 months a year now, and Jimmy Connors, who won the United States, Wimbledon and Australian titles, is aiming at the Grand Prix championship, which carries a whopping $100,000 top prize.

title: Excerpts From Addresses by the President and Kissinger
description: Everyone can now see the pulverizing impact of energyprice increases on every aspect of the world economy. The food problem, the inflation problem, the monetary problem and other major problems are linked to the allpervasive energy problem.

title: State Mental Health Body Calls For Increase in Local Services
description: SOUTH FALLSBURG, N.Y., Sept. 23The New York State Association for Mental Health, an organization whose members consider themselves consumer advocates for mental patients, called today for increased mentalhealth services on the local level to aid mental patients in making the transittion from hospital to society.

title: 7% Credit for PeeplintVoted by,House Tax Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)  A 7 per cent tax credit, valued at $50million a year for recyclers of consumerdiscarded glass, paper, rags and metal except iron and scrap steel, was approved today by the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Turk Says Nation Can Find Arms if U.S. Drops Aid
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Sept. 23 (UPI)Turkey's Finance Minister said today that other sources of military aid could be found if the United States stopped providing it.

title: JUDGE SUGGESTS A TEST OF PARDON
Kheel Doubts Port. Unit Aid on Pare
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator and mass transit advocate, asserted yesterday that there was no way that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey would yield even one penny in time to help save the 35cent transit fare.

title: Citadel Coach Quits
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Sept. 23 (AP)The Citadel basketball coach, George Hill, resigned today. His assistant, Les Robinson, replaced him.

title: KIDNAPPER IN OHIO ASKS $2,000 RANSOM
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 23 (UPI) The 4yeastold: daughter of the. Taft Broadcasting Inc., board chairman,, Charles S. Mechem Jr., was, kidnapped from the front yard of her suburban. Mount Lookout home this afternoon. She was reported being held for. a $2,000 ransom.

title: Saxbe and Kelley, Citing Crime Rise, Hold Prosecutors and Courts Guilty
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Two of the nation's top law enforcement officials charged today that prosecutors and courts were responsible for the rising crime rate because they often failed to convict and jail repeated offenders.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Porter Carries Hope for New Life on Knicks
description: Howard Porter waits and hopeir, and so do Knick fans.

title: Cyprus is the Burning Issue for Athens and Turkey but Others Are Smoldering
description: ATHENS, Sept. 23 Wh Foreign Minister George Ma ros of Greece meets Secrete of State Kissinger tomorrow New York, the main topic w presumably be Cyprus. But Greek Gover ment, which can to power tv months ago b cause of the C prus crisis, is ready looking beyond the prol lems of that unhappy island.

title: The City's 0.4Million Discrepancy Apparently Accounted For in 2d Audit
description: The outside auditors wl turned up a $5.4million di crepancy in the ledgers of city vault two months ago have now apparently accounted the funds.

title: Stocks Finish Mixed in Slower Trading
description: The stock market finished mixed for the second consecutive session yesterday in much slower trading as investors hopes for a quick reduction in the prime rate evaporated.

title: Convention Backers Call Zone For Clinton Peril to West Side
description: Charges that the proposed Clinton Preservation District is a classic example of planning for poverty and would thwart the natural development of the West Side were made before the City Planning Commission yesterday by the Citizens Committee for Equal Justice in Clinton.

title: Italy's Money Loss Found Small Despite Oil Deficit
description: ROME, Sept. 23Although Italy faces severe problems in financing her evermounting oil deficits, the actual outflows of money. to date have been minimal, according to officials of the Bank of Italy.

title: Met Starts 90th Season On Quiet Note
Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city sold $800million in shortterm revenueanticipation notes yesterday at an average interest rate of 7.447 per centalmost 1 percentage point lower than at the last sale two weeks ago.

title: Pilots End Braniff Strike As Dispute Goes to Panel
description: DALLAS, Sept. 23 (UPI)A pilots strike that idled 9,200 workers and grounded Braniff International Airlines planes for two days ended today and a company spokesman said that all flights were on normal, schedules.

title: Australian Writer Says C.I. A. Sought To Influence Voting
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sept. 23 (UPI)Charges that the. United States Central IntelliI gence Agency offered funds in an unsuccessful effort to help defeat the Australian Labor Government in legislative elections last May were reported today in advance copies of a book by an Australian political journalist.

title: Virdon Says 6 Victories Should Do It
description: In the serenity of his office, where temperature and temperament have remained the same throughout the long baseball season, Manager Bill Virdon sized up his Yankees chances yesterday.

title: SELASSIE'S SON BIDS FOR LIMITED RULE
description: GENEVA, Sept. 23Crown Prince Asfa Wossen of Ethiopia said today that he had informed his country's military government that he would like to serve his people as a constitutional monarch.

title: Amex Prices Increase
New Stars Come Out Tonight
description: Since leaving town a couple of weeks ago for games in Portland and Hawaii, the New York Stars have become the beneficiaries of some of the fallout from the National Football League player cuts.

title: A Girl, 10 , Is Raped In Brooklyn School; TeenA ger Hunted
description: A 10yearold Brooklyn girl was raped yesterday in a stairwell of a school in the Flatbush section by an assailant whom the police described as in his late teens.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23Four areas in the New York tristate region have been designated national historic landmarks. Landmarks, which now total 1,157, are cited for their significant role in the social humanitarian development of America and are somewhat protected by law in that no Federal funds can be spent that will detract from their property value. The new ones are:

title: Lafayette's Football Goliath Walking With Pride
description: Russell Tompkins doesn't like scales. He is an offensive tackle at Lafayette High School and nobody there is certain how much he weighs. Russell said at the Brooklyn pounds; his coach, Ace Adler, says it's around 280, and some teammates estimates are 290. It is certain, however, that Russell is talented and may become the most heavily recruited high school football player this season in New York. Other certainties are a height of 6 feet 3 inches, a 17inch neck and 49inch chest.

title: Theater: Gypsy Bounces Back With Zest and Lilt
New Edens
description: Surely this is the time of the year when Eve persuaded Adam to eat the fruit, there.in Eden. Apples are ripe. Grapes are almost ready to be picked and, pressed. Things now come to fulfillment. There is a sense of new, more profound knowledge, if one will only go and seek; of new, more perceptive. answers if one will only propound the questions; of new Edens beyond the bluemisted hills.

title: Fire Engulfs Lisbon Palace; Some Art Is Feared Lost
description: LISBON, Thursday, Sept. 24 (Reuters)Fire burned through the 19thcentury Ajuda Palace Museum today and more than 300 firemen fought to save the building and art treasures.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Sale
Court Rebuffs State Drive Against Nursing Homes
description: New York State lost another round in court yesterday in its effort to speed enforcement of Federal safety, standards in nursing homes,

title: Senate Hires Wechsler
description: TRENTON, Sept. 23 (AP) Walter Wechsler, who retires Sept. 30 as the State Budget Director, has been hired as a temporary consultant to the State Senate. The Senate president, Frank J. Dodd, Essex Democrat,said Mr. Wechsler would advise a special committee that is exploring ways of restructuring public school financing.

title: 5 POLICE CHARGED IN SHOOK HERE
description: The Police Department filed charges yesterday against live officers as a result of a shooting incident Sunday morning in which a 22yearold man was wounded in the eye by a police bullet.

title: SUFFOLK TO GET A NEW HOSPITAL
description: YAPHANK, L. I., Sept. 23Plans are taking shape for a $20million hospital here, adjalcent to the uncompleted Suffolk Meadows race track, which ran into financial difficulties.

title: Nixon Enters the Hospital For Treatment of Phlebitis
3 MORE INDICTED IN FORT LEE CASE
description: NEWARK, Sept. 23  Three more. defendants were arraigned today on charges of conspiring to bribe Fort Lee officials, after they tried unsuccessfully to convince Federal District Court Judge Frederick B. Lacey that he should disqualify himself from presiding over the case. This brings to nine the number of persons indicted in the case.

title: State Gets $1.16Million
description: ALBANY, Sept. 23 (AP)The state received $1.16million in parimutuel revenue from the summer thoroughbred racing season at Finger Lakes, the State Department of Taxation and Finance reported today. Attendance totaled 238,940, a daily average of 4,508 during the July 1Aug. 31 meeting.

title: Going Out GUIDE
description: The Hands and Heart display consists of photo murals, slides, video tapes, films and artifacts that attempt to give a feel of people working, making things and in general living their lives amid economic poverty and cultural riches.

title: Restored Bow Bridge Reopens to Pedestrians
description: Bow Bridge, the 115yearold structure that almost fell into the Central Park Lake six years ago, was dedicated yesterday in its restored and refurbished form.

title: Nuclear Plant Reopens
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., Sept. 23 (AP)  Boston Edison's Pilgrim nuclar power plant is back in operation today after undergoing an inspection ordered by the Atomic Energy Commission. The plant was closed last Tuesday for routine inspection, a Wkesman said.

title: Meredith Cleared for Race
description: JACKSON, Miss., Sept. 23 (AP)A Hinds County judge ruled today that James H. Meredith, the civil rights figure, was eligible to run as an independent candidate in this fall's Congressional elections. Circuit Judge Francis Bowling ruled in a suit against the State Election Commission, which had declined to approve Mr. Meredith's candidacy.

title: Porter Carries Hope for New Life on Knicks
description: Howard Porter waits and hopes, and so do Knick fans.

title: BRITISH WORKERS DEFY LABOR PACT
description: LONDON, Sept. 23  The peace treaty between British trade unions and the Labor party Government showed signs of strain today as negotiations to end an unauthorized strike at one of the nation's largest companies broke down.

title: Case of the 8 Dead W omen: Detective Is Transferred
description: The head of the Police Deparment's Fourth Homicide Zone was reassigned yesterday after a departmental investigation reported that detectives had failed to recognize, the overall pattern of killings in the deaths of eight women in a West side hotel during the fait Year and a half.

title: Coopers &
description: A major accounting firm is taking a limited step toward auditing quarterly corporate reports.

title: Kerner to Get a Hearing For Parole Nekt Month
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 23Otto Kerner, former Illinois Governor and United States appeals court judge who is serving a Federal prison term here, will get a parole hearing in October.

title: HIGH COURT RULING IS ASKED ON TAPS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) The Justice Department is supporting an appeal by a convicted Soviet spy for a Supreme Court ruling on the President's wiretapping powers to protect national security.

title: VW and ford in Germany Both Laying Off Workers
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Sept. 23 (Reuters) Volkswagen laid off 46;500 workers today for a week in a production cutback in its six West German plants. It, was the sixth layoff this year; all because of lagging sales. Ford also laid off German workers.I

title: Party Leaders Near Pact On SchoolFunding Action
description: TRENTON, Sept. 23As a result of a partisan accommodation reached here last Week, Republican legislative leaders were reported today to be supporting Democratic efforts to seek a solution to refinancing New Jersey's public schools.

title: Water Main Break Disrupts Service on IRT
description: A major water main burst at Broadway and 137th Street yesterday, stopping subway service for an hour between 96th and 168th Streets on the Broadway IRT line during the evening rush.

title: ROT EARS VICTOR IN CAROLINA RACE
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Sept. 23The State Supreme Court ruled today that Charles D. Ravenel, Who won the Democratic gubernatorial nomination in a primary election two months ago, was ineligible to be Governor of South Carolina.

title: New Orders Climb For Durable Goods
GAINS FOR EUROPE WITH ARABS SEE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y Sept. 23The Foreign Minister of France and West German reported to the United Nation General Assembly today tha the dialogue between the Eu ropean Economic Communit: and the Arab states had starte, promisingly.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: THUN, Switzerland, Sept. 23 (UPI)Michel Carrega of France set a world record in trap shooting and the Soviet Union won two more gold medals today to maintain its lead on the fourth day of the world shooting championships.

title: Utility Asserts It Expects To Find No Reactor Peril
description: TRENTON, Sept, 23The Jersey Central Power and Light Company, under orders to close down its nuclear power plant in Oyster Creek for inspection for possible reactor defects, said today that it did not expect to find any damage similar to that discovered by the Atomic Energy Commission in three other reactors in the United States.

title: Economists Assail Rules Impeding Competition
description: A group of the nation's most distinguished economists agreed yesterday, by a vote of 21 to 2, that government should be asked to repeal a number of longstanding laws and regulations whibh, in the view of the majority; impede competition and efficiency and increase prices.was concerned that many of the proposals could threaten the jobs of union workers, at least in the short run.

title: 5 POLICE CHARGED IN SHOOTING HERE
description: The Police Department filed charges yesterday against five officers as a result of a shooting incident Sunday morning in which a 22yearold man was wounded in the eye by police bullet.

title: Artpark Ends First Season With Deficit...and Praise
description: LEWISTON, N.Y, Sept. 23Artpark the cultural park and theater compex built and operated by the state in this upstate town of 2,400, ended its first season Sept. 13 with an estimated deficit of $750,000, according to Mark Lawton of the state's Office of Parks and Recreation.

title: RONALD F. BALL
description: Ronald F. Ball, a patent attorney with the law firm of Fish & Neave, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 50 years old and lived on Midbrook Lane, Darien, Conn.

title: Fair Federal Pay
description: President Ford brought unnecessary defeat on himself in his first tangle with Congressthe killing by the Senate of his illadvised order for a threemonth delay in wage increases for 3.6 million Federal employes.

title: Col. Forrest Brooks Dies at 84; Led State Guard Signal Corps
description: Col. Forrest Edmund Brooks, who commanded the Signal Corps of the New York National Guard during World War II and was a member of Gov. Thomas E. Dewey's military staff, died Sunday evening at his home, 6 Brookline Road, Scarsdale, N. Y. He was 84 years old.

title: First Women's Bank Gets Delay In Opening Date to Raise Capital
description: The First Women's Bank, which was supposed to open its doors at 111 East 57th Street, this month, has obtained a 90day extension from the New York State Banking Department to help it raise necessary capital.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad Ali is still doubtful the world heavyweight fight against George Foreman will be held on Oct. 30 (Oct. 29 in New York). It would be a miracle, said All yesterday, a day before the oneinch adhesive clamp, over Foreman's eye was scheduled to be taken off. Whatever Ali's motives, he might have been trying to jar the champion psychologically. All admitted he has gained 6 pounds since the injury to Foreman's eye. He said he, would need three weeks of hard work. to get back into condition.

title: Morton of Interior Urges Cut in U.S. Energy Demand
description: DETROIT, Sept. 23Secre, tary of Interior Rogers C. 13, Morton told a luncheon meeting of the Economic Club of Detroit here today that the most constructive thing the United States can do is reduce its demand on the world's supply of energy as soon as possible.

title: Chapin Says He Will Seek a $3Million City Subsidy
description: Any night at the Metropolitan Opera is an occasion for debate over singers, production niceties and the broad spectrum of opera as art and business, but last evening, the opening night of the company's 90th season, was an electric mix of operatic pros and cons, of optimisms and disappointments.

title: Coast. Guard Reduces Key Biscayne Security
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Sept. 23 (AP)The security zone on Biscayne Bay in front of former President Richard M. Nixon's compound here was reduced by 75 per cent today, the Coast Guard said.

title: Messersmith Honored
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 23 (AP)The Los Angeles Dodgers star pitcher, Andy Messersmith, was named National League player of the week today by the league president, Charles (Chub) Feeney. Messersmith won two games last week to become the league's second 19game winner.

title: F.B.I. Seeking 7 Drug Dealers; Aid in Escape Not Established
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation continued its search yesterday for seven convicted narcotics dealers who escaped from the Federal House of Detention Sunday as Federal agents interviewed inmates and prison personnel.

title: Nixon, Calling Ford, Expressed Hope Kissinger Would Remain
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 Former President Richard M. Nixon telephoned President Ford last week and expressed the hope that Henry A. Kissinger would remain as. Secretary of State in the new Administration, the White House disclosed today.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Bobby Murcer doesn't need his rocking chair now anyway. The seat slants inside the legs of the maple Colonial rocker in front of his locker at Shea Stadium where the New York Yankees will oppose the Boston Red Sox twice tonight in the race for the American League East title. The legs of the rocking chair were sawed from the seat by Sparky Lyle in a clubhouse prank that somehow symbolizes Bobby Murcer's exorcism of the demons that have tortured him in a borrowed ballpark. He thrived in Yankee Stadium for five years, but the rocker had been his only Shea Stadium comfort. Through 77 games there he was frustrated by not having hit a home run. He was embarrassed by his transfer to right field from center field. He was disap pointed by not knowing at the time, because of a typographical error, that he had accumulated 1,000 major league hits. In his annoyance the rocker had been his refuge. His teammates sit on wooden stools or metal folding chairs. But the rocker advertised Bobby Murcer's space. After he finally hit a home run at Shea last Saturday in the 147 comeback victory over the Cleveland Indians, he sat in his rocker and savored the memory.

title: Fulbright Terns Down Envoy's Post in London
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 23 (Reuters)  Senator J. W. Fulbright said today that he had turned down for personal reasons President Ford's ofOr to make him ambassador in London.

title: Migrant Crew Chief Accused of Slavery
description: NEWARK, Sept. 23A migrantfarm crew leader was charged by a Federal grand jury today with holding four Puerto Rican laborers in involuntary servitude under a rarely used postCivil War antislavery law. The crew chief, Marcos Portalatin, also was charged with assaulting a state legislator and with threatening farm workers to induce them to lie to a grand jury investigating a series of incidents at the fruit and vegetable farm of Rosario Sorbello and Sons in Swedesboro.

title: A Warning on Oil
description: President Ford Secretary of State Kissinger and Secretary of the Treasury Simon have teamed up to sound the strongest possible United States warning of the danger to world order from the pricerigging and production curbs of the international cartel of oilproducing countries. The blunt words by the President and Mr. Simon at the opening of the World Energy Conference in Detroit and those of Mr. Kissinger at the United Nations General Assembly were clearly coordinated for maximum effect.

title: Bridge. For Holmes,.a Hard Contract Is Elementary, My Dear Etc.
Geon Industries Enjoined On Securities Violations
description: Geon Industries, Inc., said yesterday that the company and its chairman, George O. Neuwirth, were enjoined here from further violation of Fed

title: Republic National, Big Insurer, Agrees To Consent Order
description: DALLAS, Sept. 23 (AP)The Republic National Life Insurance Company. of Dallas Said today it had signed a consent order agreeing to cease ,alleged excessive real estate loans. the consent order; Republic admitted no guilt.

title: GREECE IS FIRM ON CYPRUS ISSUE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 23Greece told the General Assembly today that the political future of Cyprus must be determined exclusively and freely by agreement between the ethnic Greek and Turkish inhabitants of the island.

title: Charles W. Vursell Dead; Illinois ExCongressman, 93
description: SALEM, Ill., Sept, 23 (UPI)Charles W. Vursell, a Republican who served eight terms in the House, from 1942 to 1958, died Saturday night in a nursing home here. He was 93 years old.

title: RECORD DEFENSE BILL APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) The House passed today an $82.6billion defense appropriation bill over objections that the legislation contained hidden funds for the Central Intelligence Agency and money for an aircraft the Pentagon did not want.

title: First Down Worst Down For Giants
Italy Money Loss Low
description: Although Italy faces severe problems in financing her evermounting oil deficit, the actual outflows of money to date have been minimal, according to officials of the Bank of Italy. Details on Page 59.

title: Double Standard
description: Once again the antiabortion forces are trying for an endrun around the will of the majority and the word the Supreme Court. In a previous attempt last year, bill intended to liberalize Social Security benefits was selected as the vehicle for an amendment that would have prohibited all Medicaid payments for abortion. In their current effort to subvert existing law and to impose their doctrinaire views, the same forces have managed to wrap the same amendment around a $33billion appropriations bill for the Departments of Labor and Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Rangers Top Bruins, 64, At Garden
description: A Boston Bruins team laced with six rookies, including a nervous goalie whose knees turned to jelly in busy traffic, cut its baby teeth last night in Madison Square Garden, enduring a 64 spanking from the New York Rangers.

title: Rumania Will Now Pay 2% onDef aulted Bonds
description: Preliminary to a permanent settlement, Rumania has agreed to make a 2. per cent payment on account to American holders on $7.5million of longdefaulted bonds.

title: 25 Years Old: Is Glass House OldFashioned?
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn. When I built this house in 1949, said the architect Philip Johnson, referring to the famous Glass House on his estate here, I wanted it to become a classic before it was oldfashioned. Now, I don't know  I think it's hopelessly oldfashioned.

title: Court Told Airline Hired Podell After Bribe Failed
description: A former airline chief testified yesterday that his company had tried to bribe a Bahamian official before It obtained the help of Representative Bertram L. Podell of Brooklyn.

title: Pickets Heckled by Union
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 23 (UPI)About 100 pickets were heckled by members of the United Steelworkers of America today as the pickets marched outside Convention Hall, where the union was holding its 17th constitutional convention, to protest the union's treatment of minority laborres and its no strike policy.

title: FORMER PENNSY AIDE PLEADS NOT GUILTY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 23 (UPI)  David Bevan, former chief financial officer for the bankfupt Penn Central Railroad, pleaded not guilty to charges involving the alleged misapplication of $4.2million in railroad funds.

title: BICENTENNIAL CALLED TERRORISTS TARGET
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) Terrorists are planning to disrupt the United States bicentennial celebration with acts of violence, California Attorney General EveIle Younger told a Senate panel today.

title: State Concedes It;Would Shift Felons To. Mental Hospital in Camden Area
description: CAMDEN; Sept. 23A statel correction officer testified today that the prisoners the state wanted to transfer to the Ancora Psychiatric Hospital, might! include convicted murderers, armed robbers and burglars.

title: TURNPIKE HOLDS OFF A RISE IN TOLLS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Sept. 23 (UPI)No final deoision on toll incroases on the New Jersey Turnpike will be Made before next. month or without giving the public a chance to express its views, officials announced today.

title: Jessica Daves of Vogue Is Dead; Favored ReadytoWear Trend
description: Jessica Daves, editor in chief of Vogue in the nineteenfifties, died Sunday of cancer at her home, 1040 Park Avenue, She was 76 years old.

title: EDWIN STEWART
description: Edwin Stewart, founder and retired board chairman of the Excell and Treaty Management Corporation, the production and underwriting management firm for the Excess and Casualty Reinsurance Association, died yesterday at the Harkness Pavilion. He was 76 years old and lived at 825 Fifth Avenue.

title: Kennedy Frees the Democrats
description: Edward Kennedy has done the wise and courageous thing in closing the door, about as conclusively as it was possible to do, on the possibility that he might run for President in 1976, Skeptics will question whether family reasons he stated were really controlling with him; but the net effect of his announcement neverthe less comes down to two points overriding importance.

title: World Finance Leaders Invited to Camp David
description: UNITED NATIONS, Sept. 23 (UPI)Secretary of State Kissinger and Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon have invited foreign and finance ministers of key industrial countries for a weekend at Camp David, Md., to discuss world monetary and economic problems, United States officials disclosed today.

description: Essex Catholic and Seton Hall, two parochial schools with strong traditions of football excellence, are expected to be contenders for Essex County supremacy this season.

description: A fouryearold legal dispute over the pollution of Lake Champlain that pitted the State of Vermont against the State of New York and the Inter. national Paper Companymoved toward early resolution yester day when the parties reached an outofcourt agreement and asked the United States Supreme Court to dismiss a suit filed by Vermont,

title: Economists Fail to Agree At Meeting on Inflation
description: Twodozen leading economists met here yesterday in an effort to reach agreement on proposals for President Ford's inflation summit at the end of the week, but ended the day without having reached any major consensus.

title: Contract Awards
description: A $19.6million Army contract for Lance missile hardware has been received by the LTV Aerospace Corporation.

title: ADVANCE WOMEN, CITY U. BOARD BID
description: The Board of Higher Education's first meeting of the new academic year ended yesterday with an unusual plea, made by the president of Staten Island Community College, for promotion of two women faculty members. The women's promotion requests had been denied by a committee of the board because they lacked their doctoral degrees.

description: Bow Bridge, the 115yearold structure that almost fell into the Central Park Lake six years ago, was dedicated in its restored and refurbished form.

description: BONN, Sept, 23 (UPI)Representatives of West Ger man banks today reacher agreement on a proposal to reimburse 40 per, cent to 60 per cent of the losses sustainer by depositors of Bankhaus I.D Herstatt when the bank collapsed last June.

title: Braves Bow To Dodgers Marshall: 101
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 23 (AP)Mike Marshall made his 101st appearance tonight bailing Don Sutton out of an eighthinning Jam and preserving a 4.3 victory for the Los Angeles Dodgers, over the Atlanta Braves.

title: The Clinton Community
description: Demolition and development have been the natural processes of New. York. For some it has meant profit and dynamism, for others the loss of their homes and way of life. The loss has been great for the city, too, terms of neighborhoods. and services, but it was not until recently that the relationship between community health and the city's survival was perceived as anything more than a set of real estate transactions.

title: Cubans Playing a Major Relief Role in Honduras
description: SAN PEDRO SULA, Hon, duras, Sept. 23 (Reuters)Cubans, still nominally excluded from the LatinAmerican cornmunity, are playing a major role in hurrican relief in Honduras.

title: Pirates Score in 10th to Beat Cards, 10, Trail by  Game
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 23A 10thinning run knocked in by Richie Hebner tightened the National League East pennant race tonight as it produced a 10 victory for the Pittsburgh Pirates over the St. Louis Cardinals. The Pirates are half a game behind the Cardinals with nine games to play.

title: Rangers Top Bruins, 64, At Garden
description: A Boston Bruins team laced with six rookies, including a nervous goalie whose knees turned to jelly in busy traffic, cut its baby teeth last night in Madison Square Garden, enduring a 64 spanking from the New York Rangers.

title: SEOUL STUDENTS ASK PRISONERS RELEASE
description: SEOUL South Korea, Sept. 23Amid indications of a revival of open political dissent, university students called on the Government today to release all student political prisoners being tried by military courts.

title: FRANCIS HANOFEE, 59, DEMOCRATIC LEADER
description: Francis A. Hanofeer the Sullivan County Clerk and for the last 33 years. chairman of the Sullivan. County Democratic Committee, died Sunday evening at Robert Packer Hospital, Sayre, Pa, He was 59.years old.

title: NEWSPRINT PRICE RAISED $25 A TON
description: The Price Paper Corporation announced yesterdy that it was raising its prices effective Jan. 1 on 30pound newsprint by $25 a ton. The new price delivered to New York will be $259.65 a ton. Other basic weights will be in creased accordingly, the company said. Several other major newsprint producers said they were studying the price increase. A spokesman for. the Abitibi Paper Company, Ltd., said, We're aware that the cost of producing neisprint is continuing to increase and we agree some price action is justified.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Election Law Enforcethent Commission hearings on charges that Mayor Lawrence Kramer Paterson illegally transferred campaign hinds from his own treasury to those of two City Council candidates last spring ended in Morristown after hearing testimony from several witnesses, including Mr. Kramer. Alexander Parks, a commission investigator who was the final witness before Examiner Harold Price, testified that he had conferred during his investigation with Thomas Rooney, the former Mayor who was defeated by Mr. Kramer by 161 votes, and that he had found several of the allegations made against Mr. Kramer could not be substantiated. Mr. Price, a retired State Superior Court judge, is scheduled to present a list of his findings in the case to the Election Law Commission in Trenton. Officials there are expected to make a decision on the case within a month.

title: PRINTERS IN CAPITAL APPROVE CONTRACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 23 (AP) Printers at The Washington StarNews and The Washington Post have approved new sixyear contracts providing lifetime jobs for regular members and giving the newspapers the right to proceed with automation of their print shops.

title: Scott Chides Networks On Rockefeller Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP)  Senate Republican leader Hugh Scott criticized the three major television networks today for not providing live coverage of hearings on Nelson A. Rockefeller's VicePresidential confirmation.

title: CONFEREES APPROVE A STRIPMINING CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (AP) Coal strip mining would be banned in national grasslatid,4 under a compromise reached. today by a HouseSenate con ference committee.

title: Life Term in Immolation
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept 23 (AP)A man accused of igniting a neighbor with gaso. line has been sentenced to life imprisonment for murder and arson. A Hampden County Su. perior Court jury deliberated three hours Saturday and found Frank Clifford, 28 years old, guilty of both charges in the death of Robert Stokes, 35, Judge John F. Moriarty passed sentence.

title: Wood, Field &
description: MORAN, Wyo.  The tumbling, sparkling waters of the north branch of Spread Creek were often less than 10 feet wide where we drove beside it on a winding dirt road east of Moran, but at a sharp turning was a small wooden box and a sign on a post that informed anglers the creek had been stocked with cutthroat trout.

title: Washington Said to Have Authorized A GetRougher Policy in Chile in 71
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The Nixon Administration, in what amounted to a change of its clandestine policies toward the regime of President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile, officially authorized the Central Intelligence Agency to begin supplying financial and other aid to antiAllende factions in midOctober, 1971, highly reliable intelligence sources said today.

title: Simpson Is Hurt Again, May Miss Jets Game
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 23 (AP). O. J. Simpson suffered a contusion of the knee in yesterday's game with Miami and was listed as a doubtful starter for the Buffalo Bills against the New York Jets on Sunday.

title: General Mills Net Gains 11.4% In First Quarter
FOREST OIL, SETS 114MILLION DEM
description: The Forest Oil Corporatior announced in Denver yesterday that it had agreed in principle to sell to the Sun Oil Company substantially all of its oilproducing properties in the United States and Canada for $114Merger million in cash. News Forest Oil, which is engaged in exploration, development and production of oil and natural gas in major producing areas in the United States, Canada, the North Sea, the Adriatic Sea, Sumatra and the Northwest coast of Australia, said it was expected that the sale would be consummated before the end of 1974 and would be effective 1.

title: FORD AND KISSINGER WARN EXORBITANT PRICES OF OIL IMPERIL WORLD'S ECONOMY
description: President Ford and Seilfenfy of State Kissinger said yeSterday that continued high oil prices set by producing countries involved the risk of a world depression and, the President added, the breakdown of world order and safety.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON HIT 16YEAR LOW
description: LONDON, Sept. 23 (AP)Election jitters and Britain's continuing economic woes drove the London stock market down sharply today to its low est level in 16 years. The nancial Times industrial index slumped to 190.1 at the close, down 7.9 points on the day.

title: U.S. Crop Experts Praise China's Achievements in Growing Food
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 23China's achievements in efforts to increase food production received glowing praise today from a group of American plant scientists after a fourweek tour of research institutions and communes.

title: DUMPING DUTY ENDED ON HARDWOOD KRAFT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23The Tarriff Commission, in a rare decision, reversed itself today and found that a domestic industry was not being injured by imports of hardwood kraft pulp from Canada sold at dumping prices.

description: Walter H. Annenberg, the United States Ambassador in London, lost almost $9million on Penn Central stock, even through his investment adviser

description: Joe Namath, says a man who should know, couldn't be off to a better start.

title: Large Imports Appear Essential To Easing of India's Food Crisis
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 23India's grave food situation has deteriorated further in the last two weeks. Millions are facing hunger in several northern states.

title: Northern Justice
description: The scene in Bostonin recent weeks has been reminiscent of hundreds of others flashed on television screens at the opening of school in years gone by.

description: The First National City Bank said yesterday it was raising fees on new and/or additional standby and revolving credits to large corporate borrower by onequarter of a percentage point, effective immediately.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23There were so many matters to explore with Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller, the nominee to be Vice President of the United States, that the Senate Rules Committee began today with the obvious, his fortune.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 (UPI) The National Labor Relations Board said yesterday that it would not mediate labor disputes involving private secondary and elementary schools.
