description: Edith Logan Dilworth widow of Dewees Wood Dilworth, an investment broker died, yesterday at her home in Southampton, L.I. She was 80 years old and lived also in Aiken, S.C.

title: National Gallery's Negotiations With France Described
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 26The National Gallery of Art unveiled for the press today its stellar acquisition, Re. pentant Magdalen, with long tale of the highlevel negotiations involved in get. ting the painting out of France.

title: Yank Septembers to Remember
description: A September pennant race involving the New York Yankees, once as regular as the autumnal equinox, has not been a, frequent occurrence in the last decade. For the. benefit of newcomers, or oldtimers who can stand having their memories jostled, here is a review of some previous Yankee stretch drives.

title: Metropoliton Briefs
description: A bargaining session between striking Legal Aid Society lawyers and the society's management has been scheduled for this afternoon. The bargaining sessionthe first since Sept. 15comes after several behindthescenes efforts to resolve the 17dayold dispute failed.

title: 2 CBS AIDES SEEK TO END EQUAL TIME
description: In a week during which at least three Senators angrily chastised the commercial networks for failing to provide, live coverage of the Senate confirmation hearings on the appointment of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President, two officials of CBS, In separate speeches, called for the Congress to grant broadcasters greater freedom to cover political and legislative, activities.

title: FEDERAL RESERVE TO BACK FRANKLIN IN FOREIGN FIELD
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York, in a move to help solve the problems of the ailing Franklin National Bank, assumed responsibility yesterday for the bank's contracts to buy and sell foreign currencies.

title: Ice Follies Good Example of Genre
description: There is at least one 1975 model you can still have at a 1974 price. It is Shipstads & Johnson Ice Follies of 1975, and it opened last night at Madison Square Garden, with the usual blur of costumes glint of skates and blaze of ice.

title: Tax Equity
description: As President Ford prepares to open today his summit conference on inflation, only one idea seems to have emerged with any clarity from two weeks of foothill gatherings by experts in practically everythingand it has more to do with economic fairness than with fighting high prices.

title: NATHANIEL NORSEN
description: Nathaniel Norsen, writer and I former story editor for Joseph E. Levine of the Avco Embassy I pictures Corporation, died, Monday at the Veterans Administration Hospital, First Avenue and 24th Street. He was 59 years old and lived at 210 West 89th Street.

title: George InnesKer, Ninth Duke Of Roxburghe, Dies in Scotland
description: LONDON, Sept. 26George Victor Robert John InnesKer, ninth Duke of Roxburghe, died today in the hospital at Angus, Scotland. He was 61 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Charles O. Finley, never one to hide his light under a bushel basket, said yesterday he hoped his Oakland A's would, meet the New York Yankees in the American League playoffs rather than the Baltimore Orioles because the Orioles pitching is so solid. As for the World Series, which the A's have won the last two years, Finley said, I don't give a damn who represents the National League. We feel we can beat anybody in that league, including the Dodgers.

title: American Indians: Still a Stereotype To Many Children
description: To the Editor: As I sit here reading a copy of The New York Times (9/10/74), my eyes fall upon this Quotation of the Day. It's a kindergarten student's description of her first day in school.

title: SHAH REJECTS BID BY FORD FOR CUT IN PRICES OF OIL
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sept 26The Shah of Iran today rejected President. Ford's call foi reduced oil prices. He called on the industrial nations to cut the prices of their exports first.

title: Smith Upset By Pasarell In 2d Round
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. (AP)Jimmy Connors, the United States Open champion who says he's tired and ready for a rest, notched, his first victory in the $100,000 international open tennis tournament last night, but secondseeded Stan Smith was beaten, 64, 36, 76, by Charles Pasarell of Puerto Rico.

title: FORD'S ADVISERS SEE NO FAST CURB ON INFLATION RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 26 White House economic advisers have concluded that while the nation does not face a depression and mass Unemployment, it will take 18 to 36 months to reduce the, rate of  inflation in a major way.

title: SAWHILL CONCEDES ERROR ON ENGINEER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) The head of the Federal Energy Administration said today he was wrong in saying earlier that an oil company engineer was restricted to technical matters while serving the agency as an adviser.

title: Scientists Study Action on Aerosol Gas
description: A special scientific commit tee has been formed to assess for the National Academy of Sciences on an urgent basis what action might be taken with regard to the possible threat of aerosol can propellents to the stability of the atmospheric ozone layer.

title: World OilMoney Crisis: New Kissiner Focus
description: While American attention may be focused on President Ford's muchpublicized national economic summit this weekend a more momentous meetsing in deep privacy at Camp David, Md., will address the problem that is more seriously worrying the world's economic and political leadersoil and money.

title: 9 WOMEN'S DEATHS REVIEWED BY CITY
description: Dr. Dominick J. DiMaio, the city's Acting Chief Medical Examiner, said yesterday that he had reviewed the files of the deaths of nine women in which Calvin Jackson was said to have implicated himself and sent his findings to the Manhattan District Attorney's office.

title: How Stationery Started Two Women on a 30Year Partnership
description: According to Leona Rostenberg her career began on Christmas Day 1943 when her close friend Madeleine Stern gave her an elaborately wrapped package containing business stationery Each piece of writing paper was marked with a 16thcentury woodcut and the inscription, Leorra RostenbergRare Books.

title: DONALD B. WOODWARD
description: Donald Bosley Woodward, research economist and former vice president of the Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York, died Monday of a heart attack in the Long Beach Community Hospital in California. He was 69 years old and lived at 101G Lewis Street, Greenwich, Conn.

title: Bills, Not Just O.J., Are jets Concern
description: The Bills announcement that they changed the status of O. J. SImpson from doubtful to probable for Sunday's game against the Jets in Buffalo did not change the outlook much for New York's Coach, Charley Winner.

title: 5 Saved on Lake Michigan
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 26 (AP)  Five persons stranded on Lake Michigan in a disabled.. cabin cruiser for four days were rescued by the Coast., Guard late yesterday. The five. had gone without food, but were in relatively good health and did not require hospitalization. A search helicopter located the boat about 35 miles east of Racine, Wis., and a Coast Guard cutter picked up the passengers and brought. them to Milwaukee.

title: At Festival Moviegoer Is Star, Too
description: Speak to Richard Roud di rector of the New York Film Festival which opens its 12th season tonight at Alice Tully Hall, and to Martin E. Segal president of the Film Society of Lincoln Center the sponsor of the festival and you are likely to get two perspectives on the annual event.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 2.3 From WeekAgo Level
GOING OUT Guide
description: ROMANCE The New York Cultural Center has been specializing in exhibitions of paintings pf a romantic sort, and today it is opening a new show equal to its own tradition It's entitled Leonid and His Friends and it emphasizes a retrospective look at the work of Leonid Berman, whose surrealistic landscapes are very popular with many people.

title: Earthquake Rocks Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Friday, Sept. 27 (AP) A moderately strong earthquake rocked buildings in Tokyo for more than a minute shortly after noon today. There were no immediate reports of injuries. The quake registered four on a scale of seven. Several trains, including the high stopped as a pretaution.

title: Electric Kettles Recalled; A Lead Hazard Is Cited
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration announced today that thousands of electric tea kettles were being recalled be cause tests showed they posed a leadpoisoning hazard. The kettles are the same type that have already been banned in Canada.

title: On the Nation's Memory
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Partly as a result of former President Nixon's illness, the Senate of the United States is now acting quickly to give the Government control over his tape recordings and other official documents, which could be destroyed under the FordNixon agreement in the event of Mr. Nixon's death.

title: A British TV Producer Is Filming Program Here
description: Peter Blatty a British producer of television documentsries has been in New York this week filming interviews with network officials and Others concerned with broadcasting for a series about world television that he is producing. the series has been commisioned by Yorkshire TV one of Britain's regional stations, for the commercial network ITV. It will probably be televised next spring.

title: Fuel Stamps for Poor Under Federal Study
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI) The. Federal energy administrator, John C. Sawhill, says his office is considering the idea of issuing fuel stamps to poor people to help them pay the high cost of home heating.

title: Ford Appointees Checked By Watergate Prosecutor
Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The Association of American Rail. roads said today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Sept. 21 totaled an estimated 16.5 billion ton miles, 5.4 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 529,871 cars, 0.3 per cent above the preceding week, but 5.8 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. The American Trucking Association, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnaee was 7.8 per cent below last year.

title: Girl on Sohoolbus Killed
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 26 (AP)An 11yearold girl leaning out a schoolbus window was killed today when the bus rounded a curve and her head struck utility pole, the police said. She was identified as Lynn Lewis.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26, (AP)  The Government indicator designed to foreshadow future trends in the economy suffered its sharpest drop of the year in August, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 26 (AP)  The Atlanta Hawks said today they should receive Clyde Lee from the Golden State Warriors as part of a trade made in 1970. The Hawks advised the National Basketball Association commissioner, Walter Kennedy, that they were filing the claim.

title: STRIKES CURBING AUTO PRODUCTION
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26United States auto production has declined because of strikes And manufacturers uncertainty about how the public will buy the new 1975 models.

title: SOVIET SEES NO RISE IN ITS OIL EXPORTS
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26 (AP)The head of the Soviet delegation to the World Energy Conference said today that despite his nation's huge oil resources the Soviet Union cannot quickly become a major exporter of oil.

title: August Jobless Rate Rose to Record 8.3%
description: TRENTON, Sept. 26 (UPI) The unemployment rate in New Jersey climbed to a record 8.3 per cent in August, the Labor and Industry Department reported today.

title: Schmidt Is Conciliatory
description: BONN, Sept. 26  After knocking the breath out of his Common Market partners in Paris yesterday by blocking Frenchsupported agreement on higher support prices for food productS; Chancellor Helmut Schmidt applied artificial respiration today with a conciliatory phone call to President Valry Giscard d'Estaing.

title: MILITANTS QUIT PALESTINE GROUP
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 26The militant Popular Front fo the Liberation of Palestine an flounced today its withdrawa from the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Or ganization, which is the mail grouping of guerrillas, in a rif over peace moves.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, Sept. 26Rutgers and Princeton will play each other in the oldest football rivalry on Saturday, while Montclair State and Kean College will seek third consecutive victories and Upsala will open the season with uphill battle.

title: Kissinger Said to Rebuke U.S. Ambassador to Chile
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Secretary of State Kissinger rebuked David H. Popper, the United States Ambassador to Chile, after Mr. Popper bad discussed torture and other human rights issues during meeting on military aid with Chilean officials, Administration sources said today.

title: VENEZUELA PLANS RISE IN OIL TAXES
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 26Venezuela's plans to increase taxes paid by American and other foreign oil companies here may go well beyond the 3.5 per cent increase decided by other world oilproducing nations, the Mines Ministry said today.

title: Bridge:
description: The Aces, after a brief period in the doldrums, seem set to recover their former glories. At the Fall Nationals in San Antonio in November their nonplaying captain, Ira Corn of Dallas, will field a sextet fully capable of winning the world title eventually.

title: Drug Testson Horses Intensified
description: A state chemist's determination to do a better job emerged yesterday as the major clue in the mystery surrounding the recent drugging of four horses at Bel mont Park.

title: ROSALYN GRUBART
description: Rosalyn Grubart, a teacher for many years at the William Howard Taft High School in the Bronx, who specialized in 18thcentury English literature, died here yesterday after a long illness. She was 52 years old and lived in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Talks in Legal Aid Strike Slated to Resume Today
description: Representatives of striking Legal Aid Society lawyers are scheduled to meet this afternoon with the society's management in the first bargaining session since Sept. 15 The session comes after several behindthescenes efforts to resolve the 17dayold dispute failed.

title: Kissinger Sees Oil Crisis Periling Western Society
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Secretary of State Kissinger has told associates and foreign visitors in recent weeks that he is gravely concerned that failure to solve the world's economic problems could lead to breakup of the political fabric of the West and possible Communist takeovers in some countries.

title: FARE AID SOUGHT IN BUILDING FUND
description: With current city calcula tions pointing to a 1975 transit fare of 45 cents or more unless there is immediate and substantial Federal aid, Mayor Beame will urge President Ford to make some transitconstruction funds available to meet operating losses.

title: Emerson Eliminated In Two Sets
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 26 (AP)Roy Emerson, the defender, lost his secondround match tonight in the $100,000 International tennis tournament to another Australian, Ross Case, 62, 6.2.

title: Market Place
description: Just how safe are those cash funds that invest in wide variety of shortterm money market instruments. The answer to that question is, it depends.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN SLOW TRADING
SHAH REJECTS BID BY FORD FOR CUT IN PRICES OF OIL
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sept. 26The Shah of Iran today rejected President Ford's call for reduced, oil priees. He called on the industrial nations to cut the prices of their exports first.

title: Honduras Likely to Need 2 Years to Recoup Losses
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Sept. 26Foreign economic ex: perts estimated today that, with ample foreign aid, it might require at least two years for the economy of Honduras to recover from the hurricane damage of last week.

title: Hot Dog Seller's Bark Worse Than Tax Bite
description: Jerry Tuccile, the Free Liberation party candidate for Governor, wanted to protest the hot dog tax yesterday, but got a lesson in elementary economicsin Bulgarian instead.

title: India Warns Rich Nations on Lag in Helping Poor
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 26India deplored today the lag in assistance from affluent countries to the most impoverished and said that there would be tragic consequences unless help came quickly.

title: Three Hybrid Corns Tailored to the State
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Sept. 26 Six years ago a team of corn researchers began a series of experiments in crossing varieties that resulted in the development of three new hybrids that are now recommended for use by New York State farmers.

title: Opera: New L'Italiana
description: One of the impenetrable mysteries of the Metropolitan Opera during the Bing era was the administration's reluctance to rethink and revise a production after opening night. One glaring instance is the deplorable 1963 Aida that periodically appears its embarrassing pickaninny choreography still intact. This season's first performance of L'Italiana in Algeri on Wednesday night however offered some hope that the practice will no longer be rigidly applied.

title: Red Cross Teams Fight Malnutrition In Nomads in Niger Refugee Camps
description: AYOROU, Niger, Sept. 22Timidly, speaking a halting pidgin French, a youngish man in a ragged cloak that once was white told the nurse that his baby was ill. He pointed to his wife standing behind him, and she turned to display the baby, carried in a sling low on her back. The mother looked frightened, the baby wan.

title: Parley to Get New Defense Fund Data
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The White House will provid data to delegates to tomorrow conference on inflation show ing that twothirds of the pref ent $85billion defense budge is discrettonary money.

title: School Lunch Week Set
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (UPI)President Ford today designated the week beginning Oct. 13 as National School Lunch Week,

title: Soviet Reports It Is Processing Scientific Data Sent by Salyut 3
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26The Soviet Salyut 3 space station, lofted into orbit 90 days ago, has sent back to earth a module carrying scientific information that is now being processed,the Soviet Press agency, Tass, reported tonight.

title: MOSCOW REBUTS YUGOSLAV REPORT
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 26The So. Sfiet Union said today that the Western press was playing up the exposure of a proSoviet Stalinist party in Yugoslavia to foment a dispute between Moscow and Belgrade and to disrupt their friendly relations.

title: 11 Radical Economists Charge White House Talks Cloud Issues
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26A group of 11 economists from some of the major universities in the country portrayed the White House economic summit conference today as a charade. They said that the conference, which opens tomorrow could only serve to disguise and avoid the fundamental economic issues confronting the American people.

title: SOFTER MUM AID TO TURKEY BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 26The Democratic and Republican leaders of Congress met today with President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger and agreed to support a weaker version of legislation to suspend military aid to Turkey than the House voted Tuesday.

title: Soviet Warship Sinks
description: A Soviet guidedmissile destroyer exploded and sank recently in the Black Sea, a Turkish press agency reported. The Pentagon declined to confirm the report. Details on Page 7.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
MRS. PERON CHARGES LEFTISTS SEEK COUP
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 26 President Isabel Martinez de Peron accused leftwing guerrillas today of trying to provoke a military coup, and promised the armed forces that her Government would press its battle against subversion following the assassination of an army colonel and a lieutenant yesterday.

title: Bridge:
description: The Aces, after a brief period in the doldrums, seem set to recover their former glories. At the Fall Nationals in San Antonio in November their nonplaying captain, Ira Corn of Dallas, will field a sextet fully capable of winning the world title eventually.

title: Police, Tear Gas. Halt Soccer Fans
Guilty in Fatal Bombing
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Sept. 26 (AP)Ernest Burton Jr., 24 years old, was found guilty today of nine counts of firstdegree murder in the firebombing last March of a tavern here. Nine persons died and six others were injured when the bomb was tossed into the Caboose Bar.

title: Babe Stovall, Musician, 66; New Orleans Street Figure
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 26 (UPI)  Babe Stovall, a musician and singer whose raspy voice and steelbodied guitar entertained thousands of visitors to Jackson Square for 20 years, died Saturday. He was 66 years old.

title: Snowflake, a Polar Bear Dies at Central Park Zoo
description: Snowflake a 450pound polar bear bought by the Central Park Zoo a month ago, died of pneumonia there yesterday a Park Department official said.

title: Nixon Clot Responding
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon was reported to be responding well to therapy, and medical sources said that a blood clot in his right lung had apparently not destroyed tissue. Page 21.

title: MRS. IVER PIERSON
description: Mrs. Iver Young Pierson, volunteer community worker for the last five years at the Davidson Community Center, 2034 Davidson Avenue, the Bronx, died Tuesday at Morrisania Hospital. She was 44 years old and lived at 1975 Grand Avenue, the Bronx.

title: MARIAN N. SANDOR
description: Marian Nathan Sandor, wife of Paul Sandor, a retired Unites States Steamship Lines executive, and sister of the novelist Robert Nathan, died yesterday at Bellevue Hospital after having been struck by a truck at 10th Street and Fourth Avenue last Saturday. She was 77 years old and lived at 70 East 10th Street.

title: MARCIA K.AARON
description: Marcia Kurke Aarom; a fundraiser for the North Shore Science Museum in Port Washington, L. I., and the wife of Bertram D. Aaron, former president of the Electronic Representatives Association of New York, died Wednesday at her home in Roslyn Harbor, L. I. She was 44 years old.

title: People and Business
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday the election of Robert E. Kirby to the new position of vice chairman in charge of operations and the man who will succeed Donald C. Burnham as chairman and chief executive officer when Mr. Burnham retires from that post next February.

title: Selection of Jury Begins In an AtticaRiot Trial
description: BUFFALO Sept. 26July selection began here today for the first of what is expected to be a long series of trials resulting from the fiveday riot in 1971 at the State Correctional Facility at Atti ca, about 35 miles east of here.

title: F.B.I. Widens Search for Boy Kidnapped From a Playground
description: EWARK, Sept. 26The Federal Bureau of Investigation today pressed its search for 7yearold George Kaloyerakis into upstate New York and

title: New South Raising Crop of 76 Prospects
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 26Senator Edward M. Kennedy's withdrawal from the 1976 Presidential race has focused renewed attention on the um usually large number of Southern politicians who have begun to develop national ambitions and, more broadly, on the new brand of politics they espouse.

title: The Pop Life
description: The typical popmusic fan does not usually count the Hunter College Playhouse among his regular concert locales. Yet Gisela May'sconcert there next Friday night may attract a few devotees of contemporary popular music for a rather special reason,

title: Blazers Rejected By Georgia Tech
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 26 (AP)  The Florida Blazers have again come to Geotgia Tech looking for a place to play their World Football League games and again theyve been turned down.

title: Casper's 65 Leads Golf By Stroke
U.S. REVEALS GUARD ON KENNEDY YOUNG
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 (AP) Secret Service agents guarded six of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy's children for more than a week earlier this month because of a kidnapping threat, Treasury officials said today.

title: Aeros Top Blues, 54, For W.H.A.
Stocks Off Sharply As Trading Declines
description: Investors disappointment over the reluctance of most major banks to follow the lead of two leading institutions in reducing their prime lending rate plus some bearish economic news sent the stock market down sharply yesterday in slow trading.

title: Aid for Eisenhower College
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 26 (UPI)A personal appeal by House Speaker Carl Albert has helped save $9million in aid for financially troubled Eisenhower College in upstate New York. Mr. Albert made a rare speech yesterday to the House, urging members not to strike the funds from a bill that would let the Treasury use less copper in pennies if copper prices continued to rise. The bill was approved by a vote of 172 to 166 and sent to the Senate.

title: Pork and Beans Recalled
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 26 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration announced today that 1,440 improperly processed cans of Van Camp's pork and beans were being recalled. The cans, in a 16ounce size, have the identification code XRIJ over A234G on one end, and were distributed in Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kentucky, Michigan, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. A spokeman for the Government said that there had been no complaints of illness.

title: Tainted Milk
description: New Yorkers will hope that the tardy announcement by State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz that he really is looking into possible criminal action in connection with a massive fiveyear milk fraud is not just a preelection coverup of what had seemed a gross breach of official responsibility.

title: Commonwealth Lands Ask Loans to Ease Oil Strain
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 26Commonwealth countries called today for inexpensive loans and other measures to ease the severe strains on national economies following the steep rise in oil prices in the last year.

title: Rockefeller Panel Focuses On Attica and Abortions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The issues of abortion and At dominated the final day of the Senate Rules Commit. tee's hearings today as more than a dozen witnesses, including Angela Davis, testified for and against Nelson A. Rockefeller's confirmation as Vice President.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 26 (AP)  The Atlanta Hawks said today they should receive Clyde Lee from the Golden State Warriors as part of a trade made in 1970. The Hawks advised the National Basketball Association commissioner, Walter Kennedy, that they were filing the claim.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Both the tone and the details of President Ford's conditional amnesty for those whose consciences wouldn't let them fight in Vietnam betray a narrow vision.

title: The Screen
Television
description: 5:57 (5)Friends

title: New South Raising Crop of 76 Prospects
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 26Senator Edward M. Kennedy withdrawal from the 1976 Pres idential race has focused re newed attention on the un usually large number Southern politicians who hay begun to develop national am bitions and, more broadly, of the new brand of politics the espouse.

title: Saving Mass Transit
description: Somewhere between Capitol Hill and the White House, hope for preserving New York's 35cent fare is going down the drain. Having paid lipservice to the cause mass transit, President Ford has made it all too clear that the inadequate $11 billion voted by the House for a sixyear period would be the absolute upper limit that could escape his veto. On the Hill, the longrange House bill Is dying and the tattered MinishWilliams bill for shortterm relief of city transit systems is struggling to be reborn.

title: Ending of Drug Penalties Asked in Hyland Report
description: TRENTON, Sept. 26The Attorney General's office here is drafting a report to Governor Byrne that will recommend the abolition of criminal penalties for users of marijuana or hashish.

title: China Says Grain Yield Set Record Last Year
description: PEKING, Sept. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)China's grain harvest last year dwarfed all previous records, exceeding 250 million tons, Hsinhua, the official press agency, reported today.

title: SUFFOLK GIRL, 16, TOM MURDERED
description: ASHAROKEN, L. I., Sept. 26 The body of a 16yearold girl was found here late last night in what the authorities said was the first murder in this pleasant somewhat isolat ed community on Long Island's North Shore

title: Wallace Accused on Hiring of Blacks
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 26The former director of the Alabama Department of Public Safety told a Federal judge today that Gov. George C. Wallace had repeatedly instructed him not to obey one of the judge's orders regarding the hiring of black state troopers.

title: Public Service Is Urged To Reconsider Layoff Plan
description: NEWARK, Sept. 26 (AP) An organization representing employes of New Jersey utilities today called fof a reeval uation of Public Service Electric & Gas Company's plan to lay off 200 workers next month.

title: Iraqi Forces Seize Most Kurdish Towns
description: WITH KURDISH FORCES, Northeastern Iraq, Sept. 23 Government forces, in a sustained offensive to crush the Kurdish rebellion, have captured virtually every important city and town in Kurdish Iraq.

title: JUDGE CLEARS FORD AND G.M. ON PRICING
description: DETROIT, Sept. 26The General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company today were found not guilty in Federal District Court of pricefixing in the sales and leasing of cars to fleet customers.

title: Music: Notable Tosca
description: The New York City Opera's fine production of Tosca, directed by Tito Capobianco and designed by Donald Oenstager was on view for the first time this season Wednesday night. In the three leading roles were Johanna Meier who had sung Tosca only once before with the company; Gaetano Scam a young Italian tenor making his debut as Cavaradossi and William Justus singing his first Scarpia here.

title: A DECISION SOUGHT ON PARDON FIGURE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26The United States Attorney's office here has forwarded to senior Justice Department officials for a final decision a taxfraud case involving Benton L. Becker, the Washington lawyer who served as President Ford's intermediary in the pardoning of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Kissinger Sees Oil Crisis Periling Western Society
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26Secretary of State Kissinger has told associates and foreign visitors in recent weeks that he is, gravely concerned that failure to solve the world's economic problems could lead to a breakup of the political fabric of the West and possible Communist takeovers in some countries,

title: France Shows the Way
description: France has given the industrial world a worthwhile example of meaningful action to guard against the disastrous implications of escalating oil prices.

title: BUDGET UNCHANGED BY FORD FOUNDATION
description: The 18 trustees of the Ford Foundation have voted unanimously to postpone a decision on possible program budget cuts and the level of future grants.

title: Illegal Entry Charged to 29
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 26 (UPI)Federal agents arrested today 29 Mexican nationals, who were working in mushroom plants, on charges of entering the country illegally. Lawrence Augustine, district director of the United States Immigration Service, said the Mexicans, all men, were picked up in the Kennett Square area of Chester County.

title: Face Both East Contenders to End Season
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 26 This could be the week that makes Milwaukee infamous.

title: Bonn Will Propose A Petrodollar Bank
description: BONN, Sept. 26West Germany will propose next week World Investment Bank to absorb the huge amounts of cuirency being amassed by the oilproducing countries, an official of the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Bank Bandit Strikes Again
description: An armed man suspected of having robbed two to four Queens banks in the last three months held up a savings and lean office yesterday in Flushing, Queens, and escaped with $12,379. At 2:13 P.M. he entered the Flushing Federal Savings and Loan Association at 29.40 Union Street, walked up to a woman teller, showed a gun,and announced the holdup.

title: A Fleeing Suspect Slain by Patrolman After a Robbery
description: A 24yearold Brooklyn man who the police said was fleeing from the scene, of a robbery and shooting, was shot and killed by a Transit Authority patrolman after the suspect reportedly fired a shot at one of three other pursuing policemen, in Brooklyn's Bushwick section, early yesterday.

title: Injuries Mar Cards Victory
LOTTERY NUMBERS Sept. 27, 1974
Minor Concussions Found to Impair Mental Ability
description: Minor concussions of the head that can cause a brief loss of consciousness or the effect of seeing stars but produce no apparent physical damage been found by two New Zealand researchers to impair intellectual function for as much as five to seven weeks afterward.

title: Earnings Slump at Dean Witter, Reflecting Fall in Value of Seats
description: The Dean Witter Organization, Inc., holding company for Dean Witter & Co., Inc., the brokerage house, reported yesterday that the decline in the value of its stock exchange seats had pulled down net in come in the year ended Aug. 31. to $1.8million or 43 cents a share, from $3.1million, or 75. cents a share a year earlier.

title: MAX E. ESTERNAUX
description: Max E. Esternaux, a retired member of the staff of the Belli Telephone Laboratories, died Thursday at his home in Sun City, Ariz. He was 68 years old.

title: Grenade Hurled in Theater kills 4 in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 27 (UPI)A hand grenade was thrown into a packed theater 75 miles east of Saigon, killing four.Government soldiers and wounding 21 others, including 16 civilians, the Saigon command said today.

title: ETHEL J. KWESKIN
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 27 Ethel Jaffee Kweskin, former Off Broadway and television actress, died today in Norwalk Hospital from injuries suffered in an automobile accident in Norwalk on Wednesday. She was 61 years old and lived at Lakeside Drive.

title: LATIN TERRORISTS SEIZE U.S. WOMAN
description: Five armed men kidnapped an American woman official in Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic yesterday, then took over the Venezuelan con, sulate, where they seized seven more hostages.

title: Lunch and Breakfast Cost $10 at Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)Some 800 participants in President Ford's conference paid $10 each today for a continental breakfast and luncheon of coq au vin.

title: Cyprus Talks Postponed
description: NICOSIA,Cyprus,Sept. 27 (Reuters)Talks scheduled for today between President Glafkos Clerides and the TurkishCypriote leader, Rauf Denktash, were postponed today because Mr. Denktash was still out of the country, a United Nations spokesman said Mr. Denktash was in Ankara, where he met the Turkish Premier, Bulent Ecevit, and the armed forces commander, Semih Sancar yesterday.

title: PHILIPPINES PLANS NO SUGAR FOR U.S.
description: MANILA, Sept. 27 (AP)The Philippines has decided to withhold sugar exports from the United States during the current crop year, financial sources reported today.

title: Judge Names Boston Mayor CoDefendant in School Busing Case
description: BOSTON, Sept. 27Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity named Mayor Kevin H. White today as a codefendant in the Boston school desegreetion case.

title: PROSECUTORS REST IN PONIES TRIAL
description: Federal prosecutors completed, their case yesterday at the bribery trial of Representative Bertram L. Podell of Brooklyn.

title: New Carter Trial Sought, But Prosecutor Objects
description: The New Jersey Public Defender, citing newly discovered evidence of perjury by two key prosecution witnesses, called yesterday for a new trial for Rubin (Hurricane) Carter, a former boxer, and another man who are now serving life sentences for a triple homicide.

title: LowRise, LowKey HOusing Concept Gives. Banality a Test in West Village
Davits and Pell Fly to Cuba Despite Objections of U.S.
description: HAVANA, Sept. 27Senator Jacob K. Javits and Senator Claiborne Pell flew here today on a factfinding trip more than 13 years after the United States broke diplomatic relations with Cuba.

title: Dow Plunges by 16.03 to a 12Year Low
FELICE A, CHIAPPERINI
description: Felice A. Chiapperini who retired last March as chairman of the department of hotel and restaurant management at the New York City Community College in Brooklyn, died yesterday of leukemia in St. Vincent's Hospital of Richmond, S.I. He was 41 years old and lived at 343 Fanning Street, Castleton Corners, S.I.

title: Kissinger Is Challenge on Chile Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Representative Donald M. Fra sec, a senior member of VI House Foreign Affairs Commit tee, today called for Secretary of State Kissinger to meet with a group of House members to clarify the Ford Admiriistration's position on human right; in Chile.

title: Nixon Doctor Doubts Need of Surgery
description: LONG BEACH, Calif. Sept. 27 Surgery is not needed now for former President Richard M. Nixon because the phlebitis in his left leg and the blood clot in his right lung are responding satisfactorily to anticoagulant therapy, Mr. Nixon's shier physician said here today.

title: Assemblyman Gets 6Month Jail Term. After Perjury Trial
description: Calvin Williams, a lameduck Brooklyn Assemblyman who is head of New York's biggest kypsy taxi company, was sentenced yesterday to six months in jail for perjury in a case stemming from a traffic accident four years ago.

title: Soviet Artists Leave To End a Double Life
description: MOSCOW, Sept.. 27Officially Gennady and Nina Neistadt have been moderately successful graphic artists, illustrating popularScience magazines and Communist propaganda booklets to earn their living.

title: WANDA ROEHR
description: Wanda Roehr, who in 1961 established the Wanda Roehr Foundation to assist Polish students, scholars, artists and scientists, died at the age of 72 Tuesday at her home in Hamden, Conn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Art: Cobra and Contrasts, a Detroit Salute
description: Three thousand people went to the opening of Cobra and Contrasts at the Detroit Institute of Arts last Tuesday evening. What they went for was not (as the title might suggest) an ad hot at liance between a great mu, seum and a travelieng me. nagerie. They went to say goodby to Mrs. Barnett Malbin, who is shortly leaving Detroit and coming to live in New York; and what they saw was the collection that has been formed since World War II by Mrs. Malbin, who until 1965 was Mrs. Harry L. Winston.

title: Pope, at Synod Opening,
description: ROME, Sept. 27Popp Paul VI opened the fourth Synod of Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church today With a prayer for the help of the Holy Spirit in carrying out the theme of the gathering, evangelization in the modern world.

title: Talks in Legal Aid Strike
description: Representatives of the striking Legal Aid Society lawyers and the society's management met yesterday in the office of the society's lawyer, but no progress was reporied according to management. Alsq attending the meeting, in the offices of Robert Batterman, at 300 Park Avenue, were Solomon Kreitman, a member of the State Mediation Board.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
We Are We Are You Are You Are We Are You
description: PARIS On June 27, under the round dome of the Acaddmie Frangaise, on the Left Bank of the Seine, after the traditional rattle Of :drums, the anthropologist Claude LeviStrauss took his seat as a inem6er. This company of forty importals has existed since the 17th century and,; on the death of a member, it fills.the vacancy by election.

title: Indians Plan to Drop Pilot
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 27 The Cleveland Indians announced tonight that Ken Aspromonte was being dropped as manager at the end of the season, but Frank Robinson strongly denied that anybody has said anything to me about managing this ball club.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER DIP
Britain Advances In Davis Cup Play
description: LONDON, Sept. 27 (AP)Britain gained an unbeatable 3.0 margin over Iran in the second round of the 1975 European zone Davis Cup tennis competition today when John Lloyd and Mark Farrell won. the doubles. They overwhelmed All Madani and Kambiz Derafshi Javan, 61, 61, 61.

title: U.S. Bowling in Moscow Debut
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 27  The American sport of bowling came, to Moscow today under a huge inflatable tent. Inside the tent was a 16lane bowling center built by the Brunswick Corporation of the United States.

title: Bonniers, Furnishings Pioneer Expected to Close Next Month
description: Bonniers, the shop that pioneered with sophisticated modern furnishings, here following World War II, is expected to close next month, according to reliable reports from several sources in the trade and close to the Madison Avenue store.

title: Jockey Wins 6 At Bowie
description: Racing, rarities occurred from coast to coast yesterday as Chris McCarron rode six winners at Bowie and four horses wound up in a double deadheat for win and show at Bay Meadows. McCarron, the nation's leading Race jockey, increased his victory total for the season to 349 with his spree at the Maryland track. Still riding with a fivepound apprentice allowance, he has biought home 43 winners during the first 17 days of the current meeting.

title: Proposal to Curb Arab Money Flow Denied by Simon
description: Secretary of the Treasury William E Simon denied yesterday that he had ever proposed shutting the door to the flow of Arab oil funds into the United States.

title: Delegates Deeply Divided On How to Fight Inflation
FELICE A. CHIAPPERINI
description: Felice A. Chiapperini, who retired last March as chairman of the department of hotel and restaurant management at the New York city Community College in Brooklyn, died yesterday of leukemia in St. Vincent's Hospital of Richmond, S.I. He was 41 years old and lived at 343 Fanning Street, Castleton Corners, S.I.

title: London Paper Prices Rise
description: LONDON, Sept. 27 (UPI) The Times and The Guardian announced today a 33 per cent increase in their newsstand prices effective Monday. Each will cost the equivalent of 18 cents. Three other newspapers announced increases earlier this week. All blamed rising costs.

title: MAX E. ESTERNAUX
description: Max E. Esternaux, a retired member of the staff of the Bell Telephone Laboratories, died Thursday at his home in Sun City, Ariz. He was 68 years old.

title: Harold. Sauerbrei, Officer Of Cleveland Browns, 58
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 27 (AP) Harold Sauerbrei, vice president and general manager of the Cleveland Browns of the National Football League, died today at the age of 58. He had undergone surgery last November.

title: ACTION FORESEEN
description: NEWARK, Sept. 27 (AP) Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., said today that emergency action by President, Ford might be ireded if a shortage of natural gas became critI ical this winter.

title: 2 SENATORS WARN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Two Senators expressed grave reservations today over proposals under consideration by the Atomic Energy Commission. to use plutonium as a fuel in the nation's nuclear electric power reactors.

title: Announce expansion of only bank plan in U.S. that allows both checks and top interest at same time
description: CHICAGO  Millions of Americans today consider themselves lucky to have a socalled free checking account. But what they don't realize is that many are actually letting $100, $300, even $500 or more in hard cash slip through their fingers every year. This is because, although the checks are free, their account isn't earning them one cent in interest.

title: PROSECUTORS REST IN PODELL'S TRIAL
description: Federal prosecutors completed their case yesterday at the bribery trial of Representative Bertram L. Podell of Brooklyn.

title: Charles L. Hulswit Pies; Headed Rockland Utilities
description: WEST NYACK, N. Y Sept. 27Charles L. Hulswit of 167 Parrot Road, a retired publicutilities executive,, died last night, in Good Samaritan Hospital, Suffern. He was 73 years old.

title: WANDA ROEHR
description: Wanda Roehr, who in 1961 established, the Wanda Roehr Foundation to assist Polish students, scholars, artists and scientists, died at the age of 72 Tuesday. at her home in Hamden, Conn.

title: Mrs. Ford in Hospital
description: Betty Ford, wife of the President, entered a hospital for surgery today to determine whether she is suffering from breast cancer. Details on Page 30.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ORADELL, Sept. 27Tom Hutchinson is in the business of turning boys into wrestlers. He plies his trade rather briskly at Blair Academy, Blairstown, where pounded a group of mediocre wrestlers into a team that won its first national prep tournament last March at Lehigh University. A month before that, the team won its third consecutive New Jersey Independent Schools state championship with 139 points, the highest number ever scored in the tournament.

title: New Basketball Loop Plans Tryout
description: The 10team International Basketball Association will hold two invitational training camps next month as the new league prepares for its Jan. 17, 1975, season opening. A west coast camp at California State University in Los Angeles is set for Oct. 1214, and an east coast facility planned for Chesire Academy, Chesire, Conn., Oct. 27Nov. 8.

title: Quiet Jones Boy Awaits the Giants
description: All through summer training camp, Dallas Cowboy players kept waiting for Ed (Too Tall) Jones to break out the royal wardrobe of a rich rookie. Instead, pro football's No. 1 draft choice wore the same pair.of red shorts to practice every day.

title: U.S. AMBASSADOR CENSURES CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 27Ambassador William J. Porter of the United States publicly criticized Canada this week for trade practices that appear to discriminate against the United States and warned that Washington was feeling pressure to retaliate.

title: Service for John Merriman
description: A. memorial service for John Merriman, news editor on the CBS Evening News with Walter Cronkite since 1966, will be held at noon Monday in. the Universalist Church of New York City, Central Park West at 76th Street. Mr. Merriman, 50 years old, was killed in. the crash of an ,Eastern Air Lines DC9 jet at Charlotte, N. C., on Sept. 11.

title: Mrs.Carner Goes Ahead By a Shot in Coast Golf
SOYBEANS CLIMB 20C DAILY LIMIT
description: Soybeans, which jumped20cents a bushel in futures trading again yesterday, have risen exactly $1 a bushel in terms of the November contract since a week ago Friday. The beans closed at $8.58 a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: 12Year Market Low
description: Stock prices dropped sharply yesterday in accelerated trading, sending the Dow Jones industrial average down 16.03 points to 621.95, its lowest closing level in almost 12 years, Details on Page 35.

title: Waiting and Waiting, but Not for Naught
description: Knowing that I would have to apply for Medicare: three months before reached the marvelous date of becoming 65 years old, I telephoned the Social Security office for information.

title: Beth Ferro, 49, a Writer, Producer for Radio and TV
description: Beth Hollinger Ferro, a former radio and television writer and producer, died yesterday of leu; kemia in,, Memorial Hospital. She was 49 years old and lived at 300 Central Park West.

title: Notes on People
description: Richard M. Nixon has sold world publication rights to his memoirs,. including publication in hard covers, to Warner Paperback Library, one of the most aggressive companies in the softcover book industry. It was disclosed Thursday that Warner had acquired the paperback rights.

title: LEGISLATORS HEAR
description: NEWARK, Sept. 27 (AP)A legislative hearing today on high home utility bills generated more light than heat.

description: DALLASThe Dorchester Gas Corporation of Dallas sells natural gas from the Permian Basin in west Texas to an electric utility group in Texas at $1.30 a thousand cubic feet.

description: WASHINGTON,. Sept. 27The 1972 NBCTY detumentary critical of private pension plans Pensicins: The Broken Prom ise, did not violate the Fair. ness Doctrine, the United States Court of Appeals, for the Dis. trict of Columbia ruled today.

title: Triple for Pincay
description: When Laffit Pincay sent Rube the Great between horses in the rush to the wire in the feature race at Belmont Park yesterday, the probability was that he would, not get through. Those in front of him seemed too closely bunched. But the 29yearold rider from Panama shot through the narrowest of openings., and guided his mount to a sensational success in the sixfurlong race.

title: BARNETT GRUZEN, ARCHITECT, DEAD

description: WARTBURG, Tenn., Sept. 27 (AP)Two persons were found dead today in the wreckage of a single engine airplane on a mountain near Wartburg, Sheriff Cecil Byrge of Morgan County, reported, The plane had been missing six weeks. He. identified ,the dead as Mr. and Mrs. Clarence A, King Jr., Mon mouth Junction, N.J.

description: The General Public Utilities Corporation announced yesterday it would cut $394million more out of its capital outlay budget far the years 197476.

description: TRENTON, Sept. 27 (AP)The minimum price of a quart of milk in New Jersey will be 34 cents as of Oct. 1, the State Agriculture Department said today.

description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 27A decade after the Organization of American States voted diplo matic and economic sanction against Cuba, the Government of Premier Fidel Castro appear to be gaining acceptance by the LatinAmerican community.

description: The 12th New York Film Festival opened last night at Avery Fishes Hall in a sedate atmospheie that spoke more of art than of showbiz.

title: DOROTHY STONE

description: Martin T. Geraghty asked Gerald R. Coleman for $692millidn and change yesterday, thus beginning the tortuous process of compiling New York City's capital budget for year that starts next July 1.

title: INFLATION PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 President Ford opened the national conference on inflation today with a renewed appeal for bipartisan cooperation on economic policy. But political and ideological divisions became apparent almost from the moment he finished speaking. The harmony and sense of unity that pervaded the first preliminary meeting on inflation convened by the President just three weeks ago was conspicuously absent today. Critical remarks by Democratic Congressional leaders, labor representatives and others underlined the prevalent feeling here that Mr. Ford's political honeymoon is now over.

description: Neil H. Anderson, executive vice president of the New York Board of Trade since 1962, died yesterday in Chestnut Hill, Mass. He was 57 years old and lived in Summit, N.J.

description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 27A brother.of former President Arturo Frondizi of Argentina was kidnapped and murdered today by rightwig terrorists.

title: Reds'

title: Opera: Niska as Tosca
description: Sopranos all yearn to sing Tosca, with reason. From her first imperious entrance into the church of Sant Andrea della Valle to her Evel Knievelish leap from the ramparts of the Castel Sant Angelo at the final curtain Puccini's flamboyant heroine is offered one opportunity af:: ter another to transmute brassily theatrical ideas into pure dramatic gold. Few sopranos ask more of life than that.

description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP)The Polaroid Corporation said today it expected record thirdquarter sales but a drop in pershare earnings.

description: If radio listeners had one less rock and roll music station, the walls of New York would not come tumbling down nor would the Tower of Babel fail. Of the thirtyodd AM and FM stations broadcasting to city listeners, eleven, have rocks in their music. Instead of ,one less, New Yorkers seem about to get a twelfth catering to the socalled youth market. The tragedy is that its entrance will push off the dial Station WNCNwhich, together with WNYC and WQXR, is a lonely outpost mainly devoted to classical music.

Canadian Trade Surplus Off

August exports totaled $2.84billion, 5.5 per cent higher than July's $2.74billion. Imports rose 6 per cent to $2.83billion from $2.73billion in July.

description: The shortage of natural gas in the Northeast is attributable to a large extent to the price difference between unregulated intrastate deliveries and regulated interstate deliveries. Details on Page 39.

description: DENVER, Sept. 27 (AP)Francoise Durr toppled Julie Heldman, 6.2, 63, tonight and advanced to the semifinals of a $50,000 women's professional tennis tournament.

description: You simply cannot murder a woman in a shower without reminding the spectators of Psycho  thereby making there wish that they were seeing an Alfred Hitchcock movie. The shower rerun is only one of the problems in Ken Hughes's The Internecine Project, which opened yesterday at neigh borhood theaters.

description: Following is a transcript of President Ford's statement opening the conference on inflation in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times:

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)  Federal District Judge Barrington Parker turned down today requests for a new trial or dismissal of the perjury conviction against Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) Justice William J. Brennan Jr. of the Supreme Court refused today to reinstate Charles D. Ravenel as the Democratic candidate for Governor of South Carolina pending a review by the full Court of his disqualification.

title: U.S. Frees Chilean Wrongly Held Here; He Accuses Agents
description: Conceding that it had jailed the wrong man for five months, the Federal Government yesterday freed a Chilean who said he had been forcibly abducted and brought here by United States agents or at their direttion.

description: Racing, rarities occurred from coast to coast yesterday as Chris McCarron rode six winners at Bowie and four horses wound up in a double deadheat for win and show at Bay Meadows. McCarron, the nation's leading jockey, increased his victory total for the season to 349 with his spree at the Maryland track. Still riding with a fivepound apprentice allowance, he has biought home 43 winners during the first 17 days of the current meeting.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) Despite the Watergate scandals, various national committees of the Republican party have $3.2million in cash available for this year's Congressional elections, double the $1.6million held by Democrats.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Spokesmen for labor, business and Congress called on the American people today to practice energy conservation, even if it means some personal discomfort.

title: The Price of Oil
description: President Ford's yarning that the enormous increase in oil prices imposed by the oil cartel can only distort the world economy, run the risk of worldwide depression and threaten the breakdown of world order and safety has drawn a measured response from the President of Venezuela, Carlos Andres.Perez. His arguments in support of the policies of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries deserve factual, reply.

title: Complex New Rent Guidelines Issued; Many Tenants May Get No Increases
description: In an action affecting 400,000 apartments, the city's Rent Guidelines Board approved yesterday a tenantoriented change in disputed rent ceilings that is So intricate that it confused landlord and tenant spokesmen.

It is already in use at more than a dozen major utility generating plants here and abroad.

description: PARIS, Sept. 27 Nearlythree weeks ago central bank ??vernors of the 10 leading Western industrial nations an pounced that means are available and will be used, if and when necessary to provide temporary liquidity for banks the Europe Euromarkets.

description: Despite the haste, with which President Ford scotched the idea, the proposed separation of the two key Government posts now combined in the person of Henry Kissinger would actually strengthen the formulation and operation of this country's foreign policy.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept 27Deep and seemingly unbridgeable differences on how to curb inflation and meet other problems of the economy emerged today at in economic summit meeting called by President Ford.

title: Armed Men Block Lisbon Roads As. Big Rally for Spinola Nears
description: LISBON, Saturday, Sept 28 (AP)Thousands of armed civilians blocked highways into the Portuguese capital today and began unauthorized searches of cars and their occupants. The Government warned that the searches were illegal and that bloodshed could follow unless they ended.

title: 12Year Market Low
description: Stock prices dropped sharply yesterday in accelerated trading, sending the Dow Jones industrial average down 16.03 points to 621.95, its lowest closing level in almost 12 years. Details on Page 35.

I think they should be closelyheld and I assure you that they will be most judiciously handled as far as I am concerned.

description: American, Eastern and Trans World Airlines asked the Civil Aeronautics Board yesterday for approval to raise their domestic fares by 4 per cent on Nov.1.

description: CHICAGO, Sept, 27Local machinery for receiving Vietnam deserters and draft evaders and providing alternativeservice jobs for them, was in place in most states today, but So far only a handful of returnees had reported to state Selective Service officers to accept these jobs.

description: Authoritie in Kingston, N. Y., arrested a New York City man for alleged possession of $10,000 worth of heroin and cocaine after a raid at a motel there. The suspect was identified as Robert L. Hines, 25 years old of 1025 Leggett Avenue, the Bronx.

description: From the shadows and understanding of his distinguished anonymity, Al Oliver of the Pittsburgh Pirates hopes that the New York Yankees also qualify for the World Series this year.

description: WASHINGTON,Sept.,27Consumer representatives coinplained today that their inter. ests were largely, unrepreSented at the Government's conference on inflation.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)The first female military deserter from the Vietnam era has been accepted into President Ford's earned reentry amnesty program, the Pentagon said today.

title: EARNINGS OF AVCO DROP IN QUARTER
description: The Avco Corporation reported a sharp drop in thirdquarter earnings and a decision to skip the fourthquarter dividend on its preferred stock It has not paid a dividend on the common since May, 1970.

title: E.E.C. Seeks to Observe 12Country Oil Agency
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 27The Executive Commission of the European Common Market is seeking observer status at the 12nation oil consumer agency expected to be established soon within the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, the European Commissioner for Energy said today.

title: I Am Not Guilty, Satkin
description: PATERSON, Sept. 27  The Passaic landlord charged with murdering a woman and three children in a fire last year angrily shouted his innocence today at his trial and charged the prosecution with letting the real murderers go free.

title: MRS. FORD FACES A BREAST BIOPSY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Mrs. Betty Ford, wife of the President, entered Bethesda Naval Hospital late this afternoon for surgery tomorrow to determine whether a nodule in her right breast is benign or malignant.

U.S. Bowling in Moscow Debut

title: Israeli Art by a Man Who Has Seen War
description: Too much history, too soon, Can be bad for art. The idiom may not be right, the raw meat can defy digestion, the Public may be too impatient to have its wishes, its frustrations, its immediate memories put on the wall.

title: Memphis Concern Files. Lawsuit Against Xerox.

title: PENTAGON SILENT;ON WEAPONS COSTS

title: 2 Earthquakes in Japan
description: TOKYO, Sept, 27 (AP)Two earthquakes of moderate intensity occurred in central and northern Japan today; but no damage or casualties were re ported. Buildings in Tokyo were shaken for more than a minute and trains were stopPed as a precautionary measure.

title: Condominium Trend Cuts Rental Market
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Kathleen M. Jackson, a retired college professor who had lived in a quiet old building on Connecticut Avenue for 14 years, got the option several months ago of buying her apartment or moving out.

title: Driver Injured in Car Blast
description: PUTNAM VALLEY, N. Y. Sept. 27 (AP)  A Bronx man was burned on his arms and face today when cannisters of ether he had in his car exploded, setting the car afire on the Taconic State Parkway. According to the state police, the driver, Walter Reinbachs, 51 years old, was taken to Peekskill Community Hospital, where he was reported ,to be in fair condition.

She. was 84 years old and lived At 29 East 64th Street.

title: FORD AND SCOTT TIED TO G.S.A. JOB REPORT
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 27 (AP)The St. Louis PostDispatch says it has obtained a secret report showing that the General Services Administration improperly gave job preferences to persons referred by powerful political figures, including then Representative Gerald R. Ford and Senator Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania, the Senate minority leader.

title: STATE WILL ADD MILK AUDITORS
description: The State Department of Agrictilture and Markets announcedf yesterday that it would hire more auditors and tighten its auditing procedures at milk processing plants throughout the state because of the milk adulteration practices carried on by Dairylea at at least six of its facilities between 1967 and 1973.

title: 3 Rob Bank in Reno; Tie Up 9 Employes And Get $1Million
description: RENQ, Sept. 27 (AP)Three armed ten wearing Halloween masks and coveralls handcuffed and tied nine bank employes tonight and fled with more than $1million in cash from the main branch of First National Bank of Nevada, the police reported.

title: Frederick Ayer 3d Weds Miss LatIourel
description: Claire Labourel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andre Labourel of Paris, and Frederick Ayer 3d, son of Mrs. R. Draper Richards of Frederiksted, St. Croix, V. I., and Frederick Ayer 2d of Seattle, were married yesterday afternoon. The ceremony, at the Roman Catholic Church of SaintGermainl'Auxerroi's in Paris, was performed by Canon Eugene Ronce in the presence of an Episcopal clergyman, Canon Thomas Wile.

title: Contract Awards
description: Agreement was reached yesterday on final contract terms with the Occidental Petroleum Corporation to build the $50million Greater Bridgeport, Conn. recovery systems to reprocess refuse as fuel. Under the terms of the contract the petroleum corporation and its subsidiary, Garrett Research and Development Company, Inc., will design and build the system, operating it at a fixed price for 20 years.

title: Power Out 90 Minuteson S.I.
description: Almost 14,000 Consolidated Edison customers in Staten Island were left without power last night for about 90 minutes by feedercable trouble of undetermined origin. The power went off at 8:04 P.M. in the I!Port Richmond, West New Brighton and Mariners Harbor sections, darkening street lights, according to the utility, and was restored at 9:35 P.M.

title: OMEGA IS SEEKING REORGANIZATION
description: James J. Ling, the highrolling Texas financier who suffered collapse of his LTV financial empire in mid1970only to gain his balance and start new ascentevidently has fall en again.

title: Board Gives Example Of New Rent Ruling
description: The Rent Guidelines Board gave the following example of how the new rules worked:

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MANILA, Sept 27 (AP)David Rigert of the Soviet Union set two world records and swept all three gold medals today in the middleheavyweight class at the 28th world weight lifting championships. Rigert's combined snatch and jerk total of 854 pounds broke the mark 841 set this year by Andon Nikolov of Bulgaria. In the jerk, Rigert lifted 373 pounds to snap his record 469 set in 1973. Earlier, he won the snatch competition with a lift of 380 pounds.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 686
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 27 (AP)The Soviet Union announced today the launching of the earth satellite Cosmos 686. The press agency, Tass, said the new craft, launched yesterday, would continue exploration of outer space.

title: Team Canada Rally Routs Finland, 83
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 27 (AP)  Team Canada bunched four goals in the final 12 minutes, two of them by Frank Mahovlicb,, to defeat Finland's national hockey team, 8.3, tonight in an exhibition game.

title: A's Clinch Division Title For 4th Straight Season
description: OAKLAND, Sept. 27 (AP)Sal Bando, Oakland third baseman, threw out the Chicago White Sox Ken Henderson on a routine play in the third inning tonight and As fans rose for a standing ovation.

title: Teaching Hospital In Newark Is Given Approval by State
description: TRENTON, Sept. 27  The State Health Planning Council today approved construction of the $76.5million Martland Hospital in Newark, the largest medical facility in New Jersey and one surrounded by controversy since its inception in 1966

title: Mother Anxiously Awaits Word on Kidnapped Son
description: RUTHERFORD, Sept. 27 I just hope he calls soon and lets me know that Georgie is all right, Mrs. Natalie Kaloyerakis said today as the Federal Bureau of Investigation intensified its search for her missing son, who was kidnapped four days ago.

title: Nets Conquer Pistons, 9780
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Sept. 27Ray Scott, the towering coach of the Detroit Pistons and last year's National Basketball Association coach of the year, saw his team's perfect record against American Basketball Association toes dented tonight by the New York Nets, 9780, before a slim crowd of 6,031 at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Frondizi's Brother Slain in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 27A brother of former President Arturo Frondizi of Argentina was kidnapped and murdered today by rightwing terrorists.

title: BERTHA H. BERKMAN
description: Bertha Holtzmann Berkman, a former community worker in Brooklyn, an incorporator of the Progressive party and a friend of President Theodore Roosevelt who headed the party's Bull Moose ticket in 1912, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital. She was 84 years old and lived at 29 East 64th Street.

title: MEDICAL EXPERTS DEBATE DRUG LAG
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Experts disagreed sharply today on the questions of whether the United States was suffering from a medically importent drug lag and what the term really meant.

title: Grove Is Dedicated to Johnson
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27President Ford paid a moving tribute today to his onetime friendly adversary, the late President Lyndon B. Johnson, at groundbreaking ceremonies for the L.B.J. Memorial Grove on the banks of the Potomac.

title: Mary S. Jochen Wed To Peter S. Oberdorf
description: Mary Sarah Jochen, an administrative assistant at the Rockefeller Center branch of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, and Peter Scott Oberdort, vice president and senior legal officer of the Manufacturers Hanover Commercial Corporation, of New York, were married yesterday evening. The Rev. Donald Cutler performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of St. Joseph of Arimathea in Elmsford, N.Y.

title: Manson Security Tightened
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept. 27 (AP)  Charles Manson, the convicted mass murderer, has been placed under tight security restrictions again after he tried to smuggle a letter to an unidentified girl friend out of prison, state officials say. A prison spokesman said that Mr. Manson, who had been allowed greater freedom of movement and contact with other inmates earlier last week, would be moved back to his former cell.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders

description: Knowing that I would have to apply for Medicare: three months before reached the marvelous date of becoming 65 years old, I telephoned the Social Security office for information.

description: Dr. Stephen Enke, economist, and demographer with General Electric's Center for Advanced Studies, called TEMPO, and Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for economics in 196566, died last Saturday in Palo Alto, Calif., apparently of a heart attack. His age was 58.

title: Payments Deficit Showed a Widening In Japan in August
description: TOKYO, Sept 27 (AP) Japan's overall balanceofpayments deficit widened to $513million in August from $210 million in July, but it was less than a year ago, the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: LowRise, LOwKeyHousing Concept Gives Banality a Test in West Village
description: For many years now, the controversial architects Robert Venturi and Denise Scott Brown have been saying that ugly and ordinary buildings would best fulfill human needs in the city, not towering, heroic statements of modernism. Sources for modest buildings and images with social purposes will come... from the everyday city around us of modest buildings and modest spaces, they wrote in 1972.

title: PRESIDENT RETURNS APPEAL BY COLSON
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI) President Ford has returned Charles W. Colson's request for clemency to Mr. Golson's lawyers, with the advice that all such Watergate clemency requests should be submitted directli to the Department of Justice.

title: Sawhill Foresees Plants in U.S. Producing Solar Energy by 1985
description: DETROIT, Sept. 27 (UFOJohn C. Sawhill, administrator of the Federal Energy Office, said today that the United States hoped to put several solar energy plants into operation by 1985

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MAN BEHIND THE SCREEN The Wizard of Oz appears often, enough on television, and is by now an institution. Today, you and any children you know will have a chance to see it on the big screen, which means that you'll be able to see the movie for what it was in 1939  a spectacle of special effects, sumptuous color, hurtling pace (uninterrupted by commercials) and, in general, a joy.

title: Conn. in Boxing League
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI) The World Team Boxing League announced today that a Massachusetts automobile dealer had purchased the league's Connecticut franchise and would probably operate it near Hartford.

title: Pan Am Airways Has Sold a Route To Western Airlines
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 27 (AP) Pan American World Airways has sold its PortlandSeattleFairbanks, Alaska, route and related equipment to Western Airlines for $6.65million, the two carriers announced today.

Corporation that it had entered into a contract toacquire the 53 per cent stock interest of the Talcott National Corporation from Fasco, Inc., one of Mr. Sindona's holding companies.

title: Condominium Trend Cuts Rental Market
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Kathleen M. Jackson, a retired college profeisor who had lived in a quiet old building on Connecticut Avenue for 14 years, got the option several months ago of buying her apartment or moving out.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept 27 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission implemented rules today to cover short sales of stocks.

description: Barbara Jo Allen, the comedienne who adopted the nam,,. of Vera Vague on the Bob Hope and other radio and television shows in the nineteenforties and early fifties, died Sept. 14 in Santa Barbara, Calif.

title: Banks Join Arab Venture
description: LONDON, Sept. 27 (Reuters) Three more nonArab banks have joined the board of the European Arab Bank, the Midland Bank announced today. They are Credit Suisse, the Fuji Bank and the Industrial Bank of Japan. This raises the number of nonArab shareholders to 10. There are 16 Arab shareholders from 12 Arab countries.

title: Cook, Former S.E.C. Chief, Cited in Bar Complaint
description: LINCOLN, Neb Sept 27A committee of the Nebraska State Bar Association filed a sixcount disciplinary complaint today with the State Su preme Court againSt a former United States Securities and Exchange Commission chairman, G, Bradford Cook.

description: The Goldfield Corporation, Melbourne, Fla., announced yesterday that it had settled all outstanding claims against the General Host Corporation and other defendants in litigation begun in 1970.

title: Statewide Bilingual Ballot Suit To Bin Heard Monday in Buffalo
Labor Leader Assails U.S. On Its Oil Industry Policy
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 27 (AP)A state leader of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of InduStrial Organizations charged today that, a sweetheart relationship between the oil industry and the Federal Energy Administration dominated energy policies.

title: People in Sports
description: The American Basketball Association's Spirits of St. Louis have signed Don Chaney of the Boston Celtics of the National Basketball Association and Maurice Lucas of Marquette Univercity. Chaney, under suspension by the Celtics for failure to report to training camp, is to play out his option this season with Bolton, then join the Spirits for 197576.

title: Clark and Con Edison Clash on Nuclear Peril
description: BUCHANAN, N. Y., Sept. 27 Ramsey Clark, the Democratic candidate for the United States Senate, clashed with officials of the Consolidated Edison Company today over the power. Mr. Clark, who toured Con Edison's Indian Point plant with aides and some local environmentalists, called for an immediate moratorium on construction of such plants throughout the country.

title: Books of The Times
description: Conferences. Symposiums. Conventions. Hotel corridors achatter with people wearing plastic lapel badges. Plenary sessions in the grand ballroom after breakfast and discussion seminars in the afternoon. Distinguished names offering, for a fee, distinguished thoughtspeople like Kenneth B. Clark; Glum newspaper reporters shuffling through mimeographed speech texts the press room and hoping that the beer in the refrigerator will get coldpeople like me.

title: Antiques: Tiny Carvings
description: Today Japanese collectors practically ignore netsuke, preferring to amass other period wares such as swords, lacquers and porcelains. Their ancestors, however, thought well enough of these tiny toggles to preserve the thousands that Americans and Europeans now acquire with such passion.

title: SAVING OF ENERGY URGED ON PUBLIC
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Spokesmen for labor; business and Congress called on the American people today to practice energy conservation, even if it means some personal discomfort.

title: Reuss Ciets Out of Late Janis in 2to1 Victory,
description: Ann Reuss wasn't at Shea Stadium last night, but Jerry Reuss was and that's why Pittsburgh was still tied with St. Louis for first place in the National League's Eastern Division with live games to play.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Some sections of the New Jersey Turnpike will be closed on one or more Sunday mornings this fall to allow completion of the widening of the Passaic River Bridge; the New Jersey Turnpike Authority said. The southbound easterly alignment will be closed from 6 A.M. until noon on Oct. 20. Southbound motorists must use the westerly or meadowland route towards Interchange 16W. Interchange 17 will be closed, an authority spokesman said.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)  The Treasury announced today that it was removing the duties that have been assessed for more than two years against Canadian wood pulp used in fine stationery and toilet tissue. It said the action was based on a finding that revocation of the duty would not harm any United States industry.

title: Quiet Jones Boy Awaits the Giants
description: All through summer training camp, Dallas Cowboy players kept waiting for Ed (Too Tall) Jones to break out the royal wardrobe of a rich rookie. Instead, pro football's No. 1 draft choice wore the same pair of red shorts to practice every day.

title: Ford's Role Challenged
description: MOBILE, Ala., Sept. 27 (UPI) John Watts, chairman of the Alabama Whig party, filed suit in Federal District Court today. charging that President Ford holds the Presidency illegally. You can't have a President without having an election, said Mr. Watts, who has qualified Gov. George C. Wallace to run on his party's ticket for the Presidency.

title: The Women in TV: A Changing Image, A Growing Impact
description: Women voices are ringing with greater and greater authority these clays. Nowhere is the sound more noticeable than in television news broad:. casting, long the land of the baritone. Broadcasting executives, first in radio,: then in television, have traditionally held that feminine voices lacked the timbre to transmit weighty events and that this made women less creditable than men as reporters. True, such pioneers as Pauline Frederick, Marlene: Sanders and Barbara Walters did make it to the microphones and the cameras but they are among the rare exceptions.

title: CLUES ARE SOUGHT IN DOUBLE KILLING
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Sept. 27 (AP)The police today were seeking a motive and a suspect in the murder of Irving Pasternak, a 71yearold lawyer, and his wife Rhoda, 66, who were slashed to death by an intruder in their home in a welltodo neighborhood here Tursday night.

title: Sentencing Postponed For Slayer of Brownie
description: HACKENSACK, N. J. (AP)  The sentencing of Joseph McGowan who admitted to raping and killing a 7yearold Brownie scout was Postponed today until Oct 17 after his lawyer moved to retract his guilty plea and replace it with a plea of not guilty on the ground of insanity.

title: F.T.C. Is Opposing I.B.M.Comsat Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (Reuters)The Federal Trade Commission said today that its opposed a joint venture by the International Business Machines Corporation and the Communications Satellite Corporation and asked the Federal Communications Commission to deny or delay the application of the companies.

description: Perry B. Duryea, Speaker of the State Assembly and a longtime advocate of measures calculated to curb child abuse, announced yesterd,ay the establishment of a Family Life Development Center in Ithaca, N. Y., to conduct research on children.

title: ANGOLA IS PROMISED PROVISIONAL REGIME
description: LISBON, Sept. 27 (UPI) President Antonio de Spinola said today that a provisional government representing all political opinions would be set up in the.African territory of Angola as soon as there was a ceasefire there.

description: A 25yearold police officer was indicted yesterday and charged with criminally negligent homicide in the shooting death. of another man in a Bronx bar.

title: Assemblyman Gets 6Month Jail T erm Af ter Perjury Trial
description: Calvin Williams, a lameduck Brooklyn Assemblyman who is head of New York's biggest gypsy taxi company, was, sentenced yesterday to six months in jail for perjury in a case stemming from a traffic accident four years ago.
